title: Data Engineer
description:
Who You'll Work With


     You’ll be based in our office in Budapest as part of GCI Analytics team.
    


      GCI is the analytical backbone of McKinsey’s Commercial Banking and Payments practice that provides deep analytics, research, and benchmarking to financial institutions. By applying machine learning and sophisticated algorithms to the largest and premier commercial banking dataset in the market, our analytics engines help financial institutions uncover revenue opportunities, assist with product strategy, and compare bank performance against peers and more.
    






What You'll Do


     You will join our growing team as data engineer to build, maintain, and automate data pipelines on the cloud.
    


      In this role you will partner with our clients, industry experts and software engineers to understand data needs, investigate data discrepancies and discuss findings with product and leadership teams as well as deploy inclusive data quality checks.
    


      You benefit from working with the largest and premier banking dataset – terabytes of transaction-level data from hundreds of financial institutions to discover nuanced and highly accurate insights for your clients. Moreover, get unique experience of agile analytics lab – being very close to multi-dimensional data and at the same time having E2E exposure to the entire platform. You will explore entrepreneurial opportunities and innovative solutions for constantly evolving asset and by doing so evolve into a technical leader who builds cutting-edge solutions with a supportive career progression plan and freedom to innovate.
    





Qualifications



Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in management information systems, computer science, business analytics or another related field
 Strong understanding of data engineering concepts and ability to build ETL pipelines
 1+ years of SQL experience
 Understanding of a program language like Python or UNIX
 Understanding of cloud technologies like AWS
 Understanding of data visualization and building dashboards
 Motivated self-starter with entrepreneurial spirit
 Strong written and verbal communication skills
 Experience with more than one coding language / data visualization / cloud technologies is a plus

title: Data Engineer
description:
This role could be located in Sydney, Melbourne, Canberra, Brisbane or Adelaide.


 About Capgemini

 
Capgemini is a diverse collective of more than 350,000 strategic and technological experts based across more than 50 countries, partnering with world-renowned clients to transform and manage their businesses. We are dedicated to leveraging cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering, and platforms to address the entire breadth of their business needs. This passion drives a powerful commitment - to unlock the true value of technology.


 Over the last 18 months, we have tripled our business in Australia and New Zealand, with over 3,500 team members devoted to helping clients get the future they want. Now is the time to join our rapidly growing team who are at the forefront of finding new ways technology can help us reimagine what's possible, collecting unique career experiences with global brands and game-changing tech projects.


 Let's talk about the team:

 
Capgemini Financial Services is a Global Strategic Business Unit that provides information technology and consultancy services to the Banking, Capital Markets and Insurance industries. Capgemini FS brings you leading insights & deep industry experience to drive the future of Financial Services. Our customers count on us for the very latest in innovative service offerings & next generation global delivery.


 Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:

 

Work with project teams, technology stakeholders and vendors ensuring that the design, development and implementation of application programs and services are performed within project milestones
Development, testing and implementation phases ensuring that all deliverables meet the set expectations
Infrastructure setup, requirement analysis, system design and configuration, deployment and Production Support
writing and maintaining program code to meet system requirements, system designs and technical specifications in accordance with quality accredited standards
writing, updating and maintaining technical program, end user documentation and operational procedures
providing advice, guidance and expertise in developing proposals and strategies for software design activities such as financial evaluation and costings for recommending software purchases and upgrades
Engage with multiple internal technology teams including infrastructure, middleware, network/system admin, enterprise security to design and develop solutions
Understand business requirements and implement technical solutions in an efficient way
Analyze data, debug technical issues and provide remediation
Provide input for the creation of technology related project documents including functional and detailed design documents ensuring that the design meets the requirement and provides technical details to other development teams
Provide required application support during system failures
Ensure adherence to data management/data governance regulations and policies



 Let's talk about your capability and experience:



Strong knowledge of Banking
Should have experience in the areas of Technology solution/product implementation
Should have good communication skills.
Excellent SQL and ETL skills.
To have exposure to either a product development or a product implementation life cycle, is desirable
Experience with business analysis methodologies and applicable IT architectures;
Hands-on experience on Interpreting data, analyze results and provide ongoing reports; Ability to analyze large datasets
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy



 Let's talk about what's in it for you!

 
We believe technology is about more than business transformation - it's also about building a more sustainable, inclusive future. This starts with our people, working with you to get the future you want. We invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work, contributing to our inclusive culture and a safe place for our people to be themselves and truly belong. Through championing our staff-led community groups, we are committed to being active allies for everyone. We also aim to build an environment where you can thrive at work and at home. We champion remote working and are in the process of making ‘truly flexible' working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people. In addition, we strive to ensure your growth and learning experience is unique with access to leading learning platforms, external certifications, and opportunities to grow and learn the way you want. Finally, we offer opportunities to use your skills to help society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution, and we're ruthlessly focused on sustainability for our clients and our business - committing to becoming a net zero business by 2030.


 Don't meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people from diverse minority backgrounds are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single requirement. At Capgemini, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly, we encourage you to apply and tell us what you can bring to the role.


 Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory, and regulatory requirements.


 #GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.


 #LI-SB1
 #LI-Hybrid
 #LI-Mid-Senior Level

title: LEAD SYSTEMS ENGINEER (IT SYSTEMS SECURITY)
description:
Company QatarEnergy
 Department INFRASTRUCTURE SECURITY
 INFORMATION & COMMUNICATION TECHNOLOGY
 Primary purpose of job QatarEnergy is looking to recruit Lead Systems Engineer (Systems Security) that will join a team responsible for overall
 protection, confidentiality, integrity and availability of the ICT systems that supports QatarEnergy’s business operations.
 The lead will be accountable for the overall systems security controls design and implementation for the systems
 information security domains and ensure robust systems security controls architectures based on current International
 security best practices and industry frameworks in line with ICT KPIs and CSFs. In addition, the new member will be
 responsible to support and maintain the day-to-day operations and system change lifecycle of QatarEnergy’s critical
 security devices, tools & services and shall provide senior technical support for all perimeter security devices whilst
 providing leadership & mentoring to the team members.
 The role will be an enabler to the company’s success through development and implementation of security practices that
 create a secure working environment
 Experience & Skills • 10+ years of progressive combined technical experience in systems security solutions, including experience with security
 principles, and defense-in-depth techniques, related standards, and protocols with a minimum of 7+ years professional
 hands-on experience in design and support of complex systems security infrastructure preferably in the Oil and Gas
 industry.

Expert level of technical hands-on experience in implementation and operation of systems related but not limited to

 following systems security technologies.

Ability to identify, implement, create, and operate endpoint security controls, standards, processes, and procedures and

 ensuring that they are compliant with QP’s security policies and internationally recognized security frameworks and
 standards.

Effective decision making in terms of potential financial and operational consequences and to improve business efficiency


Manage and support systems security solutions and provide technical problem support, resolution, and communication

 when appropriate.

Excelling communication skills to effectively communicate with ICT internal, QP business users, QP subsidiaries and joint

 venture companies, government organizations, third parties, etc. on all matters related to systems security.





Ability to collect, analyze technical logs and report relevant discovery, provide technical conclusions and suitable

 recommendations towards resolution of reported incidents based on analyzed technical data in a timely manner.

High leadership skills and effective resource management


Manage and support conventional signature-based protection and applications whitelisting solutions for endpoint security.


Manage and support endpoint security protection systems: Antivirus, host-based firewall/IPS and device controls.


Manage and support Data Labeling and DLP solutions.


Manage and support password management solutions.


Manage and support endpoint cryptography and data encryption & HSM solutions.


Manage and support Microsoft Public Key Infrastructure solution.


Develop, review, and maintain technical documentation and versioning of implemented security systems.


Research and investigate latest vulnerabilities alerts (CVEs) and implement countermeasures.


Implement security measures to mitigate newly identified risks and recommend security controls changes or

 improvements as needed.

Analyze requests and incidents from QP staff and provide solution based on the QP Cyber Information Security

 Framework

Effective problem solver with strong analytic skills.


Ability to interpret, adapt and apply guidelines and procedures.


Has presentation skills that will gain acceptance of proposed solution from impacted stakeholders.


Can easily deal with complex technical, organizational and process problems related to projects


Attains solid project management skills that will lead to serving security requirements and obtain information about

 solutions and successful delivery.

Strong troubleshooting skills in network, software configuration, log interpretation, etc.

 Education • A minimum of a Bachelor degree in Network Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, or an
 equivalent Engineering field.

Relevant information security certification is a plus (such as Security+, CISSP, or CCIE)


Solid understanding of application transport and infrastructure protocols (SSL/TLS, DNS, DHCP, WINS, NTP, FTP, HTTP,

 SMTP, CIFS, LDAP, and Microsoft AD, and ability to support these applications/protocols when accessed through systems
 security appliances.

Certified specialist in systems security related systems such as: Endpoint security protection, application whitelisting, DLP,

 PKI, host-based firewalls, least privilege & password management solutions.

Knowledge of operating systems, applications and databases security principles.


Excellent writing skills with the ability to write technical blueprints, high- and low-level design documents, standards,

 processes, procedures, manuals, feasibility studies, and tendering proposals.

Excellent back MS office applications (MS Office Suite, MS Project, Visio) skills.

title: Data engineer
description:
Description du poste





CROSS est une société de conseil et de services en systèmes d’information, forte d’une expérience de 34 ans. Notre société créée des systèmes technologiques qui sécurisent et
   


    optimisent les processus ainsi que les données des organisations.
  


 Depuis ses agences de Morges et de Genève, les 250 employés de 
   CROSS
 adressent une large clientèle grâce à une expertise confirmée associée à un engagement et à un dynamisme reconnu. 
   CROSS
 fait partie du groupe 
   MICROPOLE, acteur international de Services du Numérique, présent en Europe et en Asie.
  


 Cross recherche un 
   Data engineer, qui sera dédié au projet de l’un de nos clients bancaires dans l’équipe Data Office.
   


    Vous participerez quotidiennement et activement aux développements des différents projets du Data Office.
  

 Profil


 Expérience du développement avec les principes DevOps (gestion de version, CI/CD) 
 Expérience de programmation en Python ou autre langage script (R, ...) 
 Expérience dans la construction de dashboards BI (Tableau, PowerBI par exemple) 
 Connaissances techniques au niveau des architectures des logiciels bancaires et de trading (langage FIX) est un plus 
 5 ans d’expérience en langage SQL (de préférence T-SQL), en gestion de base de données et outils ETL 



 Profil :




 Très bon esprit d’analyse et de synthèse 
 Intérêt pour le travail en équipe 
 Parfaite maîtrise du français et de l'anglais (oral et écrit) 
 Rigoureux et proactif 
 Excellent sens de la communication 
 Autonome et curieux 
 Master ou équivalent 
 Français et Anglais Intermediaire


 Informations contractuelles
 Vos qualités personnelles feront la différence : éthique professionnelle rigoureuse, autonomie tout en ayant un esprit d’équipe, capacités d’analyse et de synthèse, écoute, créativité, sens du service, sens de la relation client, diplomatie, engagement...
 Chez CROSS, tout autant que votre CV et l’expérience que vous saurez mettre en avant, nous serons séduits par votre personnalité, la place que vous accordez aux relations humaines dans le travail et votre désir d’implication au sein de l’entreprise.
 Pour résumer, vous l’aurez compris, si vos compétences, votre désir de grandir à nos côtés et votre personnalité correspondent à notre projet d’entreprise, alors il y a de grandes chances que nous fassions route ensemble ! Donc, n’hésitez pas, venez nous rejoindre.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
Trolley is the payouts platform for the internet economy. Our vision is to unlock the collective economic opportunity of the internet – for everyone – by building a truly global payouts ecosystem. Through our powerful platform and API, Trolley enables businesses to reach workers from all corners of the world and offers creators, on-demand workers, and suppliers the ability to bring their specialized talents to a global market. Businesses use Trolley to automate and manage payouts, collect recipient tax and banking information, and mitigate fraud and risk. The payouts solution of choice for hundreds of businesses, Trolley has made payouts to over 1.1 million different musicians, artists, makers, vendors, and suppliers around the world.
 


 Trolley is seeking a self-driven, analytical individual to join our team as an Analytics Engineer. Reporting to the VP of Product, this role manages the end-to-end data pipeline. You will empower data-informed decisions for the Trolley team and our customers. The ideal candidate will have experience with the toolset required (ELT, Warehousing, BI, etc) and have driven healthy data cultures across organizations.
 
 In your role you will:

 Extract and load through any means possible. API, CSV, screen scrapers, and more, we deal with it all.
 Transform and document data for the consumption of others across the team.
 Scale the Data Pipeline to manage costs, speed, and security trade-offs.
 Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to design and develop data flows or dashboards, enabling business operations and reporting.
 Own and manage the roadmap for the Data Team (both internal and external facing functionality).
 Collaboration with the Engineering team for best practices around technical management of the Data pipeline, and our platform database.
 Mature business-wide analysis acumen and enablement.
 Perform ROI Analysis on Trolley’s company initiatives.
 Complete other duties and responsibilities as defined by the management team.

 About you: 

Experience with end-to-end management of data pipelines.
 Excellent communication of data-related topics.
 Strong SQL skills.
 Experience writing API clients.
 Experience managing cloud infrastructure.
 Git expert.
 Experience using techniques that enable team code ownership (test-driven development, literate code, separation of concerns).

 It would be great if you are familiar with:

 Snowflake, where our Data Lake and Data Warehouse are stored dbt, for managing transformations (including documenting and testing) of our data pipeline.
 Tableau, our Business Intelligence tool.
 Terraform, for managing our infrastructure.
 Performance logging and monitoring.
 AWS Cloud Services (i.e. Lambda and Glue), for writing functions to extract data from.

 Interested? We offer:

 Competitive salary and meaningful equity.
 Join an amazing team of diverse people working together on a common mission.
 Extended Healthcare benefits including dental, vision, LTD, etc.
 4 weeks paid vacation per year + public holidays.
 Pension Plan.
 Gym Membership allowance.
 1/2 day Fridays during summer.
 Central modern office, close to public transport.
 Choice of the tools you need to do your best.

title: Software Engineer for Data Platform (f/m/x)
description:
You have a passion for developing software and are looking for a new challenge. We in RBI Group IT GmbH share an engineering mindset and the motivation of a startup. Additionally, we can provide the stability and benefits of the network within Raiffeisen Bank International Group. To provide the best possible IT services for our clients we are looking for the strengthening of our platform team. 
   
Software Engineer for Data Platform (f/m/x) 

    As a Software Engineer for Data Platform, you are responsible for the platform that supports all Feature Teams with tools, environments, patterns to build and run our data ecosystem. 
    
 By exploring and implementing patterns and solutions you drive the evolution of our data platform and meet the demands and requirements of Site Reliability, Security and Architecture. 
    

What you can expect 

Enhance and improve the tool set that supports feature teams in all phases of the software development lifecycle. (eg Test automation, CI/CD-Pipeline, Quality-Checks, Job-Control) 
Evolve data pipelines, ETL-framework, data-interfaces and design patterns hand in hand with lead developers 
Frequent interaction with Site Reliability Engineering Team to provide Self-Service environments and tools for monitoring 
Address demands and issues to be compliant with IT Security standards 
Contribute in technical Proof-of-concepts, prototypes, spikes and evaluation of open source software 

What you bring to the table: 

Engineering mindset 
Professional experience in Python, Bash, Linux, PostgreSQL, Java, Virtual machines 
Basic knowledge in Data Models, DWH, TDD, Agile Methodology (Scrum) 
Optionally experience with ETL-Tools (Pentaho Data Integrator or similar) and BI-Tools (Qlik, PowerBI) 
Optionally experience/know how in Eclipse Technologies 
Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science/Software Engineering (or similar) 
Fluent knowledge of English; German is appreciated, but not mandatory 

Our offer: 

You’ll work in an international team at a leading bank 
You’ll benefit from flexible working arrangements and determine your own work-life balance 
State of the art training, and further education 
Wide range of additional operating benefits (e.g. subsidized canteen) 
From EUR 42,000.00 annual gross excluding overtime – depending on experience and qualifications, an appropriate overpayment is provided 





We are looking forward to receiving your online application! 

https://jobs.rbinternational.com

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Overview: 
  IDC is seeking Data Analytics Engineer who will join our Data Engineering and Analysis team based in Prague, Czech Republic. In this role you will leverage the most modern cloud solutions to collect, import, load, clean, integrate and process data from numerous diverse big datasets. You will help to design and build new data platform which will enable a completely new product. That will assist technology vendors to effectively assess their markets, customers, and competitors.

 Why IDC?

 IDC is the most respected global technology market research firm. We are changing the way the world thinks about the impact of technology on business and society. Our people, data, and analytics create global technology insights that accelerate customer success. 
IDC was recognized by the Institute of Industry Analyst Relations (IIAR) as the 
2022 Analyst Firm of the Year
 for the third consecutive year, for delivering critical, timely insights in coordinated efforts around the world, during a time when our customers faced unprecedented challenges.


 Our collaborative, innovative and entrepreneurial culture is the perfect place for you to discover your future! We are just getting started! Responsibilities: 
 
Work closely with the data science team and business department to develop data models and cloud pipelines for research, reporting, and machine learning.
 Use data and build up to date datasets to solve business problems, answer questions and improve processes.
 Help drive scalable data sharing and integration practices.
 Define metrics, guidelines and strategies for effective use of algorithms and data.
 Build and maintain the infrastructure required for optimal ETL frameworks and processes that collect, import, load, clean, integrate and process data from various internal and external data sources using SQL and AWS technologies.
 Qualifications: 
 
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in computer science, data science, information technology, mathematics, or related fields.
 1+ years of experience in data engineering or roles related to data engineering.
 Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
 Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases.
 Demonstrated strong technical knowledge of object-oriented programming in Python.
 Proven ability to work independently and ensure completion of tasks accurately and on time.
 Strong English communication skills in both verbal and written form.
 Open to learn new technologies and tools.

 Preferred Qualifications

 Data engineering in a cloud environment.
 Familiarity with the AWS ecosystem.
 Proven work experience with Snowflake, PostgreSQL, Airflow, Neo4j, NoSQL databases, or distributed computing.

title: Data Engineer
description:
About the project  
 In a world where it is hard to make future-proof decisions about technology, BlackBelt relies on its ever-growing team of professionals who create the best-suited and most efficient solutions for clients. Software development simplified: we provide professional developer teams and fast application development services to global enterprises. In September 2016 we opened our nearshore centre at Canada Square and in February 2019 we have expanded our office space by 30% occupying the first floor. Our revenue in 2018 was over EUR 8 million.
 Despite the fact that from a team of three people we have become a 200+ organization, we have remained the same friendly, happy company. We regard ourselves a learning organization where knowledge-sharing and transparency are core values.
 We are looking for Data Engineers to join us and work in our continuously growing teams and diverse projects.
 Join the Data Alliance team where you can develop data-driven solutions with the help of analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence in the areas of personalization,
 user predictions, digital advertising, AdTech, and much more.
What is your task?  

 Work closely with data scientists in the development of algorithms and machine learning and deep learning models.
 Implement data pipelines for the preparation, provisioning, and versioning of training data for the machine learning models.
 Design and implement microservices in Python to provide the models via REST API, including functions for monitoring these models in production.
 Deploy microservices in the productive cloud environment, considering scalability and high availability requirements.

 What do we need? 

 Experience working as a Data Engineer
 Solid skills in programming with Python
 Ability to write efficient, well-tested code with a keen eye on scalability and maintainability
 You can work in cross-functional teams
 Experience with at least one cloud
 Outstanding verbal and written communications skills in English

 Technology stack 

 REST APIs, Python
 GCP/ Terraform/ Terragrunt / Azure Cloud, Azure DevOps
 Event Hubs, KosmosDB
 Kubernetes, Docker
 JIRA, Confluence, Gitlab

 Why should you join  

 BlackBelt team - You can join a cool and professional team, where everyone has a BlackBelt in technology
 Development - We are supporting your growth with trainings and certifications
 Diversity – You can switch between projects and Delivery Units
 Meetups - We have Meetups every month with interesting topics, knowledge sharing is guaranteed
 ️ Flexibility- If you enjoy home office, then you can still enjoy your couch after Covid
 Support - We are a caring organisation, if you face difficulties you can always count on us

title: Senior Data Strategist
description:
The opportunity


At Kin + Carta, we’ve got opportunities to offer you — for growth, for leadership, for big, world-changing impact and for, dare we say it, fun. We are a global workforce that is committed to building a world that works better for everyone. And that starts with our Kin. That’s why we’re proud of:

The life we create within our virtual walls, every day
Being B Corp certified
Our honor as a “Best Company to Work For” by Women's Choice Award









The role


Kin and Carta is looking to hire a Senior Data Analyst to join our growing BI team to help build our global data platform. If you are innovative, passionate about data and AI technologies, and look to continually learn and enjoy sharing expertise, read on!








Role responsibilities



Advising business and technical client stakeholders on the adoption of data strategies for achieving business goals
Designing of multi-phased roadmap strategies for clients
Work with client stakeholders to help them discover new data insights
Lead the estimation and planning of projects
Working with designers, data architects and data engineers on the development of data solutions for large and mid-level enterprise clients to enhance their business
Informing Designs, Process Mapping, Migration Strategies, Development, and Testing of large scale data processing architectures
Helping clients implement ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality, and build intelligent data solutions
Working with designers to help visualize data to provide insights to end-users









Minimum qualifications


We want all new hires to succeed in their roles at Kin + Carta. That's why we've outlined the job requirements below. To be considered for this role, it's important that you meet all Minimum Qualifications. If you do not meet all of the Preferred Qualifications, we still encourage you to apply.

Experience in the application of human-centered design principles to the creation of data-powered digital products is a plus.
Strong business acumen with the ability to understand how a business operates to enable growth.
Ability to analyze a collection of raw datasets to create meaningful impact to large enterprise clients while maintaining a high degree of scientific rigor and discipline
Communicates analytical findings in an intuitive and visually compelling way to provide insight to stakeholders.
Creating highly visual and interactive dashboards via Tableau, Power BI, or custom web applications.
Conducting deep dive analysis and designing KPIs to help guide business decisions and measure success.
Gathering stakeholder requirements and conducting technical due diligence toward designing pragmatic data-driven business solutions.
Strong verbal and written communication is a must with ability to educate stakeholders on best practices for data quality and governance.
Understands the business future-state goals and can align a roadmap to meet those goals.
Experienced with identifying and establishing processes, platforms, tools, and capabilities to establish a data practice for governance within an organization.
A leader that can advise data engineers and technologists as required by the target architectures.
Experience with defining a vision, strategy, and driving the implementation of a data platform capability to maturity in order to enable a business to run optimally or differentiates itself in its market.
An experienced relationship builder who knows how to work across the business to build buy-in for data initiatives. 









Preferred qualifications



Experience working in an Agile Scrum development environment or in a consulting capacity is a plus.
Managing a prioritized backlog, roadmap, and strategic direction of a data product.
Presenting to and managing the relationships to senior stakeholders including C-suite.


Proficiency in visualization/reporting tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Proficiency with cloud architecture components in Google Cloud Platform.
Proficiency with ETL design and development of data pipeline software.
Ability to turn raw data and ambiguous business questions into distilled findings and recommendations for action.
Experience with statistical and machine learning libraries or tools, along with the ability to apply them appropriately to business problems.
Experience leading and managing technical data/analytics/machine learning projects.
Success in delivering to and navigating within large organizations (Fortune 500).









About Kin + Carta


Kin + Carta is a global digital transformation consultancy committed to working alongside our clients to build a world that works better #ForEveryone. Our 2,000 curious minds make creative connections between people, data and technology to create connected outcomes across the full lifecycle of the product and platform ecosystems.
 We’re makers, builders and creators by nature, and we come to work every day to build experiences for some of the world’s most influential companies. We help businesses accelerate their digital roadmap, rapidly innovate, modernize their systems, enable their teams and optimize for continued growth.
 We are a technology business with trust and human connection at its heart. As a Certified B Corp, our triple bottom line focus on people, the planet and profit is at the core of everything we do.
 We welcome our Kin to show up as their authentic selves every day. Because this is so important to us, Kin + Carta is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. To read further about our commitment to Inclusion, Diversity, Equity and Awareness, check out the IDEA page on our website.
 If you need accommodations at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.





Apply for this role

Whoever you are, wherever you’re from and whoever you love, you’ll find an open door at Kin + Carta. It’s yours to walk through if you’re passionate about building a better world for everyone, and you’re keen to be part of a diverse and inclusive culture that plays to people’s strengths and thrives on togetherness.

title: DATA ENGINEER (DEVELOPER)
description:
Company Description
  Bosch was founded in Stuttgart in 1886 by Robert Bosch (1861-1942) and for more than 130 years has been distinguished by a unique corporate culture based on solid values that drive us to improve every day. Our products, present in a wide variety of fields, that contribute to improve the quality of life of millions of people.



 Job Description
  Responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture for SMT related process, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams along with maintain and keep updated Bid data hardware and data structure in accordance with PAE-SMT projects scope. Design and keep data standardization, Red Lake and Data Warehouse (Juarez Central Data Base)

 Create, integrate and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture for SMT processes.
 Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business and management requirements.
 Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, propose re-designing of data and infrastructure for greater scalability, etc in according with PAE-SMT scope.
 Build, design and review the data structure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS ‘big data’ technology.
 Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
 Work with others stakeholders within AE wide including Management, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data requirements needs.
 Keep our data separated, safe and secure for only the right personnel scope.
 Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader
 Design and keep Data Warehouse structure
 Design and keep JuP1 Data Lake
 Interact with Data Management structure to keep Data Governance.




 Qualifications
 

 Professional Degree
 English (Good level)
 High knowledge Programming languages C#, VB and SQL
 Knowledge on Progamming languages (C, C++, Python, Webpage)
 Knowledge on Data Science, Big data and Machine learning (optional)
 Generate database reports, models, dashboards and data containers as required.
 Strong Technical Knowledge to monitor and troubleshot issues related to Big Data, Operating System, applications and databases.
 Generate efficient queries and procedures to provide database reports. Archiving/ consulting historical data administration.
 Share troubleshooting and/or implementation Lesson learned with Business Division.
 Keep Big Data platform system version updated.
 Implements new technology systems solution to enable information availability.
 Project management

 Softskills

 Effective comunication
 Organized
 Team Player
 Service Attitude

 Additional Information
  Bosch is constantly expanding its international presence, since for us cultural diversity represents one of our greatest strengths. We are continuously promoting the growth of our more than 17,000 associates, who develop their full potential in one of the highest quality companies in technology. We value the balance between personal and work life as one of the main tools to improve the creativity and productivity of our associates.  Do you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas? Whether in the areas of mobility solutions, consumer goods, industrial technology or energy and building technology – with us, you will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. Welcome to Bosch.
 We invite you to watch this video: Bosch Juarez
 Get to know more about how we work at Bosch and our new open positions on our social networks:
 Facebook: Bosch Talento México
 Instagram: Bosch Campus México
 LinkedIn: Bosch México
 Work #LikeABosch
 PARQUE INDUSTRIAL RIO BRAVO

title: Projects Engineer
description:
Job Purpose: The Projects Engineer undertakes a range of functions to assist the Projects Development Manager in maintaining a smooth operation of the professional activities within the department. S/he will perform professional duties of a complex and confidential nature in support of the senior management. The Projects Engineer’s primary responsibilities include coordination of architectural designs, administrative, legal and work procedures pertaining to all the projects conducted by the Company; as well as maintenance of an effective liaison with the management team and staff members. This position will provide professional support to the Projects Development Manager
Job Requirements:

BSc – Civil Engineering / Architecture
3–5 years experience in a similar position with a real estate company / Engineering office / Contracting Company.
Bilingual with excellent communication skills. 
Perfect computer proficiency (Word for Windows, Excel, Power Point, Autocad, 3D, Primavera)
Ability to work independently and under pressure
Creativity and aptitude for research
Travel

Researching data and reports for financial feasibility and Private Placement Memorandum. Assisting in compilation of comparative analyses. Preparing & negotiating terms of reference documents between MENA and foreign architectural firms.


Conducting due-diligence reports on the initial financial feasibility of MENA projects and conducting continuous follow-up reports on investment projects; and preparing their filing papers under the supervision of the department head.

Maintaining interface with the work team of the Company to ensure compliance with the established budgets and operational plans.


To apply, please send your CV to info@mena-realestate.com

title: Sr Analyst, Data Engineer
description:
Grow your career with The Estée Lauder Companies!
 
The Estée Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world's leading manufacturers and marketers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance and hair care products. As the global leader in prestige beauty, we touch over half a billion consumers a year.
 
Our Company's products are sold in over 150 countries and territories under the following brand names: AERIN, Aramis, Aveda, Bobbi Brown, Bumble and bumble, By Kilian, Clinique, Darphin, Donna Karan, DKNY, Dr. Jart+, Editions de Parfums Frédéric Malle, Ermenegildo Zegna, Estée Lauder, GLAMGLOW, Jo Malone London, Kiton, La Mer, Lab Series, Le Labo, M•A•C, Michael Kors, Origins, Prescriptives,Smashbox, Tom Ford, Tommy Hilfiger and Too Faced.
 
Infused throughout our organization is a passion for creativity and innovation; a desire to push the boundaries and invent the unexpected.
 
Position Overview:

This position will develop, support and maintain scalable data pipelines that will ingest, transform and distribute numerous data streams into the organization’s entire data ecosystem. This resource is expected to lead data wrangling, ETL and data processing cluster development initiatives while working very closely to its BI&A counterpart supporting and developing advanced machine learning and statistical models. Furthermore, understanding global business customer needs will be vital for the role in order to create the appropriate data streams to ingest and connect global data sources which are then used for insight creation and decision making. This position will also require the implementation of data handling improvement projects across finance, such as process streamlining, capacity creation through identification of automation and integration opportunities, elimination of hold times and backlogs, to cite a few examples.



Start-up Team

Work closely with the different business organizations and BI&A team
Define and identified the personas and understand their business needs for analytics.
Identify the key business questions and how they connect with different data sources
Define the metrics, analyze the available data and join sources to get the correct insights.
Be proactive in identifying potential new analytical projects to extract knowledge from raw data and transform it into meaningful and impactful information.
Become the subject matter expert in data analytics leveraging on top notch process mining tools to identify process variants, bottlenecks, loops, correlation analysis whilst generating meaningful data models.




Day-to-Day Service Delivery

Data Engineer 
Collaborate with EDM and IT teams to ensure data accuracy and connectivity
Support distributed data processing administration tasks
Create custom software components for use in data pipelines
Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality
Develop machine learning models of classification to categorize unstructured data 
Build data pipelines that enable the organization to collect data points from different sources available.
Data Democratization
Prepare data for prescriptive and predictive modeling
Make data drive analysis to enable business decision making



Key Responsibilities:
 
Start-up Team

Work closely with the different business organizations and BI&A team
Define and identified the personas and understand their business needs for analytics.
Identify the key business questions and how they connect with different data sources
Define the metrics, analyze the available data and join sources to get the correct insights.
Be proactive in identifying potential new analytical projects to extract knowledge from raw data and transform it into meaningful and impactful information.
Become the subject matter expert in data analytics leveraging on top notch process mining tools to identify process variants, bottlenecks, loops, correlation analysis whilst generating meaningful data models.





Qualifications


Qualifications:

3.5 Years of experience



OneSource

Provides responsive and flexible services

Continuous improvement and service-oriented mindset.

title: Software Engineer I - University Hiring 2022
description:
At Careem we are led by a powerful purpose to simplify and improve lives in the Middle East, North Africa and Pakistan. We're pioneering the development of innovative services to aid the mobility of people, the mobility of things and the mobility of money.
 We're in the driving seat as we help to define how technology will shape progress in some of the fastest-growing countries in the world. Our teams are building tech to meet the needs of the future in areas including data and AI, e-commerce, technology-enabled logistics, maps, identity, and fintech.
 We’re well placed to solve complex and meaningful challenges at scale, with deep tech expertise, strong regulatory relationships, a local presence, and increasingly specialised global teams which are structured to operate as autonomous start-ups. Our team of over 400 engineers and developers are empowered to develop cutting-edge technology every day.
 Careem was established in July 2012, became a wholly-owned subsidiary of Uber Technologies, Inc. in January 2020, and today operates in over 100 cities across 12 countries.

About the Role
 At Careem, the mission for the New College Graduates Programme is to help grow our new joint Engineering by learning how to write Clean Code, use SOLID principle techniques, and design reliable systems. The ultimate goal is to train the new Engineers to build Engineering excellence foundations with high standards. Our Programme covers all the areas of Careem tech be it Cyber Security, Data, Infrastructure, and all the Software Engineering tracks like Backend, Frontend as well as Mobile. We are looking for software engineers to join our team of talented engineers that share a common interest in distributed backend systems, their scalability, and continued development. You will work alongside a top talent for an accelerated learning path. You will have access to some of the most exciting projects and advanced tech for accelerated learning and exposure. You will be responsible for maintaining some of our services that power the Careem engine, scaling highly distributed systems, and continuously documenting and improving our engineering practices. These large-scale, distributed systems handle everything from user requests to payment processing.

 Our tech stack is Java 8 and Spring Boot, Micro-Service Architecture, SQL and no-SQL DBs, iOS and Android applications, web front-end, and AWS infrastructure. Key responsibilities include:
  

Development of our distributed backend system to meet the challenging functional, scalability, and reliability requirements for our fast-growing business
Maintain features and systems, with an emphasis on code quality, maintainability, readability, and testing
Facilitate collaboration with other engineers, product owners, and designers to solve interesting and challenging problems across our platform
Be a valued member of an autonomous, cross-functional agile team
You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high-quality code.


 Requirement Summary: The ideal candidate will have a passionate commitment to improving the lives of people, an insane focus on excellence and customer service, and a strong alignment with our core values: being bold, focused, agile and collaborative.

 Must have:
  

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or other related technical fields.
1-2 years of experience in Object-oriented design, data structures, and algorithms.
Ability to solve complex problems
Must be able to write clean and maintainable code (must love coding!)
Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions; deal with loosely defined problems and fast-changing requirements & think abstractly
Passionate about learning new technologies and working on a product of massive scale and impact
Able to communicate effectively
Attention to detail



 Nice to have:
  

Knowledge of AWS
Knowledge of clean code principles
Deep understanding of design patterns
Demonstrated ability of test-driven development




 Where you'll be:


Even though we are working remotely, we are strong believers in collaboration and the power of building social connections with our teams. For that reason, our offices are still open and provide plenty of collaboration-friendly spaces at times when teams need it or if you need a quiet space to work outside of home.
You’ll be working in the location you’re hired from. Due to legal and compensation considerations, you will need to be based out of the country you’re hired from as your primary work location.



What we'll provide you
 In addition to a competitive long-term total compensation with salary and equity, we have a reward philosophy that expands beyond this. As a Careem colleague you will be able to:

Be part of a Remote-First organisation
Work from any country in the world for 60 days a year
Use Unlimited Vacation days throughout the year
Access fitness reimbursements for health activities including: gym, health club and training classes.
Work and learn from great minds
Create impact in a region with untapped potential
Explore new opportunities to learn and grow every day

description:

Junior Data & Analytics Engineer 

YOUR PERSPECTIVE Farai parte del team focalizzato nella gestione di sfidanti progetti di Digital Transformation per i principali players in ambito Automotive & Industrial Manufacturing, consumer Markets, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services, Telco & Media attraverso la creazione di avanzate piattaforme dati con i pattern architetturali più innovativi, sfruttando tutte le tecnologie più recenti. Valutare le tecnologie e i servizi più adatti per i differenti contesti progettuali; 
Effettuare studi di fattibilità e analisi comparative; 
Implementare processi di raccolta dati, trasformazione e modellazione attraverso l'utilizzo di strumenti quali Informatica power center , Oracle database engine , Sql server engine 
Studiare e implementare pattern architetturali innovativi (es. Data Mesh); 
YOUR UNIQUE STRENGHT 

Sei laureato/a o ti stai laureando in una delle seguenti discipline: Informatica , Ingegneria Informatica , Ingegneria gestionale , Matematica , Fisica ed hai una forte passione per la tecnologia. 
Conosci la struttura di un database relazionale e conosci i linguaggi di Data Engineering come PLSQL , TSQL , Python . 
Conosci lo strumento Informatica Power Center , Integration services . 
Conosci uno dei servizi di Data Storage and Management come Oracle o sql server . 
Hai una comprensione generale degli argomenti relativi alle infrastrutture/architetture. 
Costituisce un plus la conoscenza di piattaforme cloud tra GCP , Aws e Azure .

title: Data Engineer
description:
Your role at HEINEKEN
As our Data Engineer, you will manage our cloud data pipelines and processes in Azure, as well as provide thought leadership and sign-off on ways of working, methodologies, frameworks, tools, policies, and processes developed by our consultants.


Your deep understanding of how data is used within business processes and its impact will ensure that the right types of data and levels of data quality needed are correctly identified in order to meet business objectives.


In this role, you will:

Drive high data quality and local data quality rules to ensure business correctness of data
Coordinate with local Data Management team to ensure uplift in data quality of data sources
Act as an ambassador and build awareness of data management capabilities within OpCo
Coordinate with global HEINEKEN resources to ensure best practice implementation
Maintain cooperation between regional HEINEKEN operations to ensure scalability
Manage and drive execution of global data initiatives


 
Key Requirements:

Bachelor or Master’s degree with 5+ years experience in a related role
Azure Data Architecture & Engineering experience; Azure ML experience is a plus
Pyspark (Python) / Spark SQL (SQL) or related coding experience
Specific knowledge with: Azure Blobs / Databricks / Data Factory / Synapse
Strong inter-personal skills and able to work and interact effectively in a team-based environment; particularly between the data team and BI team
Versatile, organized, result-oriented and enjoy the challenge of working in a competitive and fast paced environment.

title: Data Engineer PL - Azure
description:
Olá, tudo bem?

 Que tal fazer parte de uma equipe que está revolucionando o setor de consultoria em Tecnologia no Brasil, com foco total em transformação digital? 


Esta é uma oportunidade para integrar o time de Data da T10, compartilhar conhecimentos (e ideias) e colaborar em projetos desafiadores e de alto nível técnico. No Reino, você será uma pessoa central no desenvolvimento do time, parte de uma equipe talentosa e com opiniões bem formadas sobre como softwares devem ser desenhados, modelados e implementados.

 Essa vaga é pra você que:

 Fortes habilidades de comunicação verbal e escrita
 Capacidade de trabalhar de forma independente e como parte de um time
 Habilidade de gerenciar o tempo e priorizar tarefas de maneira eficiente
 Forte atenção aos detalhes e precisão
 Capacidade de pensar de forma crítica e analítica
 Habilidade de aprender rapidamente e se auto-dirigir
 Forte senso de responsabilidade e compromisso com o trabalho
 Habilidade de trabalhar com prazos estabelecidos.


 Curtiu? O Reino te espera 


Responsabilidades e atribuições

 O que será esperado de você?


 Projetar, implementar e manter pipelines e data lake utilizando Azure Cloud
 Desenvolver e manter documentação para pipelines e data lake
 Realizar testes em pipelines e data lake para garantir precisão e confiabilidade
 Utilizar tecnologias de conteinerização e monitoramento como Kubernetes e Docker
 Utilizar serviço de mensageria para otimizar o processamento e o streaming de dados
 Documentar NFe e todo trabalho desenvolvido
 Escrever código SQL e Python eficiente para extrair, transformar e carregar dados (ETL)
 Colaborar com equipes interfuncionais para entender os requisitos de negócios e traduzi-los em soluções técnicas
 Buscar continuamente maneiras de melhorar a eficiência e eficácia do processamento e armazenamento de dados.


 Requisitos e qualificações

 Experiência com:


 3+ anos de experiência como Data Engineer
 Conhecimento profundo de Azure Cloud e tecnologias relacionadas
 Experiência prévia trabalhando com NFe
 Conhecimento sólido em Kubernetes e Docker
 Experiência em processamento ou streaming de dados rápidos
 Habilidade em escrever código SQL e Python de forma eficiente
 Experiência em gerenciamento de banco de dados e armazenamento de dados
 Conhecimento em mensagens e integração de sistemas
 Experiência em testes e validação de pipelines e lagos de dados
 Conhecimento em criação e manutenção de documentação técnica.


 Conhecimento em:


 Formação acadêmica em Ciência da Computação, Engenharia de Dados ou área relacionada
 Cursos e certificações em Azure Cloud, Kubernetes, Docker, SQL e Python são altamente valorizados


 Bônus:


 Experiência em C# e .NET


 Informações adicionais


 Está é uma posição 100% remota. Para fins trabalhistas, previdenciários, tributários, fiscais e sindicais fixa-se como Localidade Base Contratual a cidade de Uberlândia - MG.
 Remuneração competitiva CLT. Nosso objetivo maior é realizar um trabalho de alta qualidade e com impactos reais; e entendemos que isso tem um custo.
 Benefícios: VA/VR, Auxílio Home Office, Auxílio Saúde Mental, Convênio Médico e Odontológico, Gympass, Equipamento e Day Off de Aniversário.
 Diferenciais: Ambiente plural, criativo, transparente e livre 



Que bom ter você aqui!

 Nós nascemos da paixão pela tecnologia e do desejo de construir o ambiente de trabalho que queremos e acreditamos ser possível: plural, criativo, transparente e livre.

 Aqui no Reino, você estará em contato com pessoas curiosas e que buscam a excelência pessoal & técnica em tudo que fazem. É assim que entregamos produtos digitais singulares e eficientes, para que as pessoas guardem tempo para ampliar sua consciência, fortalecer seus laços afetivos e se divertir.

 Se você se identificou com a gente, #VemProReino!

title: Data Engineer - McKinsey Digital - Build
description:
Who You'll Work With


     You will be based in our Mexico City office as part of McKinsey Digital.
    


      Despite being part of a large, multinational organization, our group works more like a small startup company, where differences are appreciated. Our development teams are small, flexible, and employ agile methodologies to quickly provide our consultants with the solutions they need. We combine the latest open source technologies with traditional enterprise software products. Our office culture is casual and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. With McKinsey, you'll have the freedom to try new ideas and be creative, constantly learning and growing. We also emphasize mentoring, coaching, and support to help you build on your current skills.
    


      McKinsey Digital uses the latest technology disruptions (e.g., cloud, big data, mobile, agile, software development) and a team of talented technologists to rapidly build and deploy custom web and mobile Business intelligence applications for our clients. McKinsey Digital works closely with our consultants and clients to develop a deep understanding of business needs and create tools that enable our clients to be more productive (e.g., equip frontline with mobile sales app) and make timely decisions (e.g., management dashboards). McKinsey Digital end-products range from building iPad demos and dashboards, to embedding Excel models in existing client applications, to standing-up advanced analytics technology environments or SaaS solutions, and to building targeted web/mobile applications.
    





What You'll Do


     You will apply your passion for finding opportunities in data by using established tools and techniques, or by innovating/building new ones.
    


      You will collaborate with highly talented business consultants to design and drive architecture and implementation planning for our clients and act as a big data evangelist, educating McKinsey's and client's teams on data engineering topics.
    


      You'll do meaningful work that makes a real difference with our clients. This is a hybrid client-facing/technical role using state-of-the-art technologies, whilst also being able to communicate complex intractable ideas to non-technical audiences.
    





Qualifications



Bachelor's degree in computer science or engineering; master's degree preferred
 Experienced on Big Data platforms and tools like AWS, Azure, GCP and tools like Spark, Kafka, Snowflake, GCS Data Proc, Azure DataFactory, AWS Glue, Apache Beam/Flink, Python/PySpark. etc.
 Experienced with data modeling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured solutions, distributed systems
 Solid grasp of ETL across various platforms
 Knowledge of agile software development process and familiarity with performance metric tools
 Knowledge of web application development technologies such as Ruby on Rails, Java, UNIX, HTML, CSS, Perl, or PHP is a plus
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions; tolerance in dealing with bad quality data
 Proficiency in visualization tool (Tableau, D3, etc.)
 Distinct customer focus and quality mindset
 Ability to see from and sell to multiple viewpoints
 Ability to work at an abstract level and build consensus; ability to work both independently and with a team
 Ability to work efficiently with a solid sense for setting priorities
 Ability to guide own learning and contribute to domain knowledge building
 Excellent interpersonal, leadership, and communication skills
 Strong command of the English & Spanish language (both verbal and written)
 Willingness to travel

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:

We have various project opportunities on the field of computer vision, predictive analytics, and conversational artificial intelligence.

 What will you do:

 Gathering business requirements and translating them into machine learning requirements
 Identifying, creating and preparing data required for ML algorithms

 Build/Implement machine learning/statistical models
 Research and continuous training on AI and ML


 What we offer:

 Attractive and competitive compensation package
 Wide range of benefits including cafeteria, private healthcare package, life insurance, AYCM sport card, internal referral bonus, family-oriented benefits, company shares
 Access to a whole set of learning platforms and leading-edge trainings, opportunity to receive specific certificates

 Experience with processing/modeling big data is an advantage

title: Junior Data & AI Engineer
description:
Perché assistere al cambiamento, quando puoi guidarlo? In Accenture, potrai crescere in un ambiente inclusivo e rispettoso della tua unicità e dei tuoi valori, sviluppando le tue abilità con programmi di training continuativi ed esperienziali. Scopri cosa significa lavorare al cuore del cambiamento e accompagna le aziende più importanti nel loro percorso di trasformazione digitale.  Il tuo ruolo e le tue prospettive  Entra a far parte del nostro network internazionale di talenti Technology in ambito Data & AI. Lavorerai con tecnologie innovative su progetti entusiasmanti, liberando la potenza dei dati e dell'intelligenza artificiale per trasformare i processi di business. In particolare, potrai:

 Progettare e implementare modelli di dati specifici che aiutino a prendere decisioni aziendali migliori e più rapide attraverso l’analisi di una combinazione di dati esterni e interni
 Modellare dati, creare pipeline di dati, implementare data lake, utilizzando framework di programmazione scalabili
 Implementare procedure statistiche di qualità dei dati sulle sorgenti dati e applicare rigorose analisi iterative per supportare i data scientist nell'approvvigionamento e nella preparazione dei dati per visualizzarli e sintetizzare informazioni generando valore aziendale
 Definire gli standard di gestione dei dati e delle politiche di gestione, quali, ad esempio, l'anonimizzazione




Se vuoi fare della tua passione una carriera e hai le seguenti caratteristiche, ti stiamo aspettando:

 Hai terminato o stai per terminare un percorso di studi in Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica o Statistica
 Sei creativo, impari in fretta e ami pensare fuori dal coro
 Sei appassionato e vuoi approfondire tematiche quali: Data Architecture, Data Warehouse, Data Modeling, Data Integration, Data Transformation, Data Visualization, Big Data Technologies (Cloudera, AWS, Azure, Google, Snowflake), Spark, Python, Kafka, etc.

 Scopri di più su di noi  Accenture è un’azienda globale di servizi professionali con capacità avanzate in campo digitale, cloud e security. I nostri 699.000 professionisti combinano ogni giorno tecnologia e ingegno umano, servendo clienti in oltre 120 Paesi.  Vuoi prepararti al meglio al nostro processo di selezione? Leggi la nostra sezione FAQ: https://www.accenture.com/it-it/careers/recruiting-faq-answers  Policy  Qualora il tuo percorso di selezione andasse a buon fine, avrai la possibilità di aderire all’Accordo di smart working, ove compatibile con l’attività svolta, e lavorare da remoto secondo quanto previsto dalle policy aziendali. Per informazioni sulla nostra protezione della privacy art13 L.679/2016 (GDPR) vai su https://www.accenture.com/it-it/careers/privacy-policy  Accenture garantisce le pari opportunità.

title: MTT Test Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Manufacturing Test Data Analytics Engineer
 In this position, you would be a key member of the core Test MTT (Manufacturing Technology Team), with responsibility for implementing and supporting test data analytics solutions across our global manufacturing sites. The Test MTT is part of the Manufacturing Engineering Technologies and Standards team, with scope across all Active Safety & User Experience product families and global regions.

 Your Role

 Develop data collection and equipment monitoring solutions for production In-circuit and automated Functional Test systems
 Manage global implementation and ongoing deployment support for real time Test Data Analytics applications, working in close cooperation with 3rd party tool providers, the Aptiv IT organization, and regional Manufacturing Test team leaders
 Develop and document standard work/standard practices which are followed by Manufacturing Test Engineering and Operations support teams at all global sites, leveraging analytics to drive improvements in product quality and operational efficiency
 Develop and provide training to our global Manufacturing Test Engineering organization
 Evaluate tools and vendors to support the decision making process
 Support the IT infrastructure administration and planning for medium and long term goals


 Your Background

 Minimum bachelor degree in Electrical Engineering, Electrical Engineering Technology or equivalent. Master Degree is a Plus
 Minimum 3 years of experience with automated electrical test application development
 Minimum 1 year experience with Statistics and Data Analytics solution deployment and/or support
 Preferred: Six Sigma, Black Belt certification
 Basic knowledge of electronics manufacturing processes
 Good understanding of database design and administration
 Strong problem solving skills
 Ability to work in a diverse, global team environment
 Energetic, self-motivated, proactive, and customer focused working style
 Business fluent English


 Aptiv Rewards & Advantages
 Recognition for innovation and excellence, Opportunities to give back to the community, Meaningful work that makes a difference in the world

 Some see differences. We see perspectives that make us stronger. 
Diversity and Inclusion are sources of innovation and creativity, both of which are essential to Aptiv’s success. Everyday our diverse team comes together, drives innovation, pursues solutions, and meets challenges using their unique abilities, perspectives and talents, changing what tomorrow brings. When you join our team, you’ll get encouraged to think boldly, express your viewpoint and innovate as a matter of habit.

 Some see technology. We see a way to make connections.
 At Aptiv, we don’t just see the world differently; we work to change reality. That means developing technology that rewrites the rules of what’s possible in the pursuit of making transportation safer, greener and more connected. Today there are more than 160,000 of us globally, located in 44 countries, and united by one mission. Join the movement and together, let’s change tomorrow.

 Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates

 Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Development Engineer
description:
At Tetra Pak we commit to making food safe and available, everywhere; and we protect what's good – protecting food, protecting people, and protecting the planet. By doing so we touch millions of people's lives every day. And we need people like you to make it happen.



 Job Summary


 We are looking for a Development Engineer, who will be part of the Reliability Engineering Team based in Modena and Lund. The main areas of responsibility of the Team are the assessment of the reliability targets for components and sub-systems across the development domain of the Equipment Engineering department; the definition of the reliability growth strategy integrated into the Equipment Integration and the One Innovation strategies, ensuring the application of the reliability principles and methodologies in the development programs and the V&V activities. The lead of the Reliability Continuous Improvement Program and the Reliability Centres, the drive of the FMEA correct application within Equipment Engineering, the development of testing method and related equipment, the execution of the physical testing, documentation and sharing of the achievements is also among the responsibilities of the Team as well. You will be based in Modena. You may be required to travel up to 20% of your time regionally. 




What you will do


 As a Reliability Development Engineer you will collaborate with TD, PD, PDAL, TKH projects within D&T to:

Collect and define verification requirements for components and sub-systems
Identify and create the testing methods
Elaborate the testing documentation (Test Specifications, Testing Equipment Specification, Test Report)
Be responsible for the execution of the testing activities
Drive the collaboration with external parties for the design, build and run (at agreed cost and time constrains) for specific RIGs.
Collect, structure, and analyse data results
Report results and achievements to relevant stakeholders





We believe you have


 We believe you have:

Bachelors or Masters degree in Engineering, preferably in Mechanical or Mechatronics field or equivalent.
Experience in mechanical or material engineering field or similar.
Quality Oriented mind-set and you are focused on results
Comfortable and productive in a mixed working environment, interacting with both internal and external stakeholders having different technical and professional backgrounds
Previous experience with Reliability principles and tools
Knowledge on Failure analysis and with Statistical tools (Minitab, Weibull ++)
Strong Problem-solving capabilities
Experience with methodologies such as: Accelerated Lifetime Test, Demonstration Test, DoE, Design FMEA, debugging of equipment by RGP, etc. will be an advantage




We Offer You

A variety of exciting challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a truly global landscape
A culture that pioneers a spirit of innovation where our industry experts drive visible results
An equal opportunity employment experience that values diversity and inclusion
Market competitive compensation and benefits with flexible working arrangements


 
Apply Now
If you are inspired to be part of our promise to protect what’s good; for food, people, and the planet, apply through our careers page at https://jobs.tetrapak.com/.
This job posting expires on 27 th January 2023

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Job Requisition ID #
               














 23WD66734
 


    Position Overview
  





 Autodesk is looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our Info360 team. As a Data Engineer you will participate in a cutting-edge Data/Analytics Platform build-out. This is a key position within our SaaS development organization which is set to handle massive data scale and ground-breaking analytics and machine learning solutions.
   




 Responsibilities
   






 Design and develop cutting edge water management solutions in product-based workflows

       Work closely with stakeholders to define best in class solutions.
     





 Qualifications
   






 Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience.
     


       Minimum 3 years of experience architecting and building data pipelines and services in a large-scale production environment.
     








       Expertise in data modeling, data munging/mining, data partitioning strategies

       Proficient with Snowflake (or similar data platforms such as Redshift)

In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on discretionary annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock or long-term incentive cash grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.
