title: Scuderia AlphaTauri - Tyre Performance Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
Master’s degree in Mechanical, Vehicle, Aerospace Engineering or similar 
Fluency in English (written and verbal)
 Permanent, Full-time

 In this role you will be responsible for the analysis and understanding of tyre performance to optimise the vehicle performance.
 Areas that play to your strengths
 All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:
 Tyre Analysis

 Participate to the pre-event, in-event and post-event tyre related analysis and simulation work.
 Act as trackside tyre engineer attending 40% to 60% of the races and test events.
 Act as tyre performance engineer in Operation Room during race events.
 Support the simulator activities by following the tyre test items and conducting correlation work.
 Analyse tyre data from track and simulator to provide data driven recommendations for improving car performance and tyre usage.
 Use and develop tyre analysis and simulation methodologies for tyre understanding and for implementation in the VPG analysis tool framework.
 Support correlation work between our tyre models, simulator, and real car data.
 Support the tyre modelling activities for tyre model correlation and simulation tools development.
 Professional Relationships

 Manage and monitor tyre preparation in close collaboration with tyre technicians while on track.
 Act as a tyre liaison engineer with the tyre supplier on technical matters on track.
 Proactivity & Teamwork

 Improve methodologies, analysis, and simulation tools and develop new ideas and concepts.
 Interact effectively with Race Engineering and Vehicle Dynamics to drive the car development.
 Collaborate with other Vehicle Performance groups to support car setup definition and race strategy decision making process.
 Create a strong cooperation and communication with other tyre engineers and strategy engineers.
 Provide feedback and ideas to the group leader to help on continuous development.
 Professionalism

 Provide flexible trackside attendance and attitude to work, both in line with the requirements of the role and any specific requirements of the VPG activities.
 Always work in a professional manner regardless of the task set and be pro-active in promoting a positive image for the department/team/sponsors.
 Your areas of knowledge and expertise

 Master’s degree in Mechanical, Vehicle, Aerospace Engineering or similar 
Good knowledge of tyre engineering and understanding of tyre effect on car behaviour.
 Experience in a motorsport environment or in a motorsport team.
 Experience in a tyre manufacturer is an advantage.
 Good knowledge of telemetry tools and data analysis.
 Advanced knowledge of Matlab is essential. Experience with PowerBI and Python is an advantage.
 Ability to respect deadline for reporting information and analysis.
 Ability to work with the team, external groups, and colleagues with a strong team spirit.
 Self-organized and pro-active.
 Ability to problem solving and quickly react to a continuous demanding environment.
 Drive for continuous improvement and innovation.

title: Software Data Engineer - Full remote working
description:
Company Description
  Launched in 1998, this pioneering British-born brand has specialised in creating amazing experiences and unforgettable memories - from hotels, city breaks and holidays to theatre, entertainment and spa days. Experts in brightening up online travel, lastminute.com is among the worldwide leaders in the field, helping hundreds of thousands of customers every year find, and do, "whatever makes them pink".
 lastminute.com is part of lm group, publicly traded multinational Group, among the worldwide leaders in the online travel industry. Every month, the Group reaches across all its websites and mobile apps (in 17 languages and 40 countries) 60 million unique users that search for and book their travel and leisure experiences. More than 1,200 people enjoy working with us and contribute to provide our audience with a comprehensive and inspiring offering of travel related products and services.
 At the heart of our culture is a commitment of inclusion across race, gender, age sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.



 Job Description
  At this moment lastminute.com Group is looking for a Software Data Engineer for its Metasearch Business Unit based in Chiasso, Switzerland.
 He/she will construct, develop, optimize and maintain complex data structures taking relevant decisions about technologies and development strategies according to the other senior members of the team.
 Key Responsibilities

 Data ingestion from partners using API or static files
 Data manipulation and aggregation to generate core data for product
 ETL for analysis and report creation
 Internal support for other teams




 Qualifications
  Essential

 3+ years of experience in software development with proficiency in Java, Python or Scala, making extensive use of unit, functional and integration tests
 BSc or MSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or a related discipline, or equivalent industry experience
 Strong knowledge of Object-Oriented design, patterns, algorithms and data structures
 Good knowledge of Apache Spark framework
 Good knowledge of SQL databases
 Experience in writing code for multi-threaded systems taking into account memory/computation constraints
 Basic knowledge of Unix
 Basic knowledge of Git or other equivalent version control tool
 Basic knowledge of Maven, SBT or other equivalent build tool

 Desirable

 Basic knowledge of Statistics and Machine Learning
 Experience in programming with Python using libraries such as NumPy, Pandas and Scikit-learn
 Hands on Bash
 Hands on Docker

 Additional Information
  Qualities

 Pragmatic, but able to be meticulous with attention to detail
 Highly self-motivated, uses initiative and “go to” problem solver
 Willingness to go beyond the call of duty to get the job done
 Committed to, and actively works towards, continuous self-improvement
 Proactive and always ready to study new technologies

 By joining our company, you will have the chance to:

 Join a dynamic team in an inclusive-international environment
 Grow thanks to the career journey and our internal mobility perspective
 Manage your own schedule thanks to the flexible start and end of the working day
 Work a shorter working week (36h), of which 4 hours on Friday morning
 Get focus time for learning, development and deep work on Friday mornings
 Work partially or fully remote according to local laws
 Enjoy continuous training thanks to our company platform
 Welfare platform (Corporate Benefits) where you will found dedicated discounts with more than 1500 partners
 Benefit from employee discounts on travel
 Receive 2 days off per year for the purpose of volunteering
 Get free snacks / fruit / hot drinks / water / beverages at our offices
 Participate in amazing winter and summer corporate events
 Benefit from extended parental or marriage leave

title: Process Engineer Intern
description:
Graduated already in chemical, mechanical, industrial engineering or similar disciplines? Wanting a career within the Hygiene or Consumer goods manufacturing sector? Are you looking for an engineering opportunity that will inspire you, and allow you to develop your process engineering as well as people management skills? Then Essity as a health and hygiene fast-paced, global manufacturer which produces market-leading consumer tissue products such as Tempo or Tork is the right company for you! 

About the Role 

Essity is looking for a talented and self-motivated graduate in the field of process engineering to join our largest finished goods converting site and papermaking plants based in Lucca. This position is suitable for those who have already completed their studies or will be graduating in 2023. 

What You Will Do 

As a graduate you will play a central role in challenging the status quo, driving change and making a positive impact by delivering concrete results within our global hygiene and health business. You will be joining our professional production teams, where you will work closely with experienced colleagues and developing your knowledge and skills as follows: 

Manage safety-oriented processes for yourself and others. 
Learning to follow established engineering principles to determine the sequence of steps or processes required to manufacture tissue-based consumer products that meet the organization’s high standards of quality and cost 
Performing standard technical tasks and prepare standard operation sheets. 
Monitoring production processes and work methods; collecting, compiling, and analyzing production data to identify opportunities to improve production processes. 
Learning to troubleshoot (for example, following root cause analysis methodology) 
Driving projects to support continuous improvements and deliverables 
Driving your own continued learning and complete industry-specific in-house training modules 


Who You Are 

You will be a recently graduated engineer or will be completing a technical engineering degree (Bachelor or Master degree qualified) who has a natural focus on the environment and a compulsive curiosity about how engineering can play its part in delivering for the future. 
You should be a data driven and a process-improvement enthusiast who can demonstrate that you are a successful team player, have a passion to lead others and manage responsibilities given to you. 
Work experience is not required, but internships within a manufacturing environment is an advantage. 
We’re looking for people who embody our values, aren’t afraid to challenge, innovate, experiment, and move at a fast pace. We’re always looking for ways to improve our products and ourselves. If this is you, we’d love to talk. 


What We Can Offer You 

We offer you a challenging job in a global company with many strong international brands. We offer an 6 months internship contract with a competitive compensation. At Essity, we believe every career is as unique as the individual and empower employees to reach their full potential in a winning culture motivated by a powerful purpose. If you apply for a job at Essity, you can be sure that the only criteria we consider for selection is professional experience, qualifications, key job-related attributes and working values. 
Together, we are improving lives, every day. 
Working at Essity is not just a career; it is a chance to directly make the world a healthier, more hygienic and safer place. With impactful innovations coupled with sustainable solutions, we strive to reach more people every year with the necessary and essential solutions for well-being. 

Application End Date: 
30 gen 2023

title: Data Engineer
description:
What does KLAR do?

 Klar is a Mexican fintech startup whose mission is to democratize and revolutionize the way in which financial services have been delivered so far in Mexico, especially since half of the population doesn’t have a bank account. We have had more than 1 million users since 2021!
 We are changing this scenario by offering a tech product that allows users to manage their money through a mobile and web application. Users can withdraw or deposit money from any cash machine, they can also use the card in stores and even do online payments. We don’t have any branches, everything is done and managed through the app.
 Our product roadmap includes offering loans and credit for a larger group of clients based on our very sophisticated credit modeling.
 Life at Klar
 We have a very international team with more than 30 nationalities working from Mexico City, Berlin, and remotely. Our founder Stefan Moller is also half German and Mexican, which allowed Klar to think globally since its inception.
 This is a full-time permanent position based in our Mexico office, or to be performed remotely within any LATAM county. 

Your daily adventures will be


 Maintain our DWH and Data Services
 Design, develop, and extend ETL code and data pipelines
 Create and maintain Data architecture and documentation
 Share data modeling and transformation expertise with all teams
 Automatize internal tasks


 What you bring to the table


 Experience in Data space as an analyst, engineer or equivalent
 Bachelor/Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent
 Required Hard Skills: AWS, Python
 Nice to have: Terraform, DBT, Rust
 Strong written and verbal English communication skills
 Solution-oriented mindset
 Strong analytical skills
 Capacity to adapt in a fast-moving environment


 What do we offer?


 Competitive salary based on performance and experience
 Stock options
 15 days of paid vacation days per year
 Vacation premium
 Extended maternity and paternity leave
 30 days of Christmas bonus
 Medical Insurance
 Computer devices
 Gympass subscription to stay healthy and fit
 Flexible work environment, with a hybrid model
 A modern centrally located office in Mexico City with free drinks and snacks, and regular social events
 International work environment with amazing and highly skilled people
 A world class team that helps you evolve your skills in areas you're interested in
 An opportunity to have a real impact in one of the most exciting emerging markets

 We trust our highly skilled and diverse team and we’re committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive environment for new talents to flourish. We value diversity and welcome all applications regardless of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion/belief, physical abilities, age, sexual orientation, and identity.
 
 We are looking forward to receiving your application!

title: Sr. Data Analytics Engineer
description:
ABOUT THE OPERATIONS IT TEAM

 Operations IT is a global IT capability supporting the Global Operations organisation. We business partner with Operations capability areas: Pharmaceutical Technology Development, Manufacturing & Global Engineering, Quality Control, Sustainability, Supply Chain, Logistics and Global External Sourcing and Procurement. We operate out of Operations hub sites including in the UK, Sweden, US, and China; and out of our Global Technology Centres in India and Mexico.

 THIS IS WHAT YOU’LL DO

 As a Senior Data Analytics Engineer, you will lead a team of data engineers to support solution development, provide technical leadership, and take responsibility for delivery across many initiatives. You are a T-shaped engineer and leader, a person with a broad range of knowledge and experience across data & analytics, with significant depth in at least one technical area. You will guide the engineering team accountable for harvesting, storing, quality checking, transforming, and visualising Operations data, build out reusable data products, which users from Operations units can self-service for analytics and AI/ML workflows. You will also be managing and providing ongoing Business-as-Usual support to ensure these data products evolving overtime to meet Operations business objectives.

 Our technology is focused around the AWS stack and modern data engineering stack, such as: Snowflake, DBT, DataKitchen, AWS Kinesis, Qlik Replicate. The EL tools are Qlik Replicate and the Visulaization is through Qlik Sense and Power BI.

 You will provide technical leadership throughout our software development lifecycle, from the initial development of a technical design based on a blueprint, right through to hypercare. The core of our development and support team are based in Chennai, with deep technical expertise based in the UK and Sweden. You will also work closely with the Enterprise Data & AI teams to leverage central Enterprise Data Platforms for Data Cataloguing, Master Data Management and Reference Data Management.
 You will need a collaborative delivery approach to be successful. We prefer to use Agile but choose the appropriate approach for the project. So, experience of a variety of delivery management methodologies would come in useful.

 YOU WILL NEED TO HAVE

 Experience with & knowledge in a broad base of data tools, ETL frameworks, monitoring and data technologies, for example our stack includes: AWS services, Snowflake, DBT, Airflow (good to have - DBT, DataKitchen, AWS Kinesis) 
Experience of visualisation technologies (we are focused on Power BI and Qlik Sense),
 Knowledge of Data Mesh and Data Product, in particular, experience with delivering and managing data products
 Experience in Design, development of Data Products
 Maintenance of existing data products to ensure that they evolve with the landscape
 Knowledge of data architectures, design including dimensional modelling
 Knowledge of cloud-based data management services: AWS, or equivalent
 Advanced SQL skills
 Experience of building scalable high availability analytics solutions
 Continuous integration and continuous development
 Experience of data analysis, such as: profiling, investigating, interpreting and documenting data structures
 Experience of managing and providing support to data solutions


 In addition, candidates will be expected to demonstrate:

 Advanced experience with project delivery and agile methodologies
 Influencing and innovation skills
 Good communication and facilitation skills
 Good written and verbal skills, fluent English.
 Knowledge of data privacy, GxP, GDPR regulation

title: Data Analytics Engineer (E2)
description:
Job Description Summary GE Aerospace is inventing the future of flight in Services Technology group along with teams like Services Modeling and Analytics, expert staff in the creation of performance analytics and fleet modeling support for the biggest aviation commercial product lines like LEAP and CFM56.
 
 We are looking for an engineer interested in becoming part of our Analytics team, which main responsibilities are the worldwide in- service turbofan engine health condition monitoring, current performance behavior understanding, and future state condition forecasting.
 
 The engineer would have the opportunity to apply statistical methods for data analyses, identify opportunities to standardize/automate processes, and explore data visualization tools to upgrade products effectiveness, a role that will ensure technical growth and will expose engineer at high management levels.
 
 Job Description
 Roles and Responsibilities

 Build digital tools that consume information from our data lake (pull data with SQL), clean and process the data (define rules for cleaning the data based on an exhaustive data exploration and descriptive analysis), transform the data using descriptive and inferential statistics and/or create data models for descriptive and/or prediction purposes.
 Support closely Fleet Management Engineers in physical phenomena and root cause investigations by providing diagnostic analyses of fielded engines behavior using all the previous skills mentioned.
 Looking for a proactive candidate with strong work ethic, creativity, curiosity, and self-learning capabilities in data management, data analysis, and programming languages.

 .
 Required Qualifications

 BS degree or master’s degree or PhD degree
 Degree must be in: Systems / Software / Computer Science / Physics / Engineering / Applied Mathematics / Data Science & Analytics (STEM related fields)
 Experience with programming languages (Python is a big plus)
 Experience with object-oriented programming
 Experience with SQL
 Knowledge on Descriptive Statistics, Inferential Statistics, and Probability Theory
 Experience with Data Modeling: Distribution fitting, linear regression models (and variants e.g., multiple linear regression, ridge regression, etc.), and logistic regression.
 Experience with techniques & multiple views for data analysis (e.g., distribution plots, scatter plots, box plots, density plots, etc.)
 Ability to find patterns and anomalies in a dataset
 Ability to find segregations/groups within a dataset
 Combine descriptive statistic with visualization skills to understand the data to propose cleaning and data modelling strategies
 Effective written and oral communication skills in English and Spanish
 Demonstrated interpersonal experience and ability to work in multidisciplinary teams
 Demonstrated ability in managing projects and execute strategic processes schedules
 Ability to communicate with Senior leadership / engineering
 Demonstrated ability in establishing common goals and objectives
 Demonstrated ability in influencing and shaping team's long-term vision and strategy
 Disciplined, innovative, self-driven, and that can work independently without supervision

 .
 Desired Characteristics

 Familiarity with PEP8 standard
 Experience with matplotlib and seaborn packages
 Experience creating visualization dashboards with Tableau, Spotfire or similar technologies
 Knowledge of Bayesian statistics
 Experience with modeling techniques like support vector machine or artificial neural network
 Experience working with scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or Keras.


 Additional Information







 Relocation Assistance Provided: No

title: Production Planner Engineer
description:
Company Description
  At Bosch, we care; for you, our business, and our environment.
 Let’s turn visions into reality. At Bosch, we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people’s lives. Our areas of activity are every bit as diverse as our outstanding Bosch-teams around the world. Their creativity is the key to innovation through connected living, mobility or industry. Our responsibility goes far beyond ‘business’. We’re independent of stock markets and bound to the purpose of the Robert Bosch Stiftung; our success directly benefits society, the environment, and future generations. Our promise to our associates is rock- solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Join in and feel the difference.

 EDIM S.p.A. provides die casting and machining services. The Company offers services that include tool design and manufacturing, chromate plating, and assembling of parts. EDIM S.p.a. serves industries such as mechanics and automotive.



 Job Description

You will also support Production Planner

title: Machine Learning Engineer – Data Science
description:
Overview: 
 
   IDC is seeking a 
  Machine Learning Engineer who will join our Data Science team in 
  Prague, Czech Republic.
 

   The IDC Data Science team applies the most modern technology and methods to connect multiple data streams, discover novel information, and deliver actionable insights to the rest of the company and to our customers. We combine knowledge graphs, natural language processing, machine learning, and data visualization to solve a wide range of problems entailed in providing advanced market intelligence and advisory services.
 

   In the Machine Learning Engineer role, you will come up with fresh approaches to address emerging business needs and innovate how insights are derived from data and communicated via a data platform. You will have an opportunity to shape both the product and the role, as we collaborate closely within the team as well as with other engineering and business groups.
 

 Why IDC?
 IDC is the most respected global technology market research firm. We are changing the way the world thinks about the impact of technology on business and society. Our people, data, and analytics create global technology insights that accelerate customer success. IDC was recognized by the Institute of Industry Analyst Relations (IIAR) as the 2022 Analyst Firm of the Year for the third consecutive year, for delivering critical, timely insights in coordinated efforts around the world, during a time when our customers faced unprecedented challenges.


 Our collaborative, innovative and entrepreneurial culture is the perfect place for you to discover your future! We are just getting started!
  Responsibilities: 
 
Design and conduct machine learning experiments, evaluate models as well as the overall impact on workflows
 Advise on using appropriate methods, tools, and frameworks, share the expertise in the team
 Follow advances in the state of the art, keep in touch with the professional community
 Focus on inferring original insights and presenting them with novel data storytelling
 Engage with stakeholders and business partners, improve the level of automation, apply data science best practices to drive efficient delivery of information via a data platform
 Qualifications: 
 
 Qualifications


 Bachelor's or higher degree or considerable work experience in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Software Engineering, Mathematics, Econometrics, or related fields
 3+ years of programming in Python, R, Java, Scala, Julia, or other relevant languages
 Portfolio of machine learning projects showcasing interesting approaches and experience
 Expertise in a choice of programming tools for machine learning and exploratory data analysis
 Experience with machine learning frameworks and platforms like Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, Google Colab, Amazon SageMaker
 Familiarity with frameworks and models for natural language processing, such as Hugging Face, spaCy, BERT, GPT-2, GPT-3
 Familiarity with tools for machine learning on graphs and networks, such as StellarGraph, NetworkX
 Fluency in English and strong communication skills – verbal, written, and ever learning


 What are we offering?


 International environment with daily usage of English
 Time for self-development + other trainings
 Flexible working hours + Home Office (most of the time)
 5 weeks of vacations + days off during 23.12. -31.12.
 3 Sick days
 Cafeteria system, Lunch credit

title: Data Engineer
description:
Job Description & Summary About the Financial Crime team 
 
 We focus on detecting Financial Crime. Our team serves as a regional centre of excellence that provides technical advisory to clients across the whole world so we work with clients in Europe, North America, Australia, Africa or South Asia. 
  We help our clients optimise anti-money laundering systems by enhancing them with machine learning. To enable us to deliver insights rapidly, we have a custom-developed cloud-based application that we strive to constantly improve. We have recently launched the second generation of the application. 
  Come and join the fast growing field of Financial Crime Analytics and help us combat money laundering and other types of financial fraud. 
 
Job description & summary 

(80 %) Work on client engagements 
   
Building data processing pipelines 
Assessing data quality 
Analysing data mainly about customers and monitoring alerts 

(10 %) Developing our digital assets 
   
Writing Python scripts and tests :) 
Creating CI/CD procedures 
Maintaining our infrastructure 

(5 %) Preparing new engagement proposals 
(5 %) Staying up-to-date with developments in the field of data engineering 


Requirements of the role 

At least a bachelor degree in Computer Science or a similar field, 1-3 years of experience in similar field 
Knowledge of good software development practices, design patterns and databases 
Knowledge of Python, Git, CI/CD, SQL and Docker 
Experience with Tableau, Power BI or a similar visualisation tool 
Experience with Kubernetes and Azure Cloud services is a plus 
Experience with tools for distributed processing like Dask, Ray, Hadoop and Spark is a plus 
Knowledge of frontend technologies is a plus 
Knowledge of the field of Anti-Financial Crime or Banking is a plus 
Good English both verbal and written 
Willingness to learn, take initiative and be challenged 
A confident communicator and a strong team member 
Willingness to travel if needed 


What are we offering? 

Concentrated experience and rapid career growth. It may sound like a platitude, but it really is. 
Fair wages plus paid overtime. 
Paid time off 25 days, 3 sick days and 2 extra days off from the company at the end of the year. 
High-end Ultrabook and iPhone with unlimited data. 
Benefit program with 45.000 points that you can use for holidays, education, food vouchers, sports (Multisport), health... Simply on what you enjoy. 
Supporting your development and education: business and digital skills training (e.g. Alteryx, Power BI, Tableau), ongoing training and certifications, e.g. Microsoft (Azure, PowerApps), project management (Prince2, PMI), service management (ITIL), agile development (Scrum, SAFe), DAMA, Salesforce, coaching and presentation skills and more. 
Opportunity to work in the future at a foreign PwC office, for example in the USA, Canada and there are others in the selection. 
Extra-work activities and Away Days (team building, ski weekend, etc.). 
Regular feedback on your work, also consultation with a coach with whom you can address your further development and career direction. 

 PwC is the largest audit team in the Czech Republic, law, tax, consulting and technology, data or forensic teams. Find out how easy it is to combine this knowledge when you're in the right place. 
With us, you will get the opportunity to see how business is done in large companies. We are part of an international network of companies with more than 250,000 colleagues in 158 countries. 

First, you will complete short online tests where you will find out how you are doing with logic and the ability to understand connections. After successfully passing the tests, you will have an interview and a case study. The last step is an interview with our partner, where you have to convince him of your personal qualities, for example, that you can also enjoy fun at work. We can do it all within a week. It's a challenge, but you want to work with the best and so do we! 

#LI-JOINPWCCZ

title: SAP BW Engineer(s) with data engineering flair
description:
Job Description

 Are you curious to learn and motivated to work with data and business intelligence in an IT organization? Or do you seek to use and improve your SAP-BW, HANA or Data Warehousing skills even further?

 Come join our amazing team and bring your great BI and data engineering ideas to the table and help us build a strong data foundation for the LEGO Group!

 We are hiring more positions on different seniority levels! It can be based in either Billund, Denmark or Budapest, Hungary.

 Core Responsibilities:
 As our BI Engineer(s) in the Data Office organization, you will become part of a team of great individuals who strive to build and improve a high-quality data foundation on The LEGO Group’s Data Platform.

 Your main responsibilities will be to:
 Your role as a BI Engineer will be to consistently contributing to the development of the Data Foundation, deepening your knowledge around Data Foundation technologies (tech: SAP-BW/HANA, API/Data Services, AWS, SQL, DBT, DataBricks & BeX, PowerBI, Tableau) and take ownership for the things that you work with. You will work within well-established practices and clearly defined scope of work, and you are a big great teammate who collaborates closely with your fellow team members and our customers. In addition, you will:



     Design, build and/or configure Data Foundation solutions, through close collaboration with the other product team members.
   


     Ensure implementation of business logic and business definitions in close collaboration with business partners. Secure product robustness and reliability in the trusted Data Foundation we are providing.
   


     Engineer the Data Foundation product to follow the highest development standards (incl. documentation and efficiency) and secure the highest standards of security and data privacy are followed.
   


     Build efficient and optimal solutions by challenging ideas/opinions and secure excellent quality is delivered to the users by securing proper unit and integration testing before deployment
   


     Suggest and define future stories to support the Product Owner
   


 Play your part in our team succeeding:
 The role of the Data Office is to drive value from data across The LEGO Group. Our team builds and runs our central Data Platform, and is a Centre of Excellence for data intelligence, data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence.

 Do you have what it takes?
 You come with few years hands-on experience delivering SAP-BW/HANA Data Foundation solutions, preferably in a business-facing role. you have experience in performing data analysis and data profiling using complex SQL on various source systems. Furthermore, you have:




     Strong communication skills with ability to communicate complex technical concepts and align organization on decisions with stakeholders of all levels of expertise
   


     Deep understanding of vendor-provided solutions and configuration practices (SAP BW/HANA)
   


     Actively shares knowledge and contributes to communities
   


     Some travelling might be required (5%)
   


 It will be an advantage if you have:



     Experience in any of the following BW reporting modules: Sales & Distribution, Finance, Material Management, Supply Chain Planning, Production Maintenance.
   


     Data tool integration experience (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, API, SDI/SDA).
   


     SQL and DataBricks.
   


     Cloud providers like AWS, Google Cloud, Azure.
   


 What’s in it for you?
 Here are some of what to expect:




 Family Care Leave – We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.
   


 Insurances – All colleagues are
     covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.
   


 Wellness – We want you to be your best self, so you’ll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programmes run by local teams where you are based.
   


 Colleague
Discount – We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.
   


 Bonus – We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached, you’ll be rewarded through our global bonus scheme.
   


 Your workplace – Our offices will be your primary workplace with flexibility to work from home during your working week. Your People Leader will discuss the principles of our hybrid work model, role eligibility and frequency with you.
   


 Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

 The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of e.g. race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity.

 The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

 Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

 Just imagine building your dream career.
 Then make it real.

 Join the LEGO®
   team today.







Location


     Budapest Off-Site, Hungary
   





 Job ID


     3-5633
   





 Category


     IT, Telecom & Internet

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
The Data Appeal Company is a highly tech-company that transforms geo-spatial, sentiment and market data into compelling, valuable insights that are simple and accessible. We are a dynamic and rapidly expanding company part of Almawave Group.
 We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join our Data Science Laboratory and contribute to the extraction of insights from data. The ideal candidate has a strong interest in numbers, data analysis and machine learning.
 What you’ll do

Work with the DS Lab team to provide complete solutions to business problems using data mining techniques, statistics, and data analysis
Design, develop and evaluate innovative models for predictive learning, working closely with the team
Work with large datasets using cutting-edge technologies
Automate procedures and algorithms

 Requirements 

Technical (STEM) degree (pref. Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, and Statistics)
PhD in a STEM area is a plus
Experience of 2-3 years in a similar role
Experience in location intelligence and/or smart cities analysis is a plus
Some knowledge of the AWS ecosystem, necessary to interact with the Engineering Team
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to use relational databases and knowledge of the SQL language
Strong knowledge of Python
Familiarity with Machine Learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, NLTK, spaCy) and numerical computing libraries (NumPy, Pandas, Dask, SciPy)
Curiosity and passion for data science
Teamwork and collaboration skills
Fluent in English

 Preferred skills

Docker & Kubernetes
Spark & Big Data
Hands-on experience in production systems
Experience with deep learning algorithms and knowledge of dedicated frameworks (Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch)

title: BIG DATA ENGINEER
description:
The Big Data Engineer will work withing the Advanced Analytics Solution, whose mission is to develop and operate end-to-end automation, analytics, and AI assets to improve the Company processes and business results. The Big Data Engineer will work in close collaboration with other resources from analytics, IT, and Architecture teams to develop, industrialize, and operate data pipelines, analytics/AI models and automation software for production. She/he will also be responsible to collaborate with IT department to manage the analytics environments used by the team in the current cloud-based architecture. The Big Data Engineer will support technology scouting and the definition of solutions and standards for Data & Analytics within the Company, being part of cross-functional working groups both at local and international level.
 



  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
 

Develop, optimize, and re-engineer data pipelines and analytics models;
Support team members in managing the cloud-based analytics infrastructure in coordination with the IT department;
Design and develop the activities needed to operate and monitor projects in production;
Deliver automation and analytics artifacts in line with project plans;
Support the scouting of new technologies, techniques and software in the Data & Analytics space;
Participate in cross-functional working groups to represent the needs of the Advanced Analytics team and contribute to target solution definition;





  KEY REQUIREMENTS/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE
  


Previous experience (e.g. 1-2 years) in Engineering, contributing to the development and operations of analytics/ AI assets in large-data contexts;
Master’s degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering. PhD or post-graduate courses in related fields (e.g. HPC, BDE, DS) is a plus;
Excellent knowledge of Python, PySpark, SQL, scripting, orchestration tools (Luigi, Airflow), as well as of software engineering;
Good knowledge of relational and non-relational DBs and good understanding of ETL, CDC, and data streaming tools and techniques;
Knowledge and experience of Microsoft Azure or AWS ecosystem 
Good knowledge of analytics and Big Data architectures (Kafka, Hadoop, Databricks, …), and of web and cloud technologies (Docker, Kubernetees, …). 
Fluent in Italian and English (both written and spoken)
Team spirit, self-motivation, and a proactive result-driven working style
Strong ability to work under pressure and sharply meet deadlines, self-organizing work
Strong analysis, problem-solving, and communication skills
Knowledge of statistics and data science topics, MLOps techniques, network communication protocols and project management will be considered as a plus


  Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.
 

  We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.
 

  Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.

title: Software Engineer - Launchpad
description:
Drive the future of collaborative open source development tooling as part of the Launchpad team. This is an opportunity for a motivated engineer with a passion for open source software, Linux, and web services to join our distributed team.
 Launchpad is a platform for managing open source development projects. It includes code hosting and review, bug tracking, package building, translations, and other facilities used by free and open source software developers. It provides essential development and collaboration infrastructure for major projects such as Ubuntu.
 Launchpad is a mature project, mainly written in Python (primarily Zope, with some Flask). You'll be striking a balance between keeping our business-critical services running and expanding our feature set: among other things, we are currently working on expanding our package building capabilities, improving the development flows provided to our users, and modernising our web UI. If you love keeping large projects well-organised and well-maintained, care about supporting developers, and believe that continuous improvement is the key to innovation, higher velocity, and reliability, you'll fit right in.
 Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
 What you'll do

Proactively collaborate within and contribute to design, architecture, and feature-selection for solutions across distributed teams
Write high-quality, API-first Python code with unit tests
Debug issues and produce high-quality fixes
Review code produced by other engineers
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 times a year for internal and external events

Who you are

You love technology, working with brilliant people, and solving interesting problems
You are a strategic thinker
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You have proficiency delivering robust code to production, preferably written in Python.
You have experience and enjoy maintaining and improving large and mature web applications.
You have experience with databases, ORMs (PostgreSQL a plus), data management, and data modelling.
You have an interest in, or experience with, integration, infrastructure and operations.
You believe that robust security requires conscious efforts at every stage of delivery.
You have familiarity with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
You have a solid understanding of the structure of various software packaging systems, including Debian/Ubuntu packages.

Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.
 #LI-remote
 #stack

title: AIT Engineer
description:
Job Description: 
Mission of the Job 
The main objectives of the role are the Mechanical and Thermal AIT/AIV Engineering activities at unit and payload level for space and SatCom application 
Main activities 
Contribution to the overall V&V (Verification & Validation) process for mechanical and thermal activities, including 

Contribution to the definition of the system mechanical, thermal Integration and alignment logic. 
perform and manage continuous integration, validation and verification activities up to customer acceptance of the final system. 
Verify that the system's requirements are correctly & completely implemented. 
contribution to VCD and AIT/AIV Plan 

Contribution to the overall V&V (Verification & Validation) process for mechanical and thermal activities, including 

Contribution to the definition of the system mechanical, thermal Integration and alignment logic. 
perform and manage continuous integration, validation and verification activities up to customer acceptance of the final system. 
Verify that the system's requirements are correctly & completely implemented. 
contribution to VCD and AIT/AIV Plan 


Mechanical and Thermal Assembly, integration and test activities 

During the design phase, responsible for the ‘design for manufacture’ activities and for the verification of accessibility, integrability and maintainability of the parts of the system under design. 
Develop, implement and support mechanical and thermal integration and tests procedures and processes to fulfil requirements from Engineering, Quality and Health, Safety and Environment. 
Definition of test methods, test sequences and specific test setups (vibration test, thermal tests, thermal vacuum tests) 
Definition of the procurement specifications and technical follow-up of the external procurement of test means, tools and Mechanical Ground Support Equipment. 
Supervision and support of the shop floor activities during the mechanical and thermal assembly, integration and test activities. 
Supervision and support of the shop floor activities during the antenna and payload alignment activities. 
For fully recurrent products, autonomous monitoring, data post processing for vibration test campaign and test report release (sine and random tests) 
Support anomalies investigations to identify root causes. 
Coordination of preventive and corrective maintenance of the MGSEs during the project life 
For ground and Satcom applications, contribution to the definition of preventive and corrective maintenance activities required during life cycle of the product, consistent with regulation and program requirements. 
Ability to comply with the cleanroom and workshop Health, Safety Environment and cleanliness rules. 
Contribution to first level Quality inspection, FOD (Foreign Object Damage/Debris) prevention and to continuous improvement 

Education/Training: 
Essential : 

Master’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or Aerospace Engineering 

Desirable : Post-graduation degree 
Experience: 
Essential : 

At least 5÷10 years of work experience on AIT/AIV Mechanical and Thermal Engineering, including: 
   
integration and test procedure preparation, 
consolidated experience on mechanical and thermal testing by means of the most common measurement techniques and instrumentation, 
analysis of test results and test report preparation 


Desirable 

background in projects in the frame of ECSS standard

MS Office 
Solidworks 
Nastran (desiderable) 
Patran (desiderable) 

Languages: 

Fluent in English 

Behaviours: 

Excellent communication skills. 
Excellent priority management 
Team player 
Proactive and flexible approach

title: Data Engineer
description:
Dreaming big is in our DNA. Brewing the world’s most loved beers and creating meaningful experiences is what inspires us. We are owners, empowered to lead real change, deliver on tough challenges, and take accountability for the results. We are looking for talent that shares these values, that is ambitious, bold & resilient. We want talent that is looking for fast career growth, cross-functional experiences, global exposure and robust training & development.
 


   Descripción:
 


   Diseñar y desarrollar trabajos ETL en entornos de big data para procesar grandes cantidades de datos
 

   Crear marcos o trabajos reutilizables que se puedan usar en diferentes proyectos
 

   Administrar transformaciones de calidad de datos y servicios de datos mediante SQL
 

   Mejora continua y pruebas de rendimiento propias: documentar los problemas relacionados con ETL y realice RCA, identificar trabajos de ejecución prolongada y oportunidades de optimización
 


   Requisitos:
 


Experiencia práctica en diseño ETL, mapeo de origen y destino, desarrollo y ajuste de rendimiento de código ETL complejo en lenguajes como R o Python
Experiencia trabajando con GIT, SVN o VSTS
Experiencia en la conexión a fuentes heterogéneas, incluidas SAP ECC (extracción de flujo de datos ABAP), Hive, Azure, Salesforce, entre otras
Experiencia con múltiples formatos de archivo y objetos de ubicación de archivos, incluidos SFTP, FTP, local, HDFS, ADLS, BLOB
Conocimiento de Dimensión que cambia lentamente, Esquema de estrella, Esquema de copo de nieve, OLTP y OLAP
Experiencia práctica de plataformas en la nube, especialmente Microsoft Azure
Competente en inglés y español.



   Competencias:
 


   Un verdadero emprendedor, que sueña en grande y está motivado por un entorno desafiante y acelerado.
 

   Capacidad para gestionar prioridades en conflicto bajo presión
 

   Sólidas habilidades de gestión de relaciones, comunicación y colaboración: trabajar eficazmente con audiencias técnicas
 


   Lugar de trabajo: Ciudad de México

title: Data Engineer (Python)
description:
Do našeho týmu hledáme kolegu, který by nám pomohl s návrhem, implementací a rozšiřováním datových pipelines. Vyvíjíme interní BigData aplikace pro extrakci a zpracování různých typů dat (e-com, telekomunikace). Začínali jsme v roce 2018, jako malý startup. Nyní již máme roční obrat nad 100 milionů a rosteme vesmírnou rychlostí! I přes aktuální těžké časy jsme stabilní firmou, která vždy ocení dobře odvedenou práci. 
 


Tvé aplikace budou generovat data pro různé typy reportů (webové, statické, pro různé BI nástroje). Tvojí zodpovědností bude je navrhovat a implementovat. Je tedy nutné komunikovat s vývojáři/product managery zodpovědnými za frontendovou část systému, případně s business analytiky zodpovědnými za konkrétní řešení.

 Nemusíš umět vše, důležité je mít chuť učit se a my tě na vše rádi zaučíme!

title: Big Data Engineer
description:
Are you an experienced Big data engineer and you would like to be part of a project that will bring Scandinavia's largest bank a new reporting system for its more than 10 million customers? Come and see further information :) 
 


We are building a new customer account reporting engine to (over the coming years) replace our existing legacy customer account reporting solutions across our home markets. A pre-requisite is that we consolidate all account and payment transaction data in the bank to Hadoop, so we have dozens of data formats and integration points both upstream and downstream. The project has the objective to deliver new reports to all 10M customers in the Nordics, consisting of billions of transactions a month.
 What you'll be doing:
 You willbe responsible for a successful design and implementation of a high-performing, flexible, robust, scalable and easily maintainable global reporting solution for the Bank. Actively cooperating with Product Owner, Solution Architects, Analysts, Testers and Developers. Working in an SAFe Agile team Description of knowledge and experience.

title: Part-time - Junior Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Overview: 
  IDC is seeking part-time Data Analytics Engineer who will join our newly established Data Analytics team based in Prague, Czech Republic. In this role you will leverage the most modern cloud solutions to collect, import, load, clean, integrate and process data from numerous diverse big datasets. You will help to design and build new data platform which will enable a completely new product. That will assist technology vendors to effectively assess their markets, customers, and competitors.

 Why IDC?

 IDC is the most respected global technology market research firm. We are changing the way the world thinks about the impact of technology on business and society. Our people, data, and analytics create global technology insights that accelerate customer success. 
IDC was recognized by the Institute of Industry Analyst Relations (IIAR) as the 
2022 Analyst Firm of the Year
 for the third consecutive year, for delivering critical, timely insights in coordinated efforts around the world, during a time when our customers faced unprecedented challenges.


 Our collaborative, innovative and entrepreneurial culture is the perfect place for you to discover your future! We are just getting started! Responsibilities: 
 
Work closely with the data science team and business department to develop data models and cloud pipelines for research, reporting, and machine learning.
 Use data and build up to date datasets to solve business problems, answer questions and improve processes.
 Help drive scalable data sharing and integration practices.
 Define metrics, guidelines and strategies for effective use of algorithms and data.
 Design, build and maintain machine learning systems and self-running AI software to automate predictive models.
 Research and implement machine learning algorithms and tools to make predictions according to business needs.
 Build and maintain the infrastructure required for optimal ETL frameworks and processes that collect, import, load, clean, integrate and process data from various internal and external data sources using SQL and AWS technologies.
 Qualifications: 
  Qualifications

 Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in computer science, data science, information technology, mathematics, or related fields. Applies also to students who are finishing bachelor’s degree.
 Demonstrated strong technical knowledge of programming in Python.
 Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases.
 School-level understanding of ML models
 Proven ability to work independently and ensure completion of tasks accurately and on time.
 Strong English communication skills in both verbal and written form.
 Open to learn new technologies and tools.

 Preferred Qualifications

 Data engineering in a cloud environment.
 Familiarity with the AWS ecosystem.
 Proven work experience with Snowflake, PostgreSQL, Airflow, Neo4j, NoSQL databases, or AI/ML is an advantage

title: Data Engineer - Remote, Full-Time
description:
Bluelight Consulting is a leading software consultancy seeking a skilled Data Engineer to join our fast-growing team. Our mission is to design and develop technology that improves the lives of its users while providing an exceptionally high level of service to our clients.
  


 We are looking for Data Engineer who wants to be part of a fast-paced, dynamic environment, where everyone’s opinions and efforts are valued. We hire outstanding individuals and give them the opportunity to thrive in a collaborative atmosphere that values learning, growth, and hard work.
  


 Our team is distributed across the United State and Central / South America. If you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, and rapidly-growing software development consultancy, and if you are passionate about software development and creating the finest apps in the marketplace, please apply below.
  



What We Are Looking For


 Experience with AWS services including but not limited to S3, Athena, EC2, EMR, and Glue.
 Ability to solve any ongoing issues with operating the cluster.
 Experience with the integration of data from multiple data sources.
 Experience with various database technologies such as SQLServer, Redshift, Postgres, and RDS.
 Experience with one or more of the following data integration platforms: Pentaho Kettle, SnapLogic, Talend OpenStudio, Jitterbit, Informatica PowerCenter, or similar.
 Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service.
 Experience with or knowledge of Agile Software Development methodologies.
 Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
 Excellent oral and written communication skills with a keen sense of customer service.
 Experience with collecting/managing/reporting on large data stores.
 Awareness of Data governance and data quality principles.
 Well versed in Business Analytics including basic metric building and troubleshooting.
 Understand Integration architecture: application integration and data flow diagrams, source-to-target mappings, data dictionary reports.
 Familiar with Web Services: XML, REST, SOAP.
 Experience with Git or similar version control software.
 Experience with integrations with and/or use of BI tools such as GoodData (Prefered), Tableau, PowerBI, or similar.
 Broad experience with multiple RDBMS: MS SQLServer, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redshift.
 Familiarity with SaaS/cloud data systems (e.g. Salesforce).
 Data warehouse design: star-schemas, change data capture, denormalization.
 SQL/DDL queries/Tuning techniques such as indexing, sorting, and distribution.
 BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.
 3+ years of Data Pipeline development such as SnapLogic or Datastage, Informatica, or related experience.
 3+ years of SQL experience (No-SQL experience is a plus).
 Experience designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines.






What You'll Be Doing


 Develop and maintain data models for core package application and reporting databases to describe objects and fields for support documentation and to facilitate custom application development and data integration.
 Monitoring execution and performance of daily pipelines, triage and escalate any issues.
 Collaborates with analytics and business teams to improve data models and data pipelines that feed business intelligence tools, increasing data accessibility and fostering data-driven decision-making across the organization.
 Implements processes and systems to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes.
 Writes unit/integration tests, contributes to engineering wiki, and documents work.
 Performs data analysis required to troubleshoot data-related issues and assist in the resolution of data issues.
 Work within AWS/Linux cloud systems environment in support of data integration solution
 Works closely with a team of frontend and backend engineers, product managers, and analysts.
 Teamwork: Collaborate with team members. Share knowledge, provide visibility of interpersonal accomplishments and follow directions when provided.






Company Benefits


 Competitive salary and bonuses, including performance-based salary increases
 Generous paid-time-off policy
 Technology / Office stipend
 100% remote work, now and post COVID
 Continuing education, training, conferences
 Company-sponsored coursework, exams, and certifications






   Being a software consultant is a fun, challenging, and rewarding career choice for engineers. Your contributions are highly valued by clients, and the work you do often has a direct and significant impact on the client’s business.
  


 You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects for our incredible clients, which will help you quickly improve as a consultant and software engineer. You will get to work with modern languages and frameworks alongside some of the best developers in the world!
  


 So if you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, rapidly-growing software consultancy, please apply. #LI-Remote

title: Senior Software Engineer (Frontend, Backend and Full-Stack) (Remote)
description:
Helium Health is accelerating Africa’s transition to a technology and data-driven healthcare sector. We provide a suite of solutions that serve as the digital infrastructure for all healthcare stakeholders in Africa: providers, payers, patients & governments.
  


 We are looking to hire Senior Frontend, Backend and Full-Stack Software Engineers who will be responsible for all aspects of the development and delivery of applications.
  


 Frontend Engineer




      Collaborate with product managers, designers and developers to conceptualize and build new products, features and changes that’ll radically improve user experience
    


      Write well-documented code for features, tests and other front-end web and mobile application components

      Work with internal and external stakeholders; motivating, persuading, and negotiating towards a positive outcome.
    


 Interested candidates must have the following;




      Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline with at least 5 years of professional experience as a software engineer
    


      Good knowledge of any modern framework like React, Vue, Angular or Ember
    


      Good knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3 APIs
    


      Experience in styling with solutions like Styled Components/CSS Modules/PostCSS/Sass/Less
    


      Experience with modern front-end workflows: git flow, project management tools, unit and E2E testing, build tools, REST APIs, CLIs, CI/CD
    


      Managing complex application state with Redux/Vue
    



 Backend Engineer




      Support and maintain existing production code in the field and develop and deliver new enhancements and products to our client base.
    


      Collaborate with product management, operations, quality and front-end engineers to deliver the right solution.
    


      Develop reliable, high performance service applications using Elixir, Phoenix and PHP.
    


      Provision, configure, and develop against remote infrastructure in AWS.
    



 Interested candidates must have the following;




      Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline with at least 3 - 6 years of professional experience with Elixir/PHP or similar languages
    


      Integration of user-facing elements developed by a front-end developer with our API
    


      Building reusable code and libraries for future use
    


      Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
    


      Optimisation of the application for maximum speed and scalability
    


      Separation of centralised services into micro services
    


      Experience with Git, Jenkins, Docker, Ansible/Chef/Puppet or similar tools
    


      Pride in readable, well-designed, well-tested software.
    


      Experience with relational databases (PostGreSQL, MySQL) and key-value stores (Memcache, Redis)
    


      Good oral and written communication skills

title: Analytics Engineer II
description:
ACV’s mission is to build and enable the most trusted and efficient digital marketplaces for buying and selling used vehicles with transparency and comprehensive data that was previously unimaginable. We are powered by a combination of the world’s best people and the industry’s best technology. At ACV, we are driven by an entrepreneurial spirit and rewarded with a work environment that enables each teammate to impact the company from day one. ACV’s network of brands includes ACV Auctions, ACV Transportation, MAX Digital and ACV Capital within its Marketplace Products as well as True360 and Data Services. 


What are we looking for:
 The Analytics Engineer’s primary objective is to serve the needs of ACV and its customers. This role is focused primarily on doing analysis for business needs and immediate queries from stakeholders on multiple product and tech teams. The Analytics Engineer III’s primary objective is to identify and develop solutions to the needs of ACV and its customers. This role is focused primarily on designing and executing analysis for business needs across multiple teams. 


What you’ll be doing:


Focus on doing analysis for business needs and immediate queries from stakeholders on other teams
Build reports and dashboards to give stakeholders visibility into relevant metrics
Develop and analyze large data sets
Focus on the fundamentals of great questions, good process, competent analysis, clear communication, team wins, and focused contribution to the company’s needs
With leadership guidance, be able to present analysis of a business area to stakeholders and support follow on questions, converting business questions into technical requirements

What you will need:


Excellent Microsoft Excel and Visualization skills (Tableau, Mixpanel etc.) and SQL Data-driven and highly analytical
Able to translate data and trends into powerful strategies and compelling messaging
Ability to listen with an ear to the overarching goal, not just the immediate concern that started the query
Demonstrate excellent skill and maturity, be self-motivated as well as team-oriented, and have the ability to support the development and implementation of solutions to meet the needs of our customers

Nice to Have:


MS in Statistics, Operations Research, or similar computationally intensive degree
Experience with distributed computation systems like Spark or Dask
Experience on AWS or Google Cloud

What we will offer:


Generous Time Off. At ACV, we understand the importance of work/life balance and just because we love what we do, does not mean we want to always be working.
Learning & Development Opportunities!
We love to see our engineers grow and learn and have invested heavily in our internal Learning and Development program, which provides access to PluralSight, Frontend Masters, as well as in-person conferences.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
About GlossGenius
 GlossGenius is building an ecosystem enabling entrepreneurs to succeed. We empower small businesses owners to focus on being creators, not admins, by offering a range of business management tools including booking and scheduling, marketing, analytics, payment processing and much more.
 Tens of thousands of small business owners have chosen to rely on GlossGenius every day to run their entire set of business operations. With its powerful, intuitive platform, GlossGenius is some part a fintech company, some part an SMB software company, while its vibrant, distinguished brand makes it some part a consumer company.
 About the Role
 As a Senior Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for building and fine tuning a scalable data warehouse that drives impactful business outcomes as GlossGenius continues to grow. You will partner cross-functionally with analytics, data engineering and data savvy business stakeholders to design reliable and consistent datasets, identify opportunities for improvement across business verticals, and scale data-driven decision making with self-serve data assets.
 You will report to the Head of Data and can work remotely from anywhere in Canada.
 What You'll Do

Build, maintain, refactor and optimize data models in our dbt project
Serve as the architect for our dbt project as a whole
Create a consistent user experience across our warehouse and BI tools
Mentor and uplevel analysts and data engineers in data modeling and dbt best practices
Partner with the Data Engineering team to manage our data stack
Be a champion of data privacy and quality

What We're Looking For

4+ years of experience as an analytics engineer, data engineer, or business intelligence engineer and 2+ years developing in dbt, ideally at a SaaS company
Advanced proficiency in SQL
Previous experience with data modeling, ETL/ELT development principles, and data warehousing concepts
A demonstrated self-starter with strong communication and project management skills
Familiarity with the technologies in our stack (Segment, Fivetran, Snowflake, dbt, Looker) is a plus
Experience with managing Snowflake costs is a plus

Benefits & Perks

Flexible PTO
Competitive health & dental insurance options, with premiums covered by GG
Generous, fully-paid parental leave policy
Professional Development - employees receive a yearly stipend for approved learning and educational-related expenses
One-time home office stipend
Team Bonding opportunities - annual company retreat for entire team, plus virtual events throughout the year

In order to enter the NY office or participate in any in-person events, all employees must show proof of vaccination against COVID-19. For those individuals who are unable to be vaccinated, GlossGenius will engage in an interactive process to determine a reasonable accommodation.
 At GlossGenius, we celebrate our differences and are committed to creating a workplace where all employees feel supported and empowered to do their best work. We believe this benefits not only our employees but our product, customers, and community as well. GlossGenius is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.

title: Graduate Engineer
description:
Human Resources | Adelaide Metropolitan 
  

   Closing date: 04/02/2023
   




Osmoflo Water Management Pty Ltd is an environmentally friendly leading Global designer, manufacturer, operator and maintainer of advanced water and wastewater systems working across different industries, markets, and international locations.
We are seeking Graduate Engineers, ideally with a Bachelor of Mechanical or Electrical Engineering with the ‘right Osmoflo attitude’ – a ‘can do’ approach, positive outlook, energy, and motivation to deliver.
The successful candidate will take part in Osmoflo’s Graduate Program, where they will undertake four-6 month rotations within the Innovation, Operations, Projects, and Proposal teams. Osmoflo is keen to meet a motivated individual who is a self-starter, passionate about making a difference, ready to take the next step in their career.
In addition to a great attitude, you will require:

Bachelor of Mechanical or Electrical Engineering.
The ability to conduct research, analyze data and produce simple reports
The ability to attend local and remote site locations on an ad-hoc basis
Excellent written and spoken communication skills.
A commitment to enthusiastically attend and undertake Reverse Osmosis specific technical training
An ability to maintain working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
Commitment to completing tasks with a high attention to detail and a focus on delivering quality Engineering outcomes to key stakeholders and clients.
A “people person” with excellent written and spoken communication and interpersonal skills.
Well-developed Computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite.

If you are ready to take on your next challenge and kickstart your career in Engineering, please apply by COB on 31st January 2023
For a confidential discussion, please contact Shiné Beukes, Human Resources on (08) 8282 9700 or at shine.beukes@osmoflo.com
Applications for this position are not accepted through recruitment agencies or search firms.

title: Quantity Surveyor
description:
Job Description: 
Quantity Surveyor 
Bahrain 

What You’ll Be Doing 

The Quantity Surveyor will assist the Senior Quantity Surveyor in the analysis and evaluation of all contractor claims by the contractor and other contractual matters. 
Assist the SQS in all matters relating to the financial and contractual aspects of the project. 
Participate, record and assist in the preparation of the minutes of the progress meetings. 
Provide support to the SQS on all financial and contractual matters throughout the course of the work in the project. 
Participate in all commercial meetings. 
Liaise with the SQS to ensure prompt submittal and completeness of Contractors monthly payment applications and assist the SQS in finalizing the payment certificates. 
Maintain and streamline all cost and quantity records. 
Advise the SRE and REs on measurement procedures and calculation of interim and final quantities. 
Evaluate the unit rates for new work items and present to the SQS for review. 
Participate in recording the details and monitor the day works recording and process. 
Assist the SQS in the preparation of variation orders. 
Participate in the Evaluate contractual claims for review by the SQS. 
Participate in the evaluation and recommendation of entitlement of Contractors claims for review and issuance by the SQS. 
Advice on contractual matters related to financial issues. 
Ensure completeness and validity of all contractual requirements. 
Monitor the contractor’s resource allocation. 
Assist the SQS in the preparation of financial statements for monthly report. 
Partake in the auditing of payments to Contractors. 
Check and record measurements of completed work. 
Monitor contracts final cost estimates. 
Assist the SQS in the review, negotiation and preparation of claim settlements with the Contract’s Department of Client and the Engineer (PMC). 
Participate in the preparation of Final Accounts with all supporting documentation. 


What Required Skills You’ll Bring 

Degree in Quantity Surveying, Civil Engineering, or related field and minimum 12 years experience in Quantity Surveying on major road, highway and general infrastructure construction projects preferably in the Gulf region. 
Experience in the planning or major projects with particular emphasis on the utilization of computer programs such as Primavera or equally capable program for the planning and tracking of similar projects is a requirement. Will provide assistance to the team during negotiations, arbitration, or any other forms of dispute resolution. 
Must be fully computer literate and able to utilize computer technology to access data, maintain records, generate reports, and any project specific engineering and construction relevant software. 
Must be fluent in English both written and spoken with an excellent capability in written technical skills as well as oral and written communication skills . 


What Desired Skills You’ll Bring 

The Quantity Surveyor will be providing all necessary assistance to the construction supervision team concerning all financial aspects and contractual matters in the project. Will participate in the review and approval of interim payments, project variations and other financial matters. 


Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Not Applicable/None 
 Parsons is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. Minority/Female/Disabled/Protected Veteran.

title: Service Delivery Engineer 2 (I6)
description:
Técnico residente de Prestação de Serviços
 Os clientes da Dell Technologies confiam em nossos produtos e serviços para impulsionar o progresso. Por isso, levamos o serviço que prestamos muito a sério. A prestação de serviços tem tudo a ver com garantir que nossas soluções técnicas ajudem os clientes a cumprir suas prioridades, desafios e iniciativas. Como consultores de confiança, construímos um conhecimento profundo do que cada cliente deseja alcançar.
 Em seguida, garantimos que os serviços prestados pela Dell Technologies cumprem todas as nossas promessas. Também trabalhamos em estreita colaboração com colegas de vendas e serviços globais para desenvolver planos estratégicos de crescimento de contas e para identificar e buscar oportunidades de vendas.
 Junte-se a nós como Técnico residente em nossa equipe de Serviços Profissionais em São Paulo para fazer o melhor trabalho de sua carreira e causar um profundo impacto social.
 O que você vai conseguir:
 Como Técnico residente de Prestação de Serviços, você fornecerá suporte de entrega de classe mundial aos nossos clientes, construindo um conhecimento profundo das prioridades e iniciativas de nossos clientes e tornando-se um consultor confiável que evita o impacto do cliente e facilita a melhoria contínua.
 Você irá:
 Atender as necessidades do nosso cliente, identificando vendas potenciais e oportunidades de crescimento dentro das atividades vigentes:

Executando atividades específicas de suporte de entrega para um único cliente
Auxiliando na coordenação do desenvolvimento e consolidação de documentação técnica e de processo.
Concentrando-se em atividades como análise de dados e relatórios
Auxiliando na análise de problemas específicos com o cliente
Fazendo parceria com a(s) equipe(s) da Dell para fornecer uma experiência excepcional ao cliente.


 Dê o primeiro passo para a carreira dos seus sonhos:
 Cada membro da equipe da Dell Technologies traz algo exclusivo para a mesa. Aqui está o que estamos procurando com esta posição:

 Requisitos essenciais:

 Relevante experiência com Windows OS, Active directory e antivirus
 Capacidade de definir prioridades e delegar tarefas durante o atendimento ao cliente.
 Excelentes habilidades analíticas e de resolução de problemas
 Disponibilidade para atuar de forma híbrida na região da Av. Paulista, em SP.
 Graduação Completa em cursos relacionados.

 Requisitos Desejáveis:

 Pós-graduação
 Inglês Avançado

 Here’s our story; now tell us yours
 A Dell Technologies ajuda organizações e indivíduos a construir um amanhã digital mais brilhante. Nossa empresa é composta por mais de 150.000 pessoas, localizadas em mais de 180 localidades ao redor do mundo. Temos orgulho de ser uma equipe diversa e inclusiva e temos uma paixão infinita por nossa missão de impulsionar o progresso humano.   O mais importante para nós é que você seja respeitado, sinta que pode ser você mesmo e ter a oportunidade de fazer o melhor trabalho de sua vida - enquanto ainda tem uma vida. Oferecemos excelentes benefícios, programas de bônus, acordos de trabalho flexíveis, uma variedade de oportunidades de desenvolvimento de carreira, grupos de recursos para funcionários e muito mais.  Começamos com computadores, mas não paramos por aí. Estamos ajudando os clientes a avançar para o futuro com várias nuvens, IA e aprendizado de máquina por meio do portfólio de tecnologia e serviços mais inovadores para a era dos dados. 
Junte-se a nós e faça parte do que vem a seguir em tecnologia, a partir de hoje. 
Você também pode aprender mais sobre nós lendo nosso último Relatório de Diversidade e Inclusão e nosso plano para tornar o mundo um lugar melhor até 2030here.
 Data de encerramento da inscrição: 27 de Janeiro de 2023
 A Dell está comprometida com o princípio de igualdade de oportunidades de emprego para todos os funcionários e em fornecer aos funcionários um ambiente de trabalho livre de discriminação e assédio. Todas as decisões de emprego na Dell são baseadas nas necessidades de negócios, requisitos de trabalho e qualificações individuais, independentemente de raça, cor, religião ou crença, nacionalidade, origem social ou étnica, sexo (incluindo gravidez), idade, deficiência física, mental ou sensorial, Status de HIV, orientação sexual, identidade e/ou expressão de gênero, estado civil, união civil ou parceria doméstica, serviço militar passado ou atual, histórico médico familiar ou informações genéticas, status familiar ou parental ou qualquer outro status protegido por leis ou regulamentos nas localidades onde atuamos. A Dell não tolerará discriminação ou assédio com base em qualquer uma dessas características. A Dell incentiva candidatos de todas as idades. Leia a Política de Oportunidades Iguais de Emprego completa aqui.
