title: Data Engineer with MS SQL skills, Investment Management Solution
description:
Remote.Brazil
 Remote.Colombia
 Remote.Uruguay




         Big team (20+ people)
       

         Team extension
       
















         CLIENT
       

         Our client is one of the world’s top 10 investment companies with headquarters in Great Britain. They are building a data market that will aggregate and process investment data from multiple data feeds and systems like stock exchanges, news feeds, stock exchange brokers, internal quantitative systems, and others.
       








         PROJECT OVERVIEW
       

         This project is a part of the Data Market program. Our client has several services in the US (Chicago) in which data should be migrated and replicated from MSSQL databases to the new platform based on CDP. After finishing this assignment, you may join another project, depending on your skills.
       








           We invite you to our company, not a project
         









         TEAM
       

         You will be working directly with business stakeholders, Business and data analysts and a dedicated QAA engineer.
        


The whole program team involves around 90 various specialists (30 Big Data engineers, 10 data and business analysts, InterSystems cache developers, Java developers, Quantitative analysts/developers, etc.).









         POSITION OVERVIEW
       

         We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer with MS SQL skills to join our project team. You will be implementing data migration from corporate investment services to CDP.
       







         TECHNOLOGY STACK
       

         MSSQL, CDP, Hive + Impala, HDFS
       










          Responsibilities
        


 Communicating with stakeholders, which are fund and asset managers, investment business developers, and program and product managers, to clarify their needs
 Communicating with CDP platform tech leads and architects to define platform capabilities. 
Plan and execute data migration
 Plan and implement data replication after migration





          Requirements
        


 3-5+ years of experience or over 3-5 completed projects
 Strong experience with MS SQL
 Strong experience with Hive and Impala
 Hands-on experience with HDFS
 Knowledge of data management fundamentals (data modelling, ELT/ETL, data quality, metadata management, data warehouse/lakes patterns, distributed systems)
 Good spoken and written English





          Nice to have
        


 Experience working in an Agile environment and understanding various phases of the software development life cycle
 Experience working with Hadoop (MapReduce, HBase)
 Experience working with Apache NiFi
 Hands-on experience with Spark 2.0 or greater (+ Scala)
 Knowledge of any data & analytics (storage and processing) stack (e.g. AWS/Azure/GCP data stacks, Snowflake, Apache Hadoop/Spark, Databricks, etc) 
Experience with Data modelling
 Skills working with Airflow or Oozie
 Experience with CDP (Cloudera Data Platform)
 Knowledge of Hadoop architecture components
 Knowledge of programming language (Scala, Python, Java, C#, etc)








         USEFUL LINKS
       




            More on work at DataArt
          






            How to grow at DataArt
          






            Colleagues, offices, ducks
          













     WE OFFER
   




       Vacation
     

       As per the laws of your country. We do ask you to take a proper rest
     




       Health insurance
     

       We help you to take out an insurance policy for you and your loved ones
     




       Sick pay
     

       10 days without a doctor's note, afterwards - as per the laws of your country
     












       Time off for state holidays
     

       According to the official calendar, regardless of the client’s schedule
     




       Pleasant environment
     

       Two large corporate parties and many small get-togethers for colleagues
     




       Comfort service
     

       Solving technical and everyday problems at work
     













       The benefits package may vary depending on the region and the type of contract

title: Computing Platform Engineer for Flight Test Installation (m/f)
description:
Job Description: 
You are a Computing Platform Engineer and you'd like to develop new test means for the next generation of aircraft such as the ZEROe aircraft? 
This job is made for you! 

A vacancy for a Computing Platform Engineer for Flight Test Installation (m/f) has arisen within Airbus Commercial Aircraft in Toulouse. You will join the Flight and Integration Test Centre, especially the Enhanced Systems team composed of electronic, systems and software engineers. 

Our special features! 
We work close to our test aircraft, we know them well and we enjoy it! 
Innovation is part of our DNA! Staying at the forefront of technology is key: we continuously screen new technologies available on the market (IoT devices, wireless connectivity, new processors, new software architectures and graphical displays, artificial intelligence,...), test and integrate them into new devices, make them fly and have fun! 

Your mission: 
As a technical project leader, your mission will be to manage technical activities linked to Flight Test core components, and more precisely to computing platforms (from small-scale IoT boards to large-scale powerful cluster computing) which are used in our test aircraft to process and display data coming from a large range of sources (such as sensors or aircraft systems). 

You will be accountable of the following tasks: 

Perform technical project management tasks such as reporting, documentation writing, quality follow-up 
Lead the development of new computing platforms: collect new needs and specify technical requirements, launch purchase orders, drive development with suppliers, qualification, functional tests, integration and deployment on test aircraft 
Lead maintenance (control of equipment) and operational support activities in close collaboration with operational teams 
Manage obsolescence to anticipate operational issues 


You will work in a multi-skilled group of people, working on both hardware and software development and support, interacting with a lot of stakeholders such as technical specialists, project managers, support functions leaders, operational teams,... 

This role will involve some travel for business and as such you must be able to travel accordingly. 

Required skills: 

Educated to Master's degree level (or equivalent) in computer science with strong knowledge in hardware part of servers and workstations, knowledge in Unix/Linux Operating Systems, network and security 
Experience in IT asset management, hardware tests, hardware qualification 
Experience in project management 
Curiosity, Team player, Rigor 


Ref: JR10152328 / #LI-AM 

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth. 

Company: Airbus Operations SAS 
 
Contract Type: Permanent Contract / CDI / Unbefristet / Contrato indefinido 
 
Experience Level: Professional / Expérimenté(e) / Professionell / Profesional 
 
Job Family: Testing <JF-EN-ET> 
 
By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.  Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief. 
Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com . 

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

title: Data Engineer
description:
The Data Engineer supports the design, implementation and maintenance of data flow channels and data processing systems that support the collection, storage, batch and real-time processing, and analysis of information in a scalable, repeatable and secure manner. He/She focuses on defining optimal solutions to data collection, processing and warehousing. He designs, codes and tests data systems and works on implementing those into the internal infrastructure. He focuses on collecting, parsing, managing, analysing and visualising large sets of data to turn information into insights accessible through multiple platforms. 

 He is passionate about numbers and works with large data sets. He has a keenness for understanding business processes and resolving challenges in order to provide solutions with the help of clean and interlinked databases and architectures. 
Qualifications 

 Diploma/Degree in Computer science. 

 Minimum 4 years experience in data models and reporting packages. 

 Ability to analyse large datasets, data model and interpret data pattern. 

 Experience in develop reporting and visualization through any Business Intelligent tools. 

 Hands-on experience in transforming functional specifications into design specifications. 

 Hands-on experience in SQL, or any related RDBMS database. 

 Experience in Dot Net, Python, or any related OOP language. 

 Good to have ETL/ELT experience, specifically on Microsoft SSIS. 

 Good problem solving & communication skills. 

 Working experience with Qlik Sense is a plus.

title: Junior Data Engineer at Proton Therapy Leader
description:
Who are we?

 IBA is a listed company, headquartered in Belgium, and employs 1500 people across the globe mobilizing their skills and passion to Protect, Enhance and Save lives
  We develop, manufacture and support innovative equipment and software solutions for diagnostic, cancer treatment, and industrial applications.
  Innovating for life since more than 30 years, IBA has opened new ways to diagnose and fight cancer and become the worldwide technology leader in the field of Proton Therapy, which is today the most advanced technologies treatment against cancer. Our core particle accelerators knowledge is unparalleled, with 100,000 patients treated on our proton therapy solutions and over 550 accelerators in operation globally.
 

One Mission, 4 business lines

 IBA ‘s world class expertise lies in the development of:
  next generation Proton Therapy technologies
  Radiopharmaceuticals providing oncology care providers with premium quality services and equipment
  Dosimetry advanced solutions for Quality Assurance of medical equipment and increased patient safety
  particle accelerators for the Industrial and medical world.
 
 Our 4 business lines are employing more than 1,500 passionate professionals worldwide dedicated to our Mission: Protect, Enhance and Save lives.
 

Sustainability commitment

 As a company, we are focused on striking the right balance between our stakeholders: increasing our market share and the return for our shareholders, improving the quality of life of our customers, patients and employees, and contributing to the well-being of our society, while also maintaining and restoring our planet’s health.
 
 “Since 2021, IBA is recognized as a certified B Corporation (or B Corp). B Corps are companies that promote ‘business as a force for good’, balancing profit and purpose. They meet the highest standards of social and environmental performance, public transparency, and legal accountability.”
 
 Check out our webpage sustainability to find out more!
 

Join us

 At IBA we dare to develop innovative solutions pushing back the limits of technology. We achieved worldwide recognition in our field by supplying the world's top oncologists with the most precise, cancer-defeating, technologies.
 
 If you are passionate, cause-driven, you can make this quest yours by joining our dedicated colleagues and give your career a new meaning.
 
Who are we?

 The Belgian, B-Corp certified company IBA has opened new ways to diagnose and fight cancer and is the global leader in the field of Proton Therapy, the most advanced technologies treatment against cancer.
 

Job Description

 The Advanced Analytics team at IBA focuses on using data to add value to the lifes of our customers and colleagues. We value agility, ownership, and we are not afraid to challenge the status quo.
 
 You'll contribute to our advanced data stack (DBT, Databricks, Terraform, AzureML, AirFlow, Gitlab CI) to support our data warehouse, data lake, MLOps platform and machine learning models. You'll use your experience to work closely with our IBA data architect and other data engineers in the team to ensure that your setup is maintainable, scalable and in line with increasing business needs.
 
Must-have

Computer Science, engineering degree or equivalent experience
Knowledge of software design best practices
Mastering SQL and Python
Familiar with Git
Fluent in English, French is a plus
Analytics mindset
Passionate about data

Nice-to-have

Cloud experience (any cloud provider, Azure preferred)
Experience with CI/CD pipelines
Knowledge of dimensional modeling
Relevant experience in a data team

Cherry on the cake, we offer :

Attractive salary package that corresponds to your experience level
Flexible home office policy
Possibility to work in our offices in Louvain-la-Neuve and also from a coworking in Leuven if you live in Flanders
A team that listens and leaves room for everyone’s development
Environment with cutting-edge technologies and challenging problems
Work at a Bcorp Certified company
Good work/life balance

 Die Identität von IBA wird durch eine Gruppe von Kollegen geprägt, die durch Motivation, Neugierde, Kreativität, den Willen zum Lernen im täglichen Berufsleben, durch technische Herausforderungen und darüber hinaus einen hoch entwickelten Team- und Familiengeist angetrieben werden. Denn all dies zusammen macht das alltägliche Leben einfacher und unterhaltsamer.
  Wenn Sie Teil eines Teams aus etwa 40 Nationen werden und an einem der über 45 Standorte auf 3 Kontinenten arbeiten, bietet IBA Ihnen die Möglichkeit einer bedeutungsvollen Karriere mit direktem Einfluss auf den Kampf gegen Krebs.
 
 Wir werden angetrieben durch:
 

Entwicklung einer Umgebung, die durch modernste Technologie geprägt ist
Ausbau beruflicher und persönlicher Fertigkeiten durch praktisches Lernen, durch Teilnahme an herausfordernden Projekten und erstklassigen Fortbildungen
Persönliche Weiterentwicklung in einer freundlichen Kultur, die auf festen Werten basiert (DARE- CARE -SHARE- BE FAIR)
Autonom handeln und Teil von motivierten Teams mit guter Work-Life-Balance sein
An einem Unternehmen mitwirken, bei dem Nachhaltigkeit, Sicherheit und Wohlbefinden Standbeine unseres Erfolgs sind

 « IBA ist ein aufregendes und wachsendes Unternehmen mit einem einzigen Ziel vor Augen: Der Gesellschaft mit Partikeltechnologie dienen. Zusammen mit unseren Kunden und Partnern werden unsere Mitarbeiter durch die Mission des Unternehmens angetrieben und motiviert: Leben von Patienten schützen, verbessern und retten. Und das jeden Tag. » Olivier Legrain, CEO

title: Junior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Do you want to kickstart your career in Data & AI? Then you’ll definitely be interested about our Rootsacademy for young graduates!

 Please note that the next RootsAcademy will start on Monday, the 6th of March 2023. Unfortunately, for people needing a work permit, because of the current delays it is no longer possible for this position to finalize the process in time.

 The Job
 As a Machine Learning Engineer you will excel in building digital data-driven solutions for our clients. You will become an architectural genius that effortlessly designs, develops and deploys machine learning models.
 We are a scale-up from Leuven and Ghent that researches, designs and codes robust AI-solutions & platforms for various sectors. Our dedicated in-house team of data-specialists uses a pragmatic best-tool-for-the-job approach to optimise our clients' processes and decision making. With a strong focus on DataOps and MLOps we firmly believe in robust and production-ready solutions being an essential part to our work. The result? Our team provides clients a reliable foundation to make data-driven decisions.

 More information about our Rootsacademy? https://dataroots.io/careers/rootsacademy
 Want to know more about the role of a Machine Learning Engineer at Dataroots? https://dataroots.io/foo/role-machine-learning-engineer

 What you can expect at dataroots?
 Ready to roll into your next adventure? Let’s meet! At Dataroots, we have prepared a 2-month training program for young graduates that gives you a strong foundation to start your career as a Machine Learning Engineer (Start date: 6 March 2023). During these months you will be introduced to the world of AI, cloud, data, infraops and robust software design. After this period, you will start your first data engineering or machine learning project. To become a good machine learning engineer, you need good software engineering skills and knowledge, and a first data engineering project is the best way to build up this knowledge. Later on, you will continue to develop towards becoming an expert in machine learning and data science. 

Our offices are the ideal workplace for people with a knack for innovation. Our languages? Python, Scala and Go. What we speak when we're not coding? English, because, with colleagues from Mexico or France, you'll enter an inspiring and internationally focused team.

 The Skills

 You are strongly motivated to become an excellent Machine Learning Engineer.
 You have a solid foundation in Machine Learning theory and have trained and/or deployed your first AI models.
 You're at ease with programming in Python, SQL knowledge of Scala is a plus. 
You have been in contact with cloud platforms like AWS, GCP or Azure. 
You have heard of tools like Apache Spark, Beam and/or Kafka.
 You know that Kubernetes, Terraform and CI/CD aren't Star Wars characters. You are interested in learning about data-architecture and data-infrastructure.
 You have a knack for picking up on new technologies and frameworks.
 You have an analytics and solution oriented mindset.
 You have strong communication skills and look forward to helping clients in overcoming their challenges.
 You ideally have knowledge of English and Dutch, knowledge of French is a plus.

 This list was probably a bit much. Don't worry, we don't expect you to tick every box from the beginning. Most of all: we are looking for colleagues with the same passion for personal and team development as the rest of us.

 The Offer

 An attractive salary package.
 Guidance by our experienced Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers and other experts.
 A training trajectory & budget focused on advancing your professional career.
 Training and seminars with your team and external experts to further sharpen your technical skill set.
 We let off steam during our fries & beers and monthly day@dataroots events #workhardplayhard.
 Your own innovation budget to work on cool, educational, challenging and/or opensource projects with others within your guild.

 Our offices are located in Leuven and Ghent. These locations are always available for brainstorm sessions or team events. As a dataroots consultant, you will occasionally be doing on-site visits at our clients.

 Ready for a new chapter as a Machine Learning Engineer at Dataroots? Great! Apply now!
 How do you apply? Either choose the easy way and use the apply button below or impress us with your skills by POSTing your resume via our /recruitment endpoint (you can find the docs here https://api.dataroots.io/v1/docs).

title: Data Center Technician
description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 
Experience with operating systems and networking protocols. 
Experience with computer hardware and server hardware or troubleshooting/diagnosing. 
Experience with troubleshooting hardware or network related issues using Linux-based tools.


 Preferred qualifications:

Experience with Linux operating systems. 
Experience in the maintenance and monitoring of server systems. 
Experience with coding or scripting.
Ability to collaborate and partner with people and teams to overcome challenges. 
 Ability to speak and write in English and French fluently.


About the job

 As Data Center Technician, you will perform core data center operations and deployment tasks on a single function (e.g., maintenance, machines, programs, networking, or media security), under direct guidance. You will perform basic troubleshooting and problem identification to address day-to-day issues by following existing protocols and well-defined documented activities and escalate non-standard challenges when required. You will also engage in community contributions to improve and sustain our culture and operations.
 Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.


 Responsibilities

Contribute to efforts and projects in the deployment, maintenance, and support of current and new data center servers and network infrastructure.
Repair broken equipment, including servers and networking and storage devices (e.g., replace hard drives, replace RAM, swap CPUs, motherboards, etc.).
Install and maintain switches, routers, and other large-scale networking gear.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Test Engineer
description:
Responsibilities:


 Execute engineering activities during new product introduction including product test flow simplification and test program readiness before ramping to volume manufacturing. 
Supporting production technical related issue and lot disposition 
Monitor and analyze test/product/yield/silicon performance, execute implementation schedules and product data management. 
Provide value-add engineering solutions to meet cycle time improvement, cost reduction and quality performance goals 
Drive continuous improvement projects in Test processes to improve operational efficiency and productivity 
Work closely with Test planning/manufacturing/engineering teams to ensure the smooth execution of Test manufacturing operations 
Collaborate with cross-functional Central/Site teams to overcome Test operation issues and challenges 
Support Quality team in sustaining and achieving quality excellent and customer quality expectation


 Requirements:




 Bachelor's degree in Electrical and Electronic Engineering/Computer Engineering, or related Engineering field 
Minimum 2-3 years and above of relevant working experiences will be an advantage. Fresh graduate is welcome as well 
Knowledge in tester platform such as Eagle, Hatina, Flex, T2K, etc will be an advantage 
Basic programming/computer hardware knowledge. Knowledge of programing language such C++, Visual basic, Unix, etc. 
Fundamental engineering knowledge on semiconductors, electronics. 
Independent, resourceful and takes initiative 
Basic statistical knowledge understanding of mean, cpk, sigma 
Good communication skill and able to work as team with different level of people

title: Data & AI engineer
description:
Lieu : Tubize, Belgium 
 Thales people architect solutions at the heart of the defence-security continuum. Interoperable and secure information and telecommunications systems for defence, security, and civil operators, are based upon innovative use of radiocommunications, networks, and cybersecurity. We are ground breaking new digital technologies such as 4G/5G mobile communications, cryptography, cloud computing and big data for use in physical protection systems, and critical information systems. 
 
Thales Belgium SA, Belgium competence center of Thales, is a company located on 2 sites, one in Tubize (near Brussels) and the other one in Herstal (near Liège). Thales Belgium, which employs more than 280 collaborators, is specialized in the design, development and supply of critical information systems for customers in the sectors of Defense, Security (including Cyber) and Aerospace. 

Mission: 

You will be part of the Innovation team of the company. You will be developing Proof-of-concepts in the context of various R&D projects. In particular, you will deploy data processing framework & develop artificial intelligence algorithms (Deep learning, Reinforcement learning). You will also contribute to the development of AI within Thales Belgium. You will be included in a team of both internal colleagues & external partners. 

The working language is English, French is an asset. 

Main Responsibilities & Profile: 

The data & AI scientist will be involved in a series of Proof-of-Concepts aiming at demonstrating the feasibility of introducing Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the development of various capabilities for future products. Your task will be: 

to collect &/or emulate data; 
to develop software allowing to process these data and make them usable by our AI; 
to elaborate and train AI models and share this expertise with Eurocontrol by coaching junior data scientists within the team. 
to participate in the development of AI within Thales Belgium, e.g. by building & operating an AI lab. 
to write technical reports. 


The following qualifications and skills are relevant and desirable for this role: 

Technical: 

Experience and good knowledge of Python (tenserflow/keras, pandas, numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, matplotlib), 
Experience and good knowledge of SQL querying. 
A good knowledge of common statistical models and machine learning algorithms used in data science. 
Understanding of HADOOP/Cloudera framework, inclusive HDFS, HIVE, IMPALA, SPARK ,… 
Experience and good knowledge of Linux OS and scripting techniques (Bash/Ksh) 


General: 

Excellent presentation and communication skills. 
Experience with writing reports and publications related to AI topics in MS Word and/or LateX . 
Ability to understand business needs and analyze data 
A Master’s degree or PhD in data science with option AI, or relevant experience 
Fluency in English is mandatory. 


Required abilities 


Stress resistant, autonomy, sense of initiative 
Versatility and flexibility 


Customer driven and quality oriented 


Interdisciplinary and creative, end-to-end commitment, focused and persistent 
Team player, listening and communication skills 


At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now! 

Interested?  Apply now! Click on the button below to upload your profile and show your interest.   Diversity Statement  We actively support a working pattern that suits your lifestyle and helps you reach your ambitions. That means that equal opportunities, inclusion and an informal culture are integral to our success. It also means that your well-being and happiness matter to us! That’s why we offer you the flexibility to do what’s important to you; whether that’s part time hours, job sharing, remote working, or the ability to flex your start and finish times.

title: Thermodynamics Engineer
Apprenticeship-D&A Data Engineer-KPMG Lighthouse
description:
Grade
Internship

Department
KPMG Lighthouse

Descriptions
Looking forward to a data-driven career in a dynamic environment? KPMG is now on the lookout for young talents to join our Lighthouse Data & Analytics Apprenticeship Program: “Discover, Analyse, Transform and Accomplish” Unlike a mundane internship program, our Apprenticeship program is specifically designed to blend hands-on experience with relevant trainings to enhance your job competency. As part of the Firm’s talent development program, we are committed to invest in data science training for our apprentices to achieve the necessary accreditations. Your mission is to analyse large data sets and transform them into meaningful insights to identify current trends, cycles and anomalies. Our Apprenticeship program comes with a unique feature of one-to-one mentorship where you will be guided by an assigned mentor throughout the program. Upon completion of the program, you'll stand a chance to be offered a permanent role in KPMG Lighthouse. If you are passionate about your career path of becoming a data professional, we welcome you to embark the journey with us! Inspire Confidence. Empower Change. KPMG the Clear Choice

Responsibilities
This program aims to equip candidates with the necessary skills in the data and analytics space. At the end of this program, candidates can expect to have technical and functional capabilities which are essential for Data Engineer role. Some of the key responsibilities of Data Engineer Apprentice are as follows: - - Assist in creation and enhancement of data solutions enabling seamless delivery of data and for collecting, analysing and managing large sets of data - Assist in design, develop, automates, and support the use of applications to extract, transform, and load (“ETL”) data - Assist in the design of the logical data model and implements the physical database structure and constructs and implements operational data stores and data marts - Participate in consulting with technical lead, development teams and client to get a big-picture idea of the client’s data storage needs - Assist in designing and coding the data warehousing system to desired project’s specifications - Assist in conducting preliminary testing of the warehousing environment before data is extracted - Troubleshooting any issues that may arise - Present ideas and solutions based on relevant project needs - Apply business strategy while driving technology strategy, balancing short term and long term needs to ensure that the architecture can scale and evolve accordingly - Participate and contribute on an end-to-end approach by connecting all the pieces of data to deliver the data while leveraging all available assets - Provide input, ideas and observations to carry out plans and procedures to ensure schedule attainment, performance and targets are met.

Requirements
- Availability of 6 months and above. - Bachelor’s degree with a quantitative focus: Actuarial Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems/Technologies (IS/IT), or Business and Commerce with D&A background. - Good knowledge on implementation of business data solutions (e.g. ETL, data modelling, and data analysis). - Systematic troubleshooting approach, coupled with strong communication skills. - Independent, self-motivated, organised, results oriented, teamwork spirit and ability to undertake multiple tasks to meet challenging deadlines. - Prior experience or project knowledge of data analytics or big data project will be an added advantage. - Comfortable to work with large and complex dataset. - Basic knowledge on Office 365 such as MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel, MS Power Platform - Good command of English, both written and spoken. Good to have: - Data Warehousing, BI and Azure solutions or relevant cloud technologies - ETL Solution (SSIS and Azure Date Factory or equivalent tools) - EDW Solution (SSMS and Azure Data Lake, Azure Synapse Analytics or equivalent tools) - Cube Solution (SSAS or Azure Analysis Service or equivalent tools) - Data architecture, including data model design and implementation (incl. relational, dimensional, No-SQL) - Architectural governance of solutions - Strong theoretical understanding of data management best practice (e.g. data quality, metadata management, data lineage) - Proficiency in warehousing architecture techniques including MOLAP, ROLAP, ODS, DM, and EDW.

title: Data Engineer - Google Cloud
description:
Vil du lage skyløsninger for noen av Norges største merkevarer? Vi søker deg som uoppfordret utforsker de siste teknologiske trendene, og samtidig er kvalitetsbevisst når du implementerer det beste skyen har å by på. Hvis du digger å skape verdi gjennom å sammenstille, bearbeide og utnytte store mengder data, så bør du lese videre.
 Som Google Cloud Partner og Google Marketing Platform Partner, vil en stor del av arbeidshverdagen din gå ut på å bruke tjenester fra Google-universet for å utnytte potensialet i data fra en rekke uavhengige kilder og systemer. Du vil bli en del av cloud-teamet sammen med fem andre data engineers og data scientists, som inngår i Knowits inkubatoravdeling. Det innebærer høy grad av frihet under eget ansvar, og en stor påvirkningskraft på hvordan teamet skal utvikles og drives framover.
 Sammen med 200 dyktige kolleger her i Oslo, vil du jobbe for å posisjonere Knowit Experience som de beste i byen på datadrevne kundeopplevelser. Du vil samarbeide tett med blant annet analytikere, markedsstrateger og forretningsutviklere, i tillegg en haug med teknologer, designere og dyktige ansatte fra andre fagområder. Å dyrke eget fag i kombinasjon med et kryssdisiplinært fokus, ligger i DNAet vårt. Slik bevarer vi en kultur der innovative ideer løftes, kreativitet hylles og kunnskap deles. 

Dine arbeidsoppgaver vil være

Sammenstille datakilder for å bygge datavarehus i skyen 
Utvikle skreddersydde data pipelines og integrasjoner
Tilrettelegge for- og bygge løsninger for predikering, anbefalinger, segmentering og kundefrafall (anti-churn)
Utnytte stordata ved hjelp av Google Cloud
Bidra til mer datadrevne uttak i kommunikasjon og markedsføring
Veilede kunder i å utnytte større deler av Google Cloud-tilbudet
Utforske mulighetsrommet i Google Cloud og bidra med å dra teamet i riktig retning
Ta medansvar for teamets delingskultur og sørge for kompetanseheving for deg selv og de rundt deg


Ønskede kvalifikasjoner

Minimum 2 år med arbeidserfaring som skyutvikler, dataingeniør eller analytiker
Relevant høyere utdannelse
Gode ferdigheter i SQL og Python
Erfaring og interesse for BigQuery og Google Cloud Platform
Kjennskap til ETL og datatransformasjonsverktøy som Fivetran, Dataform, dbt
Erfaring med REST APIer og versjonshåndtering
Kjennskap til Google Analytics eller annen bruksmønster innsamling
Evne og lyst til å jobbe med flere kundeprosjekter av gangen




Hos oss får du


En fleksibel arbeidshverdag med mulighet og tilrettelegging for hjemmekontor. Vi opererer ikke med kjernetid, men tilpasser oss kunder og prosjekt.
Anledning til å jobbe på tvers av fagområder med inspirerende kollegaer i Norges sterkeste digitale fagmiljø
En omfattende portefølje med spennende kunder som har mye data og ser viktigheten av den
Splitter nye lokaler i Oslo sentrum 
Stor grad av selvstendighet: Vi har ubegrenset antall fagtimer å bruke hvert år!
Gode muligheter for å påvirke din arbeidshverdag og hvordan vi jobber
Konkurransedyktige betingelser, inkludert årlig overskuddsdeling, svært god helseforsikring og støtte til bredbånd og trening, for å nevne noe.





Les mer om hva vi har gjort
 …på Googles partnerside, blant våre kundehistorier eller på våre egne Cloud-sider.

 Om dette passer for deg?
 Gi lyd fra deg! Du trenger ikke å skrive en lang søknad - vi trenger bare nok informasjon til å vurdere erfaringen din (CV eller LinkedIn) og noen linjer om hva ved denne stillingen som interesserer deg.   Du kan også kontakte avdelingsleder Lars Erik Austad hos oss for å høre mer, på telefon 928 45 288 eller e-post lars-erik.austad@knowit.no

title: Dimensional Control Engineer
description:

  Yabimo is an international company with experience, conducting operations in Europe (Norway, Iceland, Sweden, Denmark, France, Germany, Belgium, the Netherlands) and dealing with the highest quality services, such as the recruitment and selection of technical personnel such as INSPECTORS, ENGINEERS and OPERATORS.
   For one of our clients, we are looking for people for the position of:
  
 Dimensional Control Engineer

Taking measurements of steel elements and checking welds
Designing components for the assembly process to increase productivity and safety
Electronic dimension control of piping and structure for the oil and gas industry, onshore and offshore.
Experienced with surveying steel structures (eg. topsides, flare towers, manifolds, templates, cranes), subsea modules fabrication, surveys of tie-in spools to assure first-time-fit, and subsea pipelines fabrication surveys.
Fabrication and installation assistance, production help during construction, establishing grid networks, production of DC survey reports at every stage of fabrication. 
Experience with ultra-high precision metrology using Metronor industrial metrology systems in combination with Delcam Powerinspect software.

 We offer:
  

Work in a rotation system
Work for one of the largest companies in the Oil&Gas industry in Norway
We provide accommodation, transport and meals
Exciting career/development opportunities
Competitive conditions

experience in a given position
Bachelor’s Degree in engineering

title: Stage Data Engineer (H/F)
description:
Description 
 Vous êtes mordu(e) d’innovation et êtes prêt(e) à relever de nouveaux défis captivants ? Vous avez envie de plonger tête la première dans l’univers démesuré du Marketing Digital ? Ne cherchez plus, Editus est l’entreprise qu’il vous faut !
 Intégrer Editus c’est se laisser séduire par une entreprise collaborative et « data oriented », qui place la donnée au cœur de ses métiers.
 Fun, Target et Team Spirit ça vous parle ? Ce sont justement les valeurs par lesquelles sont animés nos 140 collaborateurs !
 Base de données référente à Luxembourg, Editus est aussi le Partenaire Marketing de nombreuses entreprises au niveau local. Notre ambition est de proposer à nos clients des solutions Marketing sur mesure et adaptées à leurs besoins.

 Et si vous deveniez notre futur(e) stagiaire en Data Engineering (H/F) ? Responsabilités

 Construire des rapports BI pour des use-cases spécifiques

 Vous avez une appétence pour le monde de la donnée

 Langues French Education Master Expériences professionnelles 0+ years

title: Big Data Engineer - Remote Work
description:
Who We are
 BairesDev is proud to be the fastest-growing company in America. With people in five continents and world-class clients, we are only as strong as the multicultural teams at the heart of our business. To consistently deliver the highest quality solutions to our clients, we only hire the Top 1% of the best talents and nurture their professional growth on exciting projects. 
We are looking for Big Data Engineers for Home-based modality to join our Development team and participate in different projects made up of multicultural teams distributed throughout the world. We are looking for proactive people, team players passionate about programming in this language and oriented to provide the best experience to the end user. This is an excellent opportunity for those professionals looking to develop in one of the fastest growing companies in the industry!
 These developers will face numerous technical challenges, so they must use current technologies, get involved in the mobile world, web applications, devices, etc.
What You’ll Do:

Work together with developers, tech leads and solution architects to build applications.
Improve existing structures by adding new functionalities or proposing technological updates so that as a result, the impact of your contribution is significant in the core of each business.
The result of your work will also allow you to improve the user experience on scalable and high availability platforms, contributing to the key differential of each business.

Here’s what we are looking for:

6+ years of experience working as a developer.
5+ years of experience in Big Data.
Proficient with analysis, troubleshooting, and problem solving.
Hands-on experience with managing data loads and data quality a plus.
Advanced English level.

How we do make your work (and your life) easier:

100% remote work.
Hardware setup for you to work from home.
 - Flexible hours - make your schedule.
 

Paid parental leave, vacation & holidays.
Diverse and multicultural work environment.
An innovative environment with the structure and resources of a leading multinational.
Excellent compensation — well above the market average.
Here you can grow at the speed of your learning curve.

Our people work remotely but with a consistent and robust culture that promotes diversity and teamwork. To continue being the leading software development company in Latin America, we want to ensure that every BairesDev member gets the best growth and professional development opportunities in a diverse, welcoming, and innovative environment.  Every BairesDev team member brings something unique to our company. We want to hear your story. Apply now!

title: Data engineer inter india
description:
Experience: 3-6 years
 Roles and Responsibility 

Extracting data from multiple channels.
 Transforming and compiling data together into a common format.

 Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL

 Previous experience as a data engineer or in a similar role

 Based in Dallas, TX, Veridic Solutions is a leading provider of cloud and digital transformation services. Veridic Solutions, we are:

title: Senior Real-Time Kernel Engineer - Ubuntu Linux
description:
Real-time Linux is a key requirement for critical infrastructure like 5G towers, robotics and self-driving cars. We are excited to be bringing Ubuntu to the real-time space, and are looking for a specialist, quality-centric senior kernel engineer to lead our real-time kernel effort.
 This is an exciting opportunity for a senior software engineer passionate about open source software with extensive experience working in low latency and deterministic systems at the operating system kernel level. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
 Canonical's kernel team delivers a wide array of optimized Linux kernels for Ubuntu on many of the world's largest clouds and data centers to robotics, IoT and edge computing. This senior kernel position will lead the effort in optimizing our Ubuntu kernel's performance over real-time workloads. If you have solid general kernel development experience, real-time kernel development skills and love the idea of producing high-quality, high-performance Linux kernels, we encourage you to bring your talents to our growing Linux kernel team to help us provide the same world-class Ubuntu experience to real-time workloads.
 What you'll do

Collaborate regularly and proactively with a globally distributed team
Lead the design and integration of real-time extensions in Ubuntu Linux kernels
Work closely with a variety of customer and partner engineers to provide optimal latency and deterministic solutions for their platforms
Drive the implementation of real-time performance measurement infrastructure
Collaborate with internal and upstream maintainers to develop optimal Linux kernel real-time solutions
Take responsibility for rigorous testing of the Ubuntu real-time kernels

Who you are

You love technology and working with brilliant people
Strong grasp of real-time as a system of distinct components with a keen interest in tuning to achieve maximum performance
Able to function and communicate effectively as part of a globally distributed team
Communicate effectively in English, both written and oral
Demonstrated ability to present oneself in a professional manner when interacting with colleagues, business partners, and the open source community
Demonstrated expertise in working in operating system kernel internals in a real-time environment, Linux or other RTOS
Direct experience with the PREEMPT_RT patchset while not required would be highly regarded
Earned a bachelor's (or equivalent university level) degree, preferably in a technology field
Significant programming experience in C, with Python and Bash scripting also highly regarded
Solid understanding of device drivers, BSP's, and other low level system engineering

Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the world's computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
What we do:
 Treyd is a fast-growing, venture-backed startup dedicated to helping eCommerce companies that sell actual goods grow as fast as software companies. With our Buy now, Pay later (BNPL) solution we provide our customers with short-term financing to pay their suppliers so that they can scale and unlock their full potential. To achieve our goals, we need exceptional Frontend Engineers—people like you.
 We’re expanding into new markets where we’re more than the challenger—we’ll be the strong partner that will propel awesome companies into established heavy hitters.
 You’d be joining our team at an early stage, but we have countless opportunities as we launch new markets and a game-changing product. We need teammates that love having a high impact in a fast-moving and ambitious company. 
Right now we’re in the process of building a strong product team and we need you to own the frontend development of our platform. To succeed in the role as Senior Frontend Engineer, you should have a strong engineering background with the experience and ability to take ownership of the frontend development and the interactivity aspects of the Treyd platform. If you have a background from SaaS companies, that would further improve your chances of early success.
 Treyd is a modern, open and fast growing company and we offer both a stimulating and supportive environment. So whoever you are and whoever you aspire to be, we want to hear from you.
 About the role:
 We are looking for an experienced and passionate Frontend Engineer to join our team and create the best possible user experience for our customers. You have a team player mentality and preferably a SaaS and/or marketplace background. You will work closely with the CTO, Product manager and alongside a team of talented engineers, developers, business analysts and other stakeholders in a cross functional squad. Our platform is focused on desktop use. This is a great opportunity to join an exciting startup that is growing fast and shape the future of the product.

Key responsibilities:

 Take an active role in product development of our platform and push new product directions. 
Implement the UI and engineer the experience of the application
Work within our current technical stack (Python Django & GCP).

 Who you are:

 You have 1+ years experience (or a fresh grad with solid foundation) working with front end technologies such as React, vanilla Javascript, HTML and CSS, and the associated best practices for developing on this stack
Strong proficiency in JavaScript, object model and event handlers, data structures, JSX
Complete understanding of ReactJS and its main fundamentals like JSX, component lifecycle, react hooks, etc.
Experience with ReactJS workflows like flux or Redux, Create React App
Experience with material-ui is preferred
Experience with some or all of Typescript, Graphql, Docker, , Parcel, Rollup, Styled Components, design systems, Storybook, React Query
Solid understanding of fundamental web technologies such as HTTP, REST, AJAX, Websockets and JSON
Experience building and maintaining cross-platform / responsive web-application UI
Experience working with backend developers to design and consume web APIs
Experience with testing frameworks such as Jest, Enzyme, React Testing Library, Cypress or similar
Experience delivering software in a CI/CD environment with robust automated testing
Experience with Python/Django and the ability to work server-side would make you stand out
You have the capacity to work autonomously in a rapidly changing environment.
Experience in developing a SaaS or B2B product or service
You are comfortable working in cross-functional agile teams and with user-centric methods
Devops tools experience (Git, Jira, Linear, Bitbucket, Confluence)
Familiar with SCRUM / Agile methodologies
Are a confident communicator and are able to articulate ideas verbally and in writing. English is required and Swedish is a plus.

 If this sounds like just about everything you want to do, don’t hesitate. We want to meet you like right now
 What we offer:
 Treyd offers a unique opportunity to be part of building and scaling one of the most promising and fast-growing fintechs in recent years. 

Competitive compensation package
Premium office space with the option of hybrid remote
Startup style and mentality

 Treyd is backed by international VC as well as prominent investors.
 Treyd equality:
 Treyd is an equal opportunity employer It is our commitment that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills and experience regardless of age, gender, identity, national origin, marital status, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status or religion.

title: Data and Analytics Engineer – New role – build a data factory
Software Engineer Intern 2023
description:
As a software engineer intern at AlphaLab Capital, you will gain first-hand experience working in high frequency trading environments. You will have the opportunity to work alongside top engineers and our company leaders to gain invaluable experience on how to build scalable and high performance software solutions. Interns with outstanding performance will be invited for a full-time position upon graduation.
 
Key Responsibilities

Expand trading to new markets by building connectivity to global financial exchanges
Build core components of a high-performance trading system, including core libraries for high-efficiency logging, shared memory IPC, uniform interface to trading strategies, etc.
Design, build, test and deploy proprietary software such as:

Trading simulator optimized for distributed computations
Large-scale data collection, management and visualization systems
Analytics tools to enable advanced mathematical modeling
Post-trade analysis and reconciliation to support efficient operations


The Ideal Candidate

Experience programming in Python, C++, C# or Java
Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming
Excellent problem solving, interpersonal and communication skills
Excellent English communication skills

Internship Outcomes

Gain insights into the fintech and high frequency trading industries
Enhance coding skills; get exposed to new tools and programming languages
Hands-on experience to apply computer science studies in a professional environment
Experience in an agile startup environment
Improve communication (both oral and written) skills and interpersonal effectiveness
One-on-one mentorship from our software engineers



 About AlphaLab Capital
 AlphaLab Capital Group is a technology-driven trading group that transacts over $2B daily in cryptoassets on 40+ exchanges, both centralized and decentralized. Since 2017, we have consistently generated exceptional returns (aka alpha).
 We were one of the first movers in quantitative trading on the blockchain, and today we operate thousands of algorithms 24/7 on a globally distributed network of trading servers. Our team sits across 3 continents with headquarters in Singapore.

title: Senior Data Engineer - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
description:
Who You'll Work With


     You will be based in our Riyadh, Saudi Arabia or Cairo, Egypt office as part of our QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey team, partnering with consultants, clients, and other colleagues.
    


      Our QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey teams bring the latest analytical techniques plus a deep understanding of industry dynamics and corporate functions to help clients create the most value from data.
    





What You'll Do


     You will apply your passion for finding opportunities in data by using established tools and techniques or by innovating/building new ones.
    


      In this role, you will collaborate with highly talented business consultants and data-scientists to design and drive architecture and implementation planning for our clients and act as a big data evangelist, educating McKinsey's and client's teams on data engineering topics. You’ll actively cooperate with data scientists and digital consultants to incorporate clients’ requirements and impactful analysis into our data products. You’ll also be an expert in data engineering and advise relevant people at the firm on technical aspects of analytics engagements.
    


      You will shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, drive processes for extracting and using that data in creative ways, and create new lines of thinking within an infinite number of clients and situations.
    


      Lastly, you'll do meaningful work that makes a real difference with our clients. This is a hybrid client-facing/technical role using state-of-the-art technologies, whilst also being able to communicate complex intractable ideas to non-technical audiences.
    





Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or another relevant subject
 3+ years of experience in big data related software development; experience with data modeling, design patterns and building highly scalable and secured solutions
 Background in development with practical experience with at least one general purpose programming languages (Python, R, C, Java, Scala, etc.)
 Familiar with big data platforms (SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Spark)
 Experience preparing data for analytics and following a data science workflow
 Advanced knowledge of data structures and algorithms, networking, operating systems, standard unix/linux operating systems, version control and DevSecOps tool chains, etc.
 Ability to work with a myriad of data types (structured and unstructured), extracting information from modern and legacy data platforms and identify and perform linkages across disparate data sets
 Meaningful experience in extracting and loading data from multiple database technologies like RDBMS (MS SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL), MPP (AWS Redshift, Teradata, Snowflake) and optionally NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra, Neo4J, Titan)
 Experience and interest in Cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, GCP
 Commercial client-facing project experience is helpful
 Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
 Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization
 Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively, both verbally and in writing, in English; fluency in local office language(s) is a plus

title: Data Engineer
description:
Description: 
  A few things about us…
 We're the industry's largest and most well-respected commercial flooring installation service company. Our innovative vision allows us to do business differently and create new standards by bringing industry-leading expertise from our family of brands across 52 locations across the US. Our team is now nearly 2,100 strong. We're equipped, profitable, and have grown faster than we ever expected and now include a varied array of market brands that have respectively achieved the distinction for service quality that sets our standard. Our brand partners include Diverzify+, Beckers, Collaborative Turnkey Solutions (CTS), Contract Carpet Solutions (CCS), Epoxy SI, High-Performance Flooring, Kiefer USA, Lane's Floor Coverings and Interiors, Kenny Floor Covering LLC, Pavilion Floors, ProSpectra Contract Flooring, RD Weis LLC, Select Prefab Solutions and Spectra Contract Flooring.
 Unlike others in the industry, we think and do things differently, lead with relentless curiosity, imagination, and innovation, and are frequently told by our customers that we're a breath of fresh air. We partner with some of the fastest-growing, most promising, and most well-respected companies in the US to bring their facility visions to life. We've worked unbelievably hard to serve our clients, and it's paid off.
 What's it like to work here…
 Our appealing work environment includes highly competent co-workers, competitive pay, engaging work, business casual dress, flexible schedule, full medical, telemedical, mental health, prescriptions, HSA/FSA, Life & AD&D, vision and dental benefits, and 401k. We work very hard and have a lot of fun. We thrive on doing things better, more efficiently, and smarter. We have high expectations of our people because we all live and die by our values and trust our teams to get their work done and maintain a proper work-life balance.
 Please DO NOT apply if:

 You'd feel like a fish out of water without a well-defined traditional corporate structure
 You'd consider walking into a work site and pitching in to help as being beneath you
 You're accustomed to using the phrase, "it's not part of my job description."

 Please DO apply if:

 You have the required and desired experience (this is not a learn-on-the-job position)
 You're a doer - not a manager, a coordinator, or simply an idea person - but someone who loves to get stuff done and done well
 You are a "go-to" person because you're reliable, creative, resourceful, a good decision-maker, and generally one of the most capable people your peers know.
 You're accustomed to a fun company environment, including wearing many hats and managing way too many things at any given time
 Requirements: 
  Here's what we are looking for…
 At Diverzify, we believe our associates are at the heart of our organization. We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our team. You will use various methods to transform raw data into useful data systems. You will be primarily responsible for transforming Diverzify’s data from a raw state into a valuable and intuitive tool for our leaders and operational stakeholders. In addition, you must incorporate a solid business understanding combined with a deep technical understanding of the Microsoft Azure data ecosystem and expand/optimize our data, data pipelines, flow, and collection for teams across the company. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The role will experience the entire data lifecycle of initial building, optimizing, or re-designing of our data architecture to support the growing need for analytics.
 Here's what we are looking for…

 Partnering with BI leadership, developing and maturing our data extraction and ingestion pipelines from our main ERP, CRM, MKT, and HRIS applications to ensure that our stakeholders are provided with valuable insights that grow and change with the business
 Driving processes to monitor and improve data reliability and quality of our data from their source applications
 Performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement with business stakeholders
 Building insightful Power BI analytic reports to provide actionable insights that are well utilized by stakeholders; if use declines, the role will work with stakeholders on enhancements to improve the value of data.
 Assisting in making decisions based on prioritized backlog and established release timelines
 Collaborating with the business delivery team and product stakeholders to manage the product backlog according to business value and level of work effort (return on investment).
 Participating in sprint retrospectives to continuously improve the business delivery effectiveness
 Collaborating with other technical leaders on enterprise dependencies and/or priorities
 Performing an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of sprint goals
 Performing other functions as assigned

 And you would have the following…

 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, IT, or a similar field; a Master’s is a plus
 3 or more years of previous experience as a data engineer or in a similar role
 Technical expertise in data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques
 Comprehensive understanding of the MS data ecosystem, users, and roadmap, including experience developing using DAX and related Power BI tools like Tabular Editor.
 Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with Azure SQL databases, query authoring (T-SQL), as, well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
 Experience building and optimizing databases, pipeline architectures, and data sets.

 And exhibit the following competencies…

 Attention to Detail
 Analysis and Reasoning
 Mathematical Reasoning
 Business Alignment
 Planning and Organizing
 Problem-Solving
 Relationship Building
 Managing Projects and Programs

 Is this you? If so, then we invite you to join us and apply. See firsthand what it's like to grow and advance in a truly collaborative environment where everyone is supported, empowered, and inspired to be their best and unlock their full potential. One last thing, if you heard about this position from one of our Diverzify team members, make sure you tell us and enter their contact information, and we will do all the leg work.
 #DIV22
benefits: 401(k), AD&D insurance, Dental insurance, Flexible schedule, Flexible spending account, Health savings account,

title: Data Engineer
description:
At HP, we believe in the power of ideas. Our vision is to create technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere — every person, every organization, and every community around the globe. This motivates us — inspires us — to do what we do. To make what we make. To invent, and to reinvent. To engineer experiences that amaze.

 In the IT Organization (IT), we are looking for visionaries who are willing to push boundaries to help us rewrite the rules for HP Inc . The IT will accelerate transformation through embracing agile new ways of working, investing in the digital literacy of our workforce, and using the power of data, AI, automation, and robotics to extract cost and complexity from across our business.

 The Enterprise Business Planning program is transforming how HP does enterprise-wide planning and forecasting, from WW LTP to weekly account planning in countries. This effort is multi-dimensional in nature, including (1) elements of organizational design, (2) process redesign, (3) applying sophisticated technology and application tools, and (4) leading advanced change management techniques to deliver the full value of large-scale transformation. Our vision is to enable seamless collaboration across sales, category, finance and supply chain supported by digital solutions .

 RESPONSIBILITIES

 Understands business management processes and drives design of digital solutions
 Deep understanding of the solution requirement and guidance to development, data integration, testing.
 Development and coordination of rollout activities
 Implement robust process and governance for development, testing, deployment, service transition , hyper care, regular support
 Design , Implement, Deploy Data integration Solutions, data integration pipes , process and solutions (ETL)
 Design and Develop DevOps framework for CI /CD
 Ensure all the deployments are aligned with DevOps practice and process .
 Setup robust data orchestration, data load framework and process, best in class DQ checks
 Acts as liaison between program leadership, cross-functions, IT and core program team
 Defect triaging, ticket creation, ticket assignment and resolution
 Design and implement automated monitoring framework with automated alerting mechanism on defect or performance degradation.
 Reports frequently on projects evolution, overcomes roadblocks or proposes alternatives; seeks for guidance and forces decision making as needed
 Assures designs and project activities are in compliance with data policies, architecture, security and quality guidelines and standards.
 Drives innovation and integration of new technologies into organization wide projects and activities in the big data space.
 Provides guidance and mentoring to less experienced staff members.


 Education and Experience 

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or equivalent.
 Typically 13+ years’ experience.


 Knowledge & Skills

 Excellent analytical thinking, technical analysis, and data manipulation skills.
 Deep understanding of Data Integration (ETL) architecture
 Expert level development experience with Azure data integration
 Hands on experience on bigdata systems, Hadoop, Hive, Talend
 Hands on experience on Azure DevOps, ADF, ADB, ADW, Azure Storage , key vault
 Working experience with Reporting and monitoring tools such as Power BI
 Development knowledge and understanding of Business Planning solutions and concepts
 Business acumen and excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 Experience with agile project management concepts (SCRUM)


 Additional skills that will be considered a plus:

 Azure certifications - AZ-900, AZ-104, AZ-204, AZ-400, DP-203
 Business Intelligence background ( PowerBI, Thoughtspot, Tableau, databases)
 Experience in using Service now


 About HP





  You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.
 

   So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.
 



   HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.
 



   Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion – it's just who we are.
 

   From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

title: FN integration Engineer
description:
Come create the technology that helps the world act together Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.
We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.
The team you’ll be part of
The pandemic has highlighted how important telecoms networks are to society. Nokia’s Network Infrastructure group is at the heart of a revolution to bring more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise.
As MEA FN team as part of the Customer Engineering organization in the Network Infrastructure Business Center, we design, validate solutions, we drive first off integrations of Nokia FN solutions on customer networks, and we introduce the latest network technologies to our customers.
What you will learn and contribute to 
Are you passionate about solving problems?
As part of our team, you will:
Perform customer facing network (HW / SW) / systems integration engineer function who could be assigned on site or Remote working missions.
Be required to multitask and be fast to learn and deliver with minimal supervision while showing full accountability, responsibility, and ownership. 
Work very closely with technical project managers, subject matter experts (SMEs) and product line managers (PLM) to co-ordinate delivery of solution to the project team and customer. 
Perform Installation and commissioning (I&C), onsite or remote NE/ System configuration and integration. You will work closely with TPM to achieve customer acceptance. 
Travel around the region if required for business and work on projects of varying complexity while interacting with different project teams and customers
Keep yourself up to date with the latest developments in Nokia HW and SW technologies using Nokia’s immense learning resources
Actively contribute, share, guide, train your peers about lessons learned and knowledge gained 
Your skills and experience
You have:


Excellent customer facing and spoken English skills 
A bachelor’s degree in Electrical engineering with majors in Telecommunications, Telecommunications or Computer Engineering with minimum 5 years of experience in the telecom industry or data center operations 
Excellent knowledge of fixed access technologies like xDSL technologies like (Vectoring. Bonding, G. Fast), GPON technologies like XGSPON, NGPON, 25GPON and 100GPON, Wi-Fi (IEEE 802.11 XX) technologies like (WI-FI 5, WI-FI 6/ 6E)
Hands on experience to commission, configure, SW upgrade, troubleshoot and customer acceptance testing of DSL MSANs, GPON OLTs and ONTs. 
Hands on knowledge of setting up Wi-Fi access points, beacons, and extenders 
Good knowledge IP LAN/WAN switching and routing protocols, troubleshooting skills of GPON and IP networks, collecting IP traces using popular tools.
A team player and can work in a true multinational environment. 
Preferably you will have:
Hands on knowledge of administration of operating systems and applications including local and remote installation, backup/ restore, configuration, synchronization, security patching and upgrading of RED HAT Linux. / CentOS
Hands on knowledge of setting up, validating, radio testing of 4G and 5G fixed wireless access CPEs 
IP Certifications for example CCNA, CCNP 
What we offer Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.


Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer
Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark
LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect. Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

description:

     The Data Engineer assists in setting overall development roadmap and standards for the Bank and helps evaluate and architect the use of data solutions, using industry best practices. title: Data Engineer
description:
JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally. 

 Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally. 

 What this job involves 
Support project teams in delivering real estate consulting assignments across the MEA region 

 Centralize, organize and manage data for the team 

 Analyse data from JLL databases and create a centralized database for all data points 

 Develop processes and tools to streamline and monitor data collection / storage / and standardization 

 Visualize data for stakeholders using Tableau and Power BI 

 Create and update databases, GIS maps and associated dashboards 

 Develop market analyses tools using AI and automation (e.g. Power BI) 

 Produce advanced analytics results including correlation, predictive and testing results 

 Assist with the development of periodic reports, slide decks and research papers. 

 This job can accommodate for remote working. 

 Desired skills and experience for this job 

 Education and experience 
You should ideally have a Degree in Computer Science, Computer engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics. You should have a previous consolidated professional experience in Business Intelligence projects and Big Data projects as Data Analyst for at least 3 years. An excellent working knowledge of English is an essential prerequisite (both written and verbal). Any additional language would be a plus and previous financial / real estate experience is desirable. 

 Technical competencies 
We will expect you to have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze data and information with attention to detail and accuracy, communication aptitude (written and verbal), data management capabilities, as well as an excellent knowledge of all the computer tools: Microsoft excel, power point, word, outlook, PPT productivity tools, Power BI, Tableau, Thinkcell and ArcGIS. Knowledge of R and Python would be a plus. 

 LI-AB1 
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table! 

 Personalized benefits that support personal well-being and growth: 

 JLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health. 

 About JLL – 

 We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities. 

 Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally. 

 Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.
