title: Electronics Engineer - Research&Development
description:
Job Description Summary We are looking for an Electrical Engineer that will be an addition to our console HW team. In this position you will be developing electrical parts and subsystems for our world leading high end cardiac ultrasound systems. You will be involved in completely new designs and also iterative changes of existing designs. In your daily work you will work closely with other teams (Program leadership, Mechanics, SW, Documentation, Test, Manufacturing, etc.), internal functions (RA, QA, Sourcing, Supply Chain, etc.) and external suppliers to make the best technical, compliant and high quality solutions for our products. Our work environment is international so you will be working on projects with suppliers and team members from all over the world.
 
 GE HealthCare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our purpose is to create a world where healthcare has no limits. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.
 
 Job Description
 Responsibilities

 In order to succeed in this role you need to be self-driven, structured, a team player and motivated to learn new technology, processes and procedures.
 The role we would like you to take or grow into is to be an expert within all or some of the following fields: Digital PCB design, High speed interfaces, CPU, GPU, ComExpress, BIOS, PC Technology, Battery and charger technology, embedded programming, VHDL
 Subsystem and system architecture
 Organize and implement design changes
 Organize and take part in verification and validation activities
 Analyze field data and find root causes of customer complaints
 Support suppliers and internal manufacturing in analyzing yield and quality issues


 Qualifications/ Requirements

 MSc or BSc in electrical engineering or equivalent
 Good Norwegian skills
 Good English proficiency, both oral and written


 Inclusion and Diversity

 GE HealthCare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

 Behaviors
 We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity. 

Total Rewards

 Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

 #LI-BG1

 Additional Information







 Relocation Assistance Provided: No

title: Junior Data Engineer
description:
Location
             










                  London
                





                  Remote
                















               Department
             










                  Engineering
                






















 









 Specter is building the 'Bloomberg' of Alternative Data.




 We are driven by the belief that data will disrupt any industry, so we are here to build exclusive solutions that empower next-generation businesses with data-driven insights 






 Our mission is to track the entire private and public markets within one platform: market signals, search trends, social engagement, companies, talents, websites, mobile apps, games and much more 









 Engineering at Specter 






 Specter is seeking a talented individual to be part of our engineering team. You'll work closely with our founders and the engineering team to create groundbreaking technology. This is an incredible opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the future of Specter.







 Technologies We Love






 Our core tech stack for data engineering at Specter is Node.JS and Python. We use MongoDB, PostgreSQL and S3 for storage, and our infrastructure is mostly hosted on AWS. We're early stage, and this system will evolve, so you will play a vital role in shaping our technical direction and choices as an early team member.







 Our Hiring Process








 Initial chat to discuss the role, learn about each other and explore whether it's a good fit









 One-hour coding exercise - a domain-specific exercise that doesn't require any preparation. No white-boarding!









 One-hour general technical interview [+ exercise review]









 Final interview - a chance to have a general discussion, meet the rest of the team and make sure we're the perfect fit for each other. You'll have learnt more about us by this stage, and this is a chance to have any remaining questions answered!








 What Will You Be Doing?








 Have an impact and define our data architecture









 Develop and support software, including applications, database integrations, interfaces, and new functionality enhancements









 Help guide our overall data strategy through design, prototyping, and market research









 Report directly to our founding team









 Taking ownership of products and going all the way from ideation to shipping features









 We're early, so you'll have the opportunity to participate in decision-making on the technologies we use, and you'll be influential in defining our engineering culture from the ground up








 What We Are Looking For








 Solid Python, SQL, Pandas, Postgres, and MongoDB experience









 Experience with developing and owning data pipelines end to end (ELT, ETL, DAG)









 Open-source orchestrators like Prefect or Airflow









 Experience using data warehouses (SnowFlake, BigQuery, AWS Redshift)









 Web Scraping, JavaScript/NodeJS, and Docker are a plus








 How to Apply






 No matter who you are or where you are, we'd love to hear from you! If you are interested and want to join Specter, you can email us at careers@tryspecter.com.







 Please include:








 Include the role's title in your subject line.









 Send links that best showcase the relevant things you've built and done.








 Please note that we are doing interviews on a rolling basis.

title: Data Scientist Intern
description:
As the tech firm that created the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, we’ve made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead, and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology. This is a place where you're welcomed as your own perfectly unique self, and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team. Are you in? 
Come, and be where it begins.
 
About this opportunity
 
We are now looking for a Data Scientist intern for ML/AI to develop and maintain components that deliver Telecom Insights on top of Ericsson Expert Analytics (EEA) portfolio! 
EEA is a powerful tool offered to telecom operators producing customer insights in real time. Backed by specialized metrics for predicting customer happiness, EEA provides the kind of deep understanding of customer behavior that allows service providers to proactively improve experience, satisfaction.
 Link: https://www.ericsson.com/en/network-automation/telecom-analytics 
We are expanding our Budapest EEA development and support organization. We work in small teams that use Agile methodology to keep up in a fast-paced business environment, we closely cooperate with Ericsson Research, customer units and service delivery organization. Our product platform combines cloud-based solutions with Big Data methodologies with our outstanding complex event processing to build a state-of-the-art analytics and decision management system. 
 
What you will do


 Work with / as a Data Scientists on use cases
 Automate and scale model training, inference, and evaluation
 Collaborate with various teams, such as Data Scientist team, DevOps teams, BI team, and business stakeholders
 Get familiar with the data structure – this requires continuous knowledge transfer from our telecommunications experts, so you’ll get familiar with the telco domain as well
 Help Work with real big data processing pipelines, prepare data for predictive and prescriptive modeling
 Help us conducting different analytical tasks to better understand the fundamental relationships behind our datasets, improving the quality of our modeling activity
 Help us finding approaches that are capable of handling large volumes of data (terabytes)
 Work together with telco experts to come up with machine learning and statistical models to solve network monitoring/optimization and marketing related tasks
 Learn working with parallel algorithms
 Take part in brainstorming sessions where the aim is to find use-cases that are both valuable to customers and feasible as well
 Learn how to create proof-of-concept models and how to develop and integrate them into production level codebases
 And most importantly: you will have to read and learn a lot, both from our data scientists and from books/articles/blog posts
 Work on own patents and inventions

 
 You will bring
 

Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Systems
 Previous experience with data in manufacturing/operations environment would be a plus
 Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes
 data engineering or machine learning engineer background
 Industry experience with Scala, Python, SQL
 Experience with Code and Data versioning: we use GitHub and DVC
 Experience with MLOps with focus on all steps of ML project lifecycle e.g., Data Preparation, Modeling, Deployment, Monitoring
 Experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining data pipelines in Event-driven, microservices-based distributed landscape
 Experience of various database and storage technology such as Vertica, S3 MinIO, PostgresSQL, HBase
 Experience with methodologies such as continuous integration and continuous delivery.
 Experience with code refactoring, design patterns, design-driven development, continuous deployment, highly scalable applications, application security.

 
 It's a huge plus if you have
 

Industry experience in building and productizing end-to-end analytics system of Machine Learning and Data Scientist projects
 Good knowledge of any distributed computing tools such as PySpark, Dask, Ray
 Expereince in working with AWS, Azure or GCP cloud provider (certifications are a huge plus)
 MLOps experience in terms of model monitoring, data drift detection, re-training implementation, model roll-back, for machine learning solutions
 Experience with Big Data technologies, stream processing (e.g.: Hadoop, Kafka)
 Experience with reporting BI tools (e.g. Spotfire, Tableau)
 Ability and willingness to quickly adopt new technologies and/or business domains
 Experience in Telecommunication Industry

 
 We offer you
 

A supportive multinational environment, where we believe in teamwork
 Great challenges that will give you the opportunity for continuous learning and advancement in your technical career
 To work with a talented group of Data Scientists, DevOps teams and BI developers, who will help to develop new ideas and solve complex problems of the network
 To work on big projects that will go into production, so you will not work for your desk drawer
 In our view for the continued sharpness of mind, regular brain exercise is required. To ensure this opportunity is provided across the board, trainings and conferences are encouraged and supported.

 
 Why join Ericsson?

 Here at Ericsson, our culture is built on over a century of courageous decisions. With us, you will no longer be dreaming of what the future holds – you will be redefining it. You won’t develop for the status quo but will build what replaces it. Joining us is a way to move your career in any direction you want; with hundreds of career opportunities in locations all over the world, in a place where co-creation and collaboration are embedded into the walls. You will find yourself in a speak-up environment where empathy and humanness serve as cornerstones for how we work, and where work-life balance is a priority. Welcome to an inclusive, global company where your opportunity to make an impact is endless.
 
What happens once you apply?

 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. 
Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more. 
#LI-Hybrid

 For more information on our presence and activities in Hungary, please visit Areas in Ericsson Hungary.
 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.
 Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.
 Primary country and city: Hungary (HU) || Hungary : Budapest : Budapest Job details: Developer

title: Data Engineer
description:
Intelligencia.ai is a technology company at the heart of Healthcare and AI. Our mission is to bring novel therapies to patients faster and more efficiently by applying Data Science to Drug Development. We are pioneering the use of AI for assessing and addressing fundamental risks to maximize the odds of multiple life changing therapeutics.
 Our people are the core of our success. We are a fast growing company that operates in a diverse, cross-functional and flexible environment. Our team consists of intellectually curious minds with a can-do attitude that love what they do and enjoy being part of a highly collaborative team. Together, we are solving complex problems and making a positive impact on people's lives by building cutting-edge technologies.

 Our Engineering team is focused on applying engineering rigor and innovative design elements to our machine learning driven platform with a mission to accelerate drug development process. This role will be a key contributor to the design and implementation of data engineering pipelines to ingest billions of data points across hundreds of features from publications, patents, genomics, and many other sources.
 As a Data Engineer at Intelligencia, you will be a part of a hyper-growth team that makes data a first-class citizen at Intelligencia. You will help to architect, build, and launch scalable data pipelines to support Intelligencia's growing data processing and analytics needs. A successful candidate is a self-starter, biased for action, has a problem-solving mindset and will be able to work with minimum supervision.
 Join us if you are excited to

Design and implement efficient and robust data processing pipelines
Bring algorithms prototyped by data scientists to production
Design and build performant micro-services and frontend-facing APIs
Use modern data and cloud infrastructure (Airflow, Google Cloud, Kubernetes)
Work as part of a highly motivated team that believes in the product that they are building

What you'll bring to the team

At least 5 years of experience in software development
Database modeling and query optimization, preferably using PostgreSQL Programming in Python 3
At least 1 major web framework of your preferred language, such as Django, Flask
Experience with task orchestration tools (preferably Airflow)
Cloud services (preferably Google Cloud), docker
Software engineering best practices such as testability, modularity, code reviews, pair-programming

What's in it for you

A competitive salary
Private Health Insurance
Ability to participate in Intelligencia's equity compensation plan/ future success of the company
Career Development Stipend
A great opportunity to grow and work with some of the most exceptional minds in the industry
Being part of an environment that offers challenging goals, autonomy, and mentoring, which creates unparalleled opportunities both for you and the team
You will be part of a mission to bring novel therapies to patients faster and more efficiently by applying Data Science to drug development

As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Intelligencia is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion.

title: Business Intelligence Developer / Analyst - Remote, Full-Time
description:
Bluelight Consulting is a leading software consultancy seeking a skilled Business Intelligence Analyst to join our fast-growing team. Our mission is to design and develop technology that improves the lives of its users while providing an exceptionally high level of service to our clients.
  


 We are looking for Business Intelligence Analysts who want to be part of a fast-paced, dynamic environment, where everyone’s opinions and efforts are valued. We hire outstanding individuals and give them the opportunity to thrive in a collaborative atmosphere that values learning, growth, and hard work.
  


 Our team is distributed across the United State and Central / South America. If you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, and rapidly-growing software development consultancy, and if you are passionate about software development and creating the finest apps in the marketplace, please apply below.
  



What We Are Looking For


 Should have experience in creating database architectures
 Should have experience in developing and managing Azure SQL Data Warehouse based system
 Should have sound experience in creating multidimensional cubes and Tabular models
 Customer-facing with strong communication skills
 2+ years experience working with Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, SQL data warehouse, and PostgreSQL
 3+ years experience building and administering ETL, Analysis Services, tabular, and multi-dimensional reporting models using Power BI, Tableau, SSAS, SSRS, and SSIS that are compatible with data-warehousing industry standards
 3+ years experience generating reporting solutions including Power BI and Tableau
 Demonstrated expertise using advanced-level calculations on data sets including the use of PowerQuery, M, R, and DAX
 Excellent analytical thinking demonstrated by translating data into informative visual reports, dashboards, and KPI scorecards in Power BI and Tableau
 A four-year college degree is required, with a BS/MS in Computer Science or Information Systems preferred
 Familiarity with JavaScript, CSS, React Web, and other JavaScript libraries desired
 Strong work ethic and the ability to focus and single-task throughout the day
 Ability to work well with team members within an agile development team
 Strong written and verbal communication skills






What You'll Be Doing


 Gathering detailed requirements from the Client for building cubes
 Interact with Business and IT stakeholders to gather requirements for building a multi-dimensional cube
 Design and develop multi-dimensional cubes and tabular models as per industry standards to satisfy business requirements
 Collaborate with Business and get sign-off on the developed components
 Connect to data sources, import data, and transform data for Business Intelligence
 Implement row-level data security and application security-layer models in Power BI and Tableau
 Develop responsive, intuitive, and visually stunning dashboards and reports in both Power BI and Tableau
 Integrate Power BI and Tableau reports into other applications using embedded analytics like Power BI service (SaaS), API automation, and JavaScript/React Web






Company Benefits


 Competitive salary and bonuses, including performance-based salary increases
 Generous paid-time-off policy
 Technology / Office stipend
 100% remote work, now and post COVID
 Continuing education, training, conferences
 Company-sponsored coursework, exams, and certifications






   Being a software consultant is a fun, challenging, and rewarding career choice for engineers. Your contributions are highly valued by clients, and the work you do often has a direct and significant impact on the client’s business.
  


 You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects for our incredible clients, which will help you quickly improve as a consultant and software engineer. You will get to work with modern languages and frameworks alongside some of the best developers in the world!
  


 So if you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, rapidly-growing software consultancy, please apply. #LI-Remote

title: Data Engineer
description:
Your role 

 Interfood is one of the leading global dairy trading firms, both in physical as well as financial products. To support further growth of our business, Interfood is putting digital and analytics in the core of our business strategy. Our Global Analytics team acts as the innovation center on advanced analytics and data science, supporting the strategic agenda set by the Executive Committee. Over the past years, we have built a healthy analytics environment and we are keen to keep working on more use case developments and continuous improvement. This opportunity is for supporting data professionals to grow fast with our organization. You and your team will work in close collaboration and will maintain close ties with the other IT teams (Process & Projects, Digital & Integrations, Cloud & Ops) as well as business functions. 

 Therefore, we encourage data engineers as well as software engineers who enjoy data engineering work to apply. 


In this role, you will:
 Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and other teams to analyse data requirements and deliver solutions. 
Design, build and maintain ETL pipelines. 
Develop and maintain platform monitoring and data quality monitoring jobs. 
Support migrating legacy data solutions to the new data platform. 
Creating a self-service data platform that allows business users and analysts to make the best use of the data available in an easy way. 


As our new Data Engineer you have/are:
 Advanced working knowledge of Python and SQL. 
Knowledge of distributed data processing frameworks (Spark, Hadoop). 
Experience with building and maintaining cloud-based data pipelines. 
Experience in monitoring / dashboarding (e.g. Datadog, Grafana, Kibana). 
Knowledge of IaC framework is a plus (e.g. Terraform). 
Familiar with CI/CD and SW engineering best practices. 
Up-to-date on the latest technologies and trends in the field of data. 
Experience in Agile working. 
Your profile 

 3+ years of experience in SW/Data Engineering. 

 BSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Data Science, or related field. 

 Good communication skills. 

 A passion for data. 

 Excellent in planning and execution. 

 Our offer 
Competitive compensation and benefits. Salary depends on your experience and education. 
We commit to help you stay on top of your game through tailored training and coaching organized with our partner companies. 
High exposure to business and projects with tangible impacts. 
Total health insurance coverage. 
International career opportunities. 
40 hour work week, 20 holidays. 
Travel internationally. 
Gym membership at Synergia Life. 
Participate in fun team activities. 
About Interfood 

 Do you like to work for an international company? Do you value professionality and quality? Are you comfortable in a dynamic environment? But on the other hand looking for cooperation in a close and informal team? Then Interfood is the ideal employer for you. 

 The Interfood Group is a leading global dairy trading company (milk powders, butter, cheese, dairy blends etc.). The Group consists of 14 offices in all continents with more than 350 employees. Our constant strive for optimal quality, up-to-date knowledge and a profound focus on service, enables Interfood to create the difference for its robust network of both clients and suppliers. 

 Interfood keeps on growing and developing by its proactive market approach. 

 We stimulate personal development and initiatives from our employees. Interfood, originally a family-based company, proves that global professionalism can still be combined with a unique personal company culture, in which we focus on following values: Teamwork, Commitment, Continuous Improvement, Professionalism & Responsible Leadership. All contributing to our purpose: Together for better. 

 Will you become our new team member? 



Candidates listed in the National Registry of Persons with Disabilities, who meet the requirements and are qualified for the position described in line with Law Number 19.691 are also included in this job offering.

title: Data Engineer - Mfg. Operations
description:
Do you dream of making a difference in the world? Would you like to help create a more sustainable future for generations to come? Are you looking for a career in a fast-paced, innovative environment working with world class technology and products? Here at Wolfspeed, we are leading the charge into the future of innovation and manufacturing.
 


   We are a global powerhouse semiconductor company leading the transformation from silicon to silicon carbide and GaN technologies providing solutions for efficient energy consumption and a sustainable future. While there is a great deal of complexity in our designs and solutions, what we provide for our customers is simple – we make systems more efficient while reducing cost and increasing performance.
 


   Wolfspeed’s product families include Silicon Carbide materials, power-switching devices and RF devices targeted for various applications such as electric vehicles, fast charging, 5G, renewable energy and storage, and aerospace and defense.
 


   At Wolfspeed, we are on a mission to grow our pack and build diverse, multi-skilled teams that are empowered to shape the future of Wolfspeed. We are problem-solvers, unconventional thinkers and impassioned doers always striving to do things in a better way. We provide excellent learning and development opportunities to help you get to where you want to be and a flexible working environment that enables you to work where it works for you.
 


   We unleash the power of possibilities through hard work, collaboration and a passion for innovation.
 


   The Role
 


   Wolfspeed is looking for a Data Engineer to join our growing community of data experts. You will be part of a global, multi-disciplinary team who manage and support Data Analytics portfolio at Wolfspeed. As our first data engineer in Malaysia, your specific focus will center on building relationships with key business stakeholders at our OSAT contractor facilities and driving data enablement initiatives to meet their needs.
 


   You will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross-functional teams. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys optimizing data solutions and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists while ensuring optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. The Data Engineer will be responsible for the day-to-day activities related to the implementation of new services and support for existing services.
 

   As the Data Engineering liaison to our OSAT facilities, you will work cross-functionally between Wolfspeed business stakeholders and contractor IT teams to enable and support business analytics outcomes. Heavy emphasis will be placed on delivering business value and innovations through the design and integration of information models that spans multiple data sources. Also contributes actively to the overall development and delivery of IT capabilities required to support business growth and provide a competitive advantage for Wolfspeed.
 


   What does your day-to-day look like?
 

 Execute the design, development and support of data solutions for Wolfspeed business partners, including configuration, administration, monitoring, performance tuning, debugging, and operationalization. Technology areas include Cloud Data Warehouse (Snowflake), ETL Tools (Talend), Python, SQL.
 Partner with business stakeholders to create “blueprints” for services that align with overall objectives.
 Provide support while managing SLAs for services owned.
 Participate in the development lifecycle using Agile / DevOps methodologies.
 Translate simple to complex user requirements into functional and actionable analytics, including data modeling (conceptual, logical, physical inc. relational, snowflake, and star schemas).
 Support testing and deployment as part of the full release cycle.
 Serve as a subject matter expert for Wolfspeed operations at OSAT contractor facilities, using that knowledge to craft data solutions that provide maximum visibility to global stakeholders.



   Who are we looking for?
 

   We are looking for intelligent, driven individuals who are passionate about what they do and have exceptional teamwork skills. The skills and experience needed for this role are listed below. However, we understand that there might be a few requirements that you don’t meet or skills that you don’t yet have. That’s ok! If you are a smart, passionate, hardworking individual who is eager to learn we would like to speak with you about joining our wolf pack!
 


   Must Have
 

 Minimum 2+ years’ experience
   
 Working in a Data Engineering role
 Hands-on Python, Java skills and work experience in large scape projects
 Writing complex SQL Queries
 ETL (Informatica, Talend, or Airflow), Data Modeling, Data Warehousing and working with large-scale datasets
 Experience leveraging DevOps and lean development principles such as Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery/Deployment using tools like Git, Azure DevOps
 Building and managing Data platform leveraging public cloud technologies
 Design and build modern data pipelines and data streams




   Nice to have
 

 Experience with Semiconductor or High-Tech Manufacturing
 Experience with modern data warehousing/data lake technologies, such as Snowflake
 Experience with Azure Functions or AWS Lambda
 Familiarity with Linux OS / bash scripting
 Comfortable writing REST API calls
 Experience building parsers for unstructured textual files



   What can Wolfspeed offer you?
 

 An opportunity to join a highly motivated, inspiring team working on technology that is set to unleash new possibilities and create positive changes to the way we live.
 A fun, inclusive working environment providing fantastic learning and development programs designed to enable individuals to achieve career goals and grow with the company.
 Performance based bonus plan



   This role may require additional duties and/or assignments as designated by management.

title: Technical Services Engineer
description:
Functional Responsibilities

 To provide effective technical analysis to the Flight Operations Department.

 Functional Duties

 Maintain an efficient reliability program to analyze and improve fleet efficiency and performance
 Analyze engine trend data for condition monitoring of engines, and data for other critical aircraft components to maintain inherent reliability
 Liaise with Engineering Department in various data and performance analysis.Liaise with Dispatch and Technical and Development pilots in operational matters (Route studies, Airport suitability, EDTO, etc.)
 Produce takeoff and landing performance data used in daily operations
 Design and maintain special takeoff flight procedures (EOSID) to avoid obstacles/terrain
 Maintain performance data, supporting documentation and Company manuals
 Liaise with vendors, and OEM, flight crew and airport authorities to assist with the production/assessment/validation of performance and navigation data
 Conduct performance analysis in new route study. Assesses Airworthiness data for performance impact
 Manage the airlines EFB program and ensure a reliable operation
 Analyze engine drift down/decompression strategy for certain route segments
 Conduct inflight data collection/monitoring for technical purpose and flight deck familiarization on flights
 Publish EFB Notices to inform flight crew and EFB users regarding all EFB related matters
 Conduct other duties as assigned by DFO/CPTD.

 Education

 Diploma in Engineering (any field) preferably aviation. Fresh graduates are encouraged to apply



We are all different - one talent to another - that is how we rely on our differences. At AirAsia, you will be treated fairly and given all chances to be your best.We are committed to creating a diverse work environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
 

Search Firm Representatives - AirAsia does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place.

title: Data Engineer (Elasticsearch)
description:
A projektről  
 Gyere és dolgozz velünk nemzetközi média partnerünk projektjén. Egy új, Data Alliance centert építünk, ezzel megvalósítva egy új, innovatív AI és Machine Learning technológiákat ötvöző adat-vezérelt szolgáltatási csomagot. Data Engineering csapat nap, mint nap azon dolgozik, hogy a begyűjtött adathalmazok strukturálásával és automatizálásával és egy személyre szabottabb felhasználói élményt nyújtsunk a mindennapokban, legyen szó Böngészési szolgáltatások vagy akár Kedvencek lista összeállításról a platformon. Ezekkel dolgozhatsz: Google Cloud Platform, Terraform; Kubernetes, Docker; BigQuery; Apache Beam; Elasticsearch; Python, Java, SQL; REST APIs, GraphQL
Mi lesz a feladatod?  

 Szoros együttműködés a Data Scientist, Infra csapatokkal, valamint a POkkal
 Data pipeline implementálása, stream és batch feldolgozásra, amely a keresési indexek alapjait szolgálja
 Machine learning modellek építése
 Query rewriting funkciók tervezése és implementálása,
 Algoritmusok rankelése keresési találatok optimalizálásához

 Mire lesz szükséged?  

 Legalább 4 év tapasztalat szoftverfejlesztésben
 Erős Python kódolási tudás
 Elasticsearchben szerzett tapasztalat
 Magabiztos Angol nyelvtudás
 Adat feldolgozási és tárolási eljárásokban tapasztalat: Datapipeline, ETL tervezés, implementálás
 Cloud ismeretek, GCP előny
 Valamennyi tech ismerete az alábbiak közül: Airflow, Kafka, Kubernetes, Prometheus, Grafana, OpsGenie, Google Cloud Platform, Terraform

 Miért fogod nálunk jól érezni magad?  
 Feketeöves csapat - Egy klassz, szakmailag profi csapathoz fogsz csatlakozni, ahol mindenki feketeöves
 Fejlődés - A szakmai fejlődésedet tréningekkel, vizsgákkal támogatjuk
 Változatosság – lehetőséged van projektek és üzletágak között váltani
 Meetups - Havonta tartunk Meetup-okat különböző szakmai témákban, így a tudásmegosztás garantált
 ️ Rugalmasság - Ha megszeretted a home office-t, akkor itt Covid után sem kell lemondanod róla
 Támogatás - Törődő szervezet vagyunk, így ha bármilyen problémád, vagy nehézséged merül fel a mindennapok során, a vezetőd támogatására számíthatsz

title: QA Engineer
description:
Company Description
  The Veeam Quality Assurance team invites you to work on Veeam’s products together with Veeam QA professionals in Prague.
 Veeam creates software products to solve complicated tasks in the areas of data protection and management. We work with VMware vSphere, Microsoft Hyper-V and Nutanix AHV virtualization platforms; Windows, Linux and Unix operating systems; Active Directory, Exchange, SharePoint, SQL, Oracle and SAP HANA servers and databases; Amazon, Azure and Google public clouds; and many other technologies forming the core of the modern IT-world.




 Job Description
 

 “Deep diving” into our products, technology and profession.
 Analysing software requirements.
 Testing one or several Veeam products.
 Participating in products’ creation and development at all stages of their life cycle.
 Communicating with other participants of the product development process.
 Evaluating test results, maintaining defects database.
 Participating in customer technical support processes.




 Qualifications
  You have:

 Technical education or passion for technology.
 1-2 years of software testing experience.
 Advanced knowledge of Windows or Linux operating systems.
 Understanding of network technologies and systems (DNS, DHCP, basic network settings, etc.).
 Good understanding of software development principles and the QA role in this process.
 Open and flexible mind, common sense, clear logic, analytical skills.
 Desire to grow in the software testing field.
 Desire and ability to work in a team.
 Knowledge of English, enough to read technical documentation.

 Additional skills:

 Experience working with databases.
 Experience working with virtualization platforms.
 Experience in test automation.

 Additional Information
  We offer:

 Excellent professional and career opportunities in the international team of talented and energetic people.
 Welcome bonus (in amount of 2 monthly gross salaries).
 Generous benefits package from the very first day of your employment including: premium healthcare program for you and your children, sick days, additional payments for sick leave, meal tickets, MultiSport card, public transport pass, cell phone contract.
 Cafeteria Benefit Plan – an additional annual budget that you can spend on a variety of benefits such as travel, sport, wellness, education and many more.
 Flexible working hours, no bureaucracy or formalism.
 Professional trainings and education, including courses and conferences, English & Czech classes, internal meetups and unlimited access to online library
 Work permit assistance.

 Please note: If the applicant is permanently present outside of the Czech Republic, Veeam reserves the right to refuse to consider the application for a job. Remote job is only possible in case the employee is located in the Czech Republic.

title: Data Processing and Automation-Development Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
Tasks



Your core activities consist of automation of data analysis processes on vehicle measured data 
You work on innovative measurement functions development and implementation 
You develop, test and deploy data analysis pipeline microservices 
You manage and track project targets 
You present results in project meetings and reviews 
You work in team and cooperate with other project teams 
You work on testing of hardware and software functions in prototype vehicles 
Collaborating with international project teams 





Qualifications



You have successfully completed a Bachelor´s or Master’s Degree with technical focus in mechanical and/or electrical engineering, applied math, information technology or an equivalent education 
You have good knowledge of one or more programming languages and modeling tools such as Matlab/Simulink, Python, R, Java, C/C++ and CAPL 
Your knowledge of vehicle communication structure and its analysis is an advantage 
You speak English very well, and German language is considered a plus 
You have excellent communication and teamwork skills as well as a high affinity for delivering first-quality engineering services to the customer 
You are flexible and willing to travel abroad/domestic, whenever it is required

title: Data Scientist / AI Engineer
description:
Description: 
     À propos de l’emploi
Hager Group est l’un des principaux fabricants mondiaux de l’industrie électrique.
Nous ouvrons un poste en Science des données / Intelligence Artificielle (IA) pour répondre à la croissance rapide du périmètre science et ingénierie des données.


Le poste est situé à Obernai (région de Strasbourg, France). 
Le travail à distance partiel est possible. Ce poste n’implique pas de déplacements réguliers.


Nous souhaitons une prise de poste entre mars et mai 2023.


Contexte :
L’équipe Data Science et Data Engineering fait partie du département Data Excellence Factory et, avec près de 5 ans d’existence, l’équipe dispose aujourd’hui d’un large portefeuille de projets en collaboration avec diverses activités internes, telles que les usines de fabrication, la maintenance ou la vente. 
Nous développons et exploitons des pratiques MLOps pour pousser nos produits d’apprentissage automatique (machine / deep learning) en production et assurer les activités de surveillance et de maintenance des modèles.
Nous travaillons dans un environnement Microsoft Azure et offrons à nos employés la possibilité de passer des certifications officielles.


Le poste est situé à Obernai (France, région de Strasbourg) dans un environnement très stimulant avec des interactions quotidiennes avec d’autres équipes Digital & Information, telles que la gouvernance des données, la qualité des données, la Business Intelligence, l’IoT ou la cybersécurité.
 Missions 
Bien que nous traitions différents types de jeux de données, nous privilégions pour ce poste les candidats ayant déjà une expérience sur des projets liés aux images, tels que la classification et la reconnaissance d’images.


Vos responsabilités comprennent :

Assurer des échanges réguliers avec le métier pour comprendre leurs besoins et leur fournir des produits de data science adaptés. Pour cette mission, vous bénéficierez également du soutien de notre business analyst.
Gestion de la collecte et du prétraitement des données. Le support sur le cloud et l’environnement DevOps sera fourni par notre architecte cloud.
Développer des modèles de machine/deep learning adaptés et être capable de justifier vos choix avec des métriques. Vous aurez l’occasion d’échanger avec d’autres data scientists et partenaires académiques.
Déployer vos modèles et les adapter aux retours des utilisateurs. 
Effectuer une veille technologique et scientifique pour être au courant de l’état de l’art.


 
Profil
Compétences techniques

Issu d’une formation technique ou scientifique, vous avez au moins 2 ans d’expérience sur des projets de science des données / machine learning. Vous êtes complètement opérationnel avec les librairies Python habituelles en science des données. 
Vous avez déjà travaillé sur des sujets liés à l’image, ou du moins livré des projets impliquant des réseaux de neurones convolutifs.
D’autres expériences en data science (séries temporelles, NLP...) seraient un plus.
Vous savez déployer un modèle à partir d’un environnement DevOps. 
Une certification ou des connaissances sur un environnement cloud seraient un atout important (Azure, AWS, etc.).
Vous connaissez les méthodologies Agile.
Puisque vous travaillerez dans un contexte international, l’anglais est obligatoire.


 
Savoir être 

Solide esprit d’analyse.
Rigueur méthodologique et bonne gestion des priorités.
Grande implication dans la livraison des projets.
Orientation client : vous cherchez à comprendre les besoins de vos clients internes.
Aimer le travail d’équipe.

Notre offre
Vous pouvez vous attendre à un poste avec des responsabilités et de la variété, des collègues très engagés et motivés, dans un environnement international et innovant. Nous proposons une intégration intensive, une rémunération attractive et équitable ainsi que des formations internes et externes.
Nous avons un partenariat solide avec Microsoft : accès aux ressources de R&D et d’ingénierie Microsoft et support par un partenaire Gold externe de Microsoft.


Votre défis
Saisissez votre chance future et convainquez-nous. Vous pouvez télécharger facilement votre candidature dans notre système de gestion des applications à l’échelle du groupe. S’il vous plaît utiliser l’opportunité de l’application en ligne, 10 minutes suffisent! Nous sommes disponibles à l’avance pour vos questions spécifiques.

title: Data Engineer SR.
description:
Somos uma das consultorias que mais cresce no Brasil. Atuamos em negócios e tecnologia com foco em transformações que geram valor, deixando as companhias mais eficientes e competitivas. Desde sua criação em 2012, a Peers cresce de forma acelerada e sustentável, em faturamento, resultado e equipe.

 Nossos colaboradores contam com:

 Remuneração diferenciada + pacote de benefícios atrativo
 Desenvolvimento humano
 Plano de carreira
 Programa de mentoring
 Exposição frequente com profissionais/executivos
 Trabalho híbrido ou remoto
 Liberdade e autonomia para inovar e intraempreender
 Experiência em projetos diversos


 Em digital, atuamos nas seguintes frentes:

 Estratégia e transformação digital: transformação digital e agilidade organizacional
 Experiência digital: design de jornadas e arquitetura corporativa
 Data analytics: arquitetura e governança de dados, business intelligence, advanced analytics
 Gestão de tecnologia: gestão de programas e projetos, governança de TI, cyber security, gestão de squads.


 Para continuarmos nos diferenciando, buscamos no mercado por talentos que acreditem em nosso propósito e que queiram crescer e se desenvolver profissionalmente, além de alavancar nosso grupo de associados. Buscamos por profissionais que façam a diferença e sejam movidos por desafios!

 IMPORTANTE: O contrato desta posição será em modelo híbrido, com possibilidade de opção do candidato pelas bases de São Paulo/SP ou Belo Horizonte/MG.

 Responsabilidades e atribuições
 Responsabilidades e atribuições:
 ﻿

Criar e manter arquiteturas e pipelines de dados
Montar conjuntos de dados grandes e complexos que atendam aos requisitos de negócios e aos requisitos dos nossos clientes
Identificar, projetar e implementar melhorias de processos internos: automatizando processos manuais, otimizando a entrega de dados, redesenhando a infraestrutura para maior escalabilidade, etc.
Criar a infraestrutura necessária para extração, transformação e carregamento ideais de dados de uma ampla variedade de fontes de dados usando as tecnologias de 'big data' SQL, NoSQL, e nuvens como AWS, Azure e GCP.
Criar ferramentas de análise que utilizem o pipeline de dados para fornecer insights sobre aquisição de clientes, eficiência operacional e outras métricas importantes de desempenho de negócios.
Trabalhar com as partes interessadas, incluindo as equipes de Executivo, Produto, Dados e Design para ajudar com problemas técnicos relacionados a dados e apoiar suas necessidades de infraestrutura de dados.


 Requisitos e qualificações
 Pré-requisitos:


 Uma história bem-sucedida de manipulação, processamento e extração de valor de grandes conjuntos de dados desconectados.
Forte capacidade de gerenciamento de projetos e organização.
Experiência de suporte e trabalho com equipes multifuncionais em um ambiente dinâmico.
Mais de 5 anos de experiência em uma função de Engenheiro de Dados
Ter diploma de Ciência da Computação, Estatística, Informática, Sistemas de Informação, Engenharia ou outro que comprove formação técnica aprofundada.
Experiência com ferramentas de big data: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experiência com bancos de dados relacionais SQL e NoSQL
Experiência com pipeline de dados e ferramentas de gerenciamento de fluxo de trabalho: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
Experiência com serviços de nuvem
Experiência com sistemas de processamento de fluxo: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
Experiência com linguagens de script orientadas a objetos: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc.
(Diferencial) Experiência com banco de dados orientado a grafos: Neo4j
(Diferencial)Pós-graduação e experiência em consultoria;
Inglês avançado;
Boa comunicação: verbal (apresentação, seminários) e escrita (relatórios, artigos, etc);


 Informações adicionais
 Fit cultural com nossos valores:

 Atitude e competência
 Simplicidade e pragmatismo
 Empatia e parceria
 Transparência e colaboração
 Reconhecimento e meritocracia


 Nossos associados Peers contam ainda com diversos benefícios, sendo alguns deles:

 PLR
 Plano de Saúde sem coparticipação
 Vale Refeição
 Peers Mobilidade: Auxílio com locomoção para escritório
 Peers Hobbismo: Auxílio para práticas esportivas, leitura e bem-estar
 Peers Maternidade: Licença remunerada de 180 dias a partir da data de nascimento do filho
 Peers Paternidade: Licença remunerada de 30 dias a partir da data de nascimento do filho
 Dayoff de Aniversário
 Trabalho remoto
 Plano de Treinamentos


 Aqui na Peers prezamos pela diversidade e pela inclusão. Buscamos talentos alinhados com nossos valores e nossa cultura independente de etnia, religião, sexualidade, deficiência ou nacionalidade. Portanto, se você possui as qualificações necessárias para uma de nossas vagas e quer fazer parte do nosso time, fique à vontade para se candidatar!

 Somos uma das consultorias de negócios & tecnologia que mais cresce no país.
 Nascemos com o propósito de ajudar nossos clientes a obter resultados duradouros executando projetos transformadores, de forma pragmática e simples.
 Desde sua criação em 2012, a Peers cresce de forma acelerada e sustentável, em faturamento, resultado e equipe.

 Tem a característica de ser uma consultoria ‘hands on’, que atua de forma diferenciada, não se limitando ao diagnóstico e à apresentação de soluções, mas também executando as ações propostas, monitorando resultados e atuando até mesmo como responsável pelo início da nova operação.
 Com ampla experiência em projetos junto a empresas líderes em seus segmentos e outras recém adquiridas pelos maiores fundos de private equity atuantes no Brasil, a Peers atua em praticamente todos os segmentos de mercado.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
Senior Analytics Engineer

 About RVezy
 RVezy is an innovative travel experience company that brings aspiring vacationers and RV owners together. Founded in 2016, we provide a platform for RV rentals available across most of Canada and the United States.

 RVezy serves thousands of renters and owners across North America, and you will be helping ensure they have a safe, secure, and enjoyable experience throughout each RV rental. We have a tight-knit team that has meaningful relationships with one another. Check out our reviews on Glassdoor and Indeed.

 We have grown exponentially, and our three-year revenue increased 2768% (2018-2021), as mentioned in the Globe and Mail’s: Canada's Top Growing Companies 2021.

 Want to see more? Check us out online.
 Dragons’ Den — http://www.cbc.ca/dragonsden/pitches/rvezy
 On TV — https://youtu.be/WFbmhxU1ScM
 Instagram — @lifeatrvezy
 LinkedIn — https://www.linkedin.com/company/rvezy.com/
 Website — https://www.rvezy.com
 iOS app — https://apps.apple.com/ca/app/rvezy-rv-trailer-rental/id1419681521
 Android app — https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.rvezy&hl=en_CA&gl=US

 About the role
 The Data Team at RVezy works with many teams to get the most out of their data. As an analytics engineer, you will work with analysts to build data models the right way and serve as a thought leader around data governance best practices and our data infrastructure. RVezy is looking for a talented individual to join the team to build and maintain foundational data infrastructure essential to gaining insights.

 Your daily impact
 This role will be instrumental in shaping the team’s technical direction and growth. There is a significant opportunity for growth for the right candidate.


 Build and maintain internal and external ELT & ETL pipelines
Architect and develop performant, accurate, intuitive, timely, intuitive, and scalable data models using DBT and Tableau using DRY (don’t repeat yourself) principles.
Understand the business context and support analysts/business partners in creating and standardizing source-of-truth Tableau Reports and Dashboards.
Document work, prioritize data governance, and evangelize best practices.
Act as a champion for self-service analytics across the organization by working to enable individuals to leverage our data models, reports, and tools.
Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and data scientists to understand how data is generated and used to make decisions.



 At RVezy, we’ve invested significantly in a modern data tech stack (BigQuery, Fivetran/Stitch, Prefect, Segment, Tableau, Metabase, Indicative) and a world-class data function. If you’re excited about using the best technology out there to make the biggest impact, while being part of a growing team that values collaboration, proactivity, disciplined decision making, and knowledge sharing, we want to hear from you.

 Who you are:

3-5 years of experience in an analytics engineer, data engineering, business intelligence, or technical data analytics role supporting an ecommerce business or marketplace.
Expertise in SQL and data modeling, especially using cloud-based data warehouses like BigQuery, as well as version control software (git). Plus: Knowledge of GCP data ecosystem and data ingestion tools (E.g. Fivetran/Stitch). Existing experience with DBT is highly desirable.
Excellent interpersonal skills, particularly when explaining technical or complex matters to less technical co-workers.
Ability to leverage tools, business intuition, and attention to detail when developing models and in data validation and QA.
Experience designing and implementing transformations on top of transactional, event, and SAAS data sources to produce simple to understand data models usable by analysts and business users.


 Bonus points:

Light development experience with Python, Javascript, and/or C# for dealing with more complex data transformation, ingestion, generation (internal or external).



 RVezy perks

RVezy stock options (we believe every colleague should be an owner).
Fifteen paid vacation days with extra time off over the winter holidays.
Health and dental benefits from day one.
One paid weeklong RV rental trip every year.


Opportunities to attend festivals, concerts, and RV shows across Canada and the U.S.


Employee recognition platform to reward employees’ hard work.
Frequent social events and a steady supply of coffee and snacks in the office.
Dog-friendly work environment in the Ottawa office.
Flexible work hours and a relaxed dress code.
Company laptop and equipment provided.
Paid sick days.
benefits: Dental insurance, Paid time off, Stock options,

title: Software Engineer - Data Platform
description:
Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to deliver a multi-cloud and on-premise data solution for the enterprise, which spans the full range of data stores and data technologies from big data, with Yugabyte, Spark and Kafka, through NoSQL and cache-layer capabilities like Redis, MongoDB and Opensearch, all the way to structured SQL engines like PostgreSQL and MySQL.
 This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about delivering high quality, reliable and automated infrastructure based on open source software running on Kubernetes, the public cloud and bare-metal. We are facing the challenge of fault-tolerant mission critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.
 Experience using data platform tools is desirable, but not over hands-on experience installing, configuring and operating such technologies.
 Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, automation, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of open source community dynamics, and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organizations.
 What you'll do

Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality, idiomatic Python code to create new features
Debug issues and interact with upstream communities, in the open
Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events

Who you are

You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud and experience with private cloud solutions like OpenStack
You are experienced with Kubernetes and believe it can be used for serious persistent data services
You are an accomplished Python programmer that enjoys challenging projects in mission-critical environments
You have experience operating and managing data platform technologies like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Opensearch, Kafka, Yugabyte

Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.

title: Trainee Software Engineer (Data Science)
description:
Job Details




     Job Title
    

     Trainee Software Engineer (Data Science)
    




     Location
    

     Lahore

     Experience

     5
    




Job Description

Nextbridge Pvt Ltd requires 5 x Trainee Software Engineer (Data Science) who have exposure to programming and spark to learn quickly. This position is based in Lahore, Pakistan.  Responsibilities:

 Training in a relevant technology stack.
 Development of enterprise applications.
 Maintenance and upgrades (new features, refactoring, bug fixing) of existing programs
 Additional duties as assigned.

 Requirements:

 Majoring in Computer Science, Data Science Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline.
 Community and/or campus involvement. [Would be a plus]
 Strong OOP Concepts.
 Knowledge of Design Patterns are desirable.
 Proven concepts of Databases.
 Strong technical skills including understanding of software development principles.
 Positive attitude and strong work ethics.
 Ability to quickly adapt to a changing environment.
 Ability to quickly learn new concepts and software is necessary.
 Candidate should be a self-motivated, independent, detail oriented, responsible team-player.
 Good communication skills, both written and oral.

title: Senior Analytics Solutions Engineer (Senior Business Intelligence Analyst)
description:
Job requisition number

037565



Job location

Richmond 



Full-time / part-time

Full-time



Posting period 

From 12/09/2022 to 01/27/2023 







Overview

We have an opportunity for a senior analytics solutions engineer (Senior Business Intelligence Analyst) in our Innovation & Technology division to create, deliver, support and maintain analytics solutions for various WorkSafeBC business areas, including dashboards and applications using low-code/no-code technologies. You will be responsible for creating solutions which aid in performance management, operations optimization, and data exploration.
You will develop solutions and conduct analysis on a wide variety of issues (e.g. occupational health and safety, financial risk exposure, and injured worker claims and successful rehabilitation) using various sources of business data and communicating findings and related interpretations/observations with primarily, but not exclusively, an internal audience.
At this time, this is a hybrid position where you will work primarily at home and be on-site at our Richmond office occasionally.

What you'll do

As a senior analytics solutions engineer you will:

Govern production analytics solutions by facilitating and enhancing the production solution promotion process, creating and managing templates to ensure a consistent look and feel, and ensuring the high quality of production solutions prior to promotion.
Contribute to the evolution of the production analytics solution development practice 
Use a structured approach to lead agile and waterfall/traditional projects with up to five departmental resources, including ensuring proper documentation, resourcing, planning, delegation of work, budget management, stakeholder management and coordination of work across other departments
Provide analytics solution design leadership to the department by leading design sessions, providing guidance and mentorship, focusing on user-centric and role-centric design, and innovating new and existing analytics solution types
Design, build, implements and support composite analytics applications and automated workflow
Manage production analytics solutions by following an asset management mindset, managing content on production analytics solution platforms, implementing security requirements, configuring administrative settings and options, and interfacing with other teams and vendors as needed.
Work with the business to elicit requirements, focusing on the intended outcome and working backwards, and proactively communicating and collaborating with internal customers
Independently discover the best available data to utilize for the analytics use-case through conducting research, understanding sources and gaps, reading through documentation and metadata, creating logic/connections/derivations to generate information and measurements.
Provide ad-hoc analytics solutions and analysis, production analysis solutions design and development and quality assurance


Is this a good fit for you?

We’re looking for someone who can:

Independently manage technology-related projects using project management standards
Lead and motivate a team of people to success
Elicit varied and complex business requirements and objectives and translate complex requirements into a recommended design that provides an optimal user experience
Establish credibility and develop and maintain effective working relationships both internally within the team and with customers
Critically understand and diagnose root causes to difficult or complex issues and develop innovative alternative options and solutions to address both short and long term needs
Provide high quality customer service with a focus on accuracy, relevancy and timeliness based on business requirements

Your experience and educational background:

An undergraduate’s degree in a related discipline such as Business or STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math)
A minimum of three years in an analytics delivery role
Specialist knowledge in analytics, business process analysis, management of information systems, and proven ability to apply key principles and methods used in a production environment

Application Requirements: 
You will be required to successfully meet WorkSafeBC’s requirements with regards to a criminal record clearance.
If you require an accommodation in the assessment process, please email HR Testing Accommodation (SM) at the time you submit your application. Standardized assessments will commence during the posting period.
Who are we?
At WorkSafeBC, we’re dedicated to promoting safe and healthy workplaces across British Columbia. We partner with workers and employers to save lives and prevent injury, disease, and disability. When work-related injuries and diseases occur, we provide compensation, and support injured workers in their recovery, rehabilitation, and safe return to work. We also work diligently to sustain our workers compensation system for today and future generations. We’re honoured to serve the 2.4 million workers and 245,000 registered employers in our province.
WorkSafeBC’s COVID-19 Employee Mandatory Vaccine Policy (the “Policy”) is suspended effective January 9, 2023, however we reserve the right to re-implement it in response to changes in the public health landscape, including public health orders. We are committed to the protection, health, and safety of our employees and our Communicable Disease Prevention Program and related protocols remain in effect.
We recognize that our ability to make a difference relies on building a team with a rich variety of skills, knowledge, backgrounds, abilities, and experiences, and which reflects the diversity of the people we serve. We are committed to fostering a welcoming, inclusive, and supportive work culture where everyone can contribute as their best, authentic self. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply.
What’s it like to work at WorkSafeBC?
It’s challenging, stimulating and hugely rewarding. Our positions offer tremendous diversity and excellent opportunities for professional growth. Every day, the work we do impacts people and changes lives. What we do is important and so are the people we do it for.
Our benefits
Being part of WorkSafeBC means being part of a strong, committed team. As a member of our team, you'll have access to services and benefits that can help you get the most out of work — and life.
WorkSafeBC has adopted a hybrid model offering opportunities to work remotely and onsite based on the operational needs of the position.
Learn more about what we offer.
This position is restricted to those legally entitled to work in Canada.
Thank you, in advance, for applying.

title: Software Engineer - Python and K8s
description:
Our mission is to reinvent the way companies manage their open source information systems - on public clouds and in their own data centres. To achieve that we are building a new community around Python opscode for open source applications, running on Kubernetes. We want to move all of Canonical and Ubuntu IS onto this new, open source codebase.
 We are confident that we can dramatically improve the experience of running complex business operations - and then we can help our customers embrace those new techniques and products. Traditionally, IS is an inward-facing operation. We would like to transform our IS team into an extension of the product engineering capability at Canonical. Our internal workloads are in many cases the same open source workloads that our customers want to operate. This team will productise those workloads for real-time automated operations on Kubernetes.
 This role is ideal for software engineers who enjoy Python, have a passion for distributed systems, and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a role that requires rigour in both code and customer interactions. Our engineers are technically astute open source enthusiasts who are excited about cloud computing and are ready to join a global team charged with delivering world class services to our customers.
 Strong Python development skills and familiarity with Kubernetes are key requirements of this role. You'll work closely with other teams in Canonical to ensure your products operate reliably, efficiently and scale to production sized workloads for our customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology. You will participate and be responsible for ensuring sound software architecture and follow best practices in software quality, testing and documentation.
 What you'll do

Work in Python to design and deliver open source software operations code
Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications
Learn to think rigorously about application and infrastructure reliability
Shape high quality open source monitoring and alerting infrastructure
Simplify open source operations for our customers and open source community
Demonstrate sound engineering design and testing principles in your code
Follow agile software development practices
Coach and develop your colleagues where you have insights
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with company values
Work from home with global travel once or twice a year for up to 2 weeks for events

Who you are

You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud
You are familiar with Docker and Kubernetes
You are an excellent Python programmer and enjoy challenging projects
You understand the importance of reliable software and strive to design and code to that expectation
You are organized and want your team to deliver timely, high quality software

About Canonical
 Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping individuals and businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

 #LI-Remote #Stack

title: Senior Software Engineer - App Stores Backend (Remote)
description:
Summary
 This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
 Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.
 We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.
 What you'll do

Collaborate remotely with a globally distributed team.
Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang).
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale.
Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers.
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions.
Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events.

Who you are

You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people.
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable.
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated.
You have a broad technology base but favor backend code and infrastructure.
You have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python and/or Golang.
You know your way around relational and non-relational databases and can effectively design data models that perform well, and tune queries to access them.
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.

About Canonical
 Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu - the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.
 What Canonical offers:

Work from home
Learning and development allowances
Competitive Salary
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Generous annual leave
Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
Priority Pass for travel
Exposure to international business and technology

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Associate Engineer, Product Data
description:
Associate, Product Data Req ID: 114734 Remote Position: Hybrid Hiring Manager: Lina Roslina Binti Tajuddin Band: 06 Region: Asia Country: Malaysia State/Province: Kedah City: Kulim
 Detailed Descriptions: 
Celestica Global Supply Chain operates as unified virtual system with our customer and suppliers acting as seamless extension of their operation. We offer customized, flexible and intergrade supply chain solutions, supported by a global technology platform and dedicated market focused team 
Responsible for receiving, logging, and converting Customer’s product data into formats used by our systems (Bills of Materials, preferred supplier information). Initiates Engineering Change Orders. title: QA Automation Engineer
description:
Project Description


      Client Document and Records Management is a global technology change and delivery organization comprising nearly 300 individuals located mostly in Switzerland, Poland and Singapore. Providing global capturing and document processing, archiving and retrieval solutions to all business divisions focusing on supporting Legal, Regulatory and Operational functions. At the moment developing strategic project to build large-scale digital archive for documents and records, that will gradually replace all existing archiving solutions in the bank, and to build an operational document store, that should become a single point of truth for document workflows. The whole system must scale linearly, be fault-tolerant, and handle petabytes of data. Within our organization, you would be working on the Product Development project, with the SCRUM POD Teams consisting of Developers, DevOps, Business Analysts and Quality Analysts/Testers.
       Technologies and frameworks used:
      

Development is based on Scala, Java and Javascript language
Agile Delivery Organization based on PODs model
JIRA, Confluence, PPM tools, GitHub would be mostly used by you on a daily basis
Event Driven Architecture with Kafka as event store and Kafka Streams for event streaming
Reactive streams for streaming data over HTTP: Akka HTTP/Streams
 - Non-blocking concurrency: Akka, Monix - FP abstractions: Cats
     




Responsibilities



       We are looking for experienced individual who would be working as QA Automation for the project. Key aspect on this position except technical skills is communication. A person that would be working on such position is expected to be able to speak to senior stakeholders including business representatives.
       
 Responsibilities:
       

Adapt existing tests using the test automation framework and expand test coverage
Configure automated tests to execute reliably and efficiently in CI/CD environments
Identify, share, and nurture the adoption of best practices in code health, testing, testability, and maintainability in collaboration with the wider testing team
Analyze complex software systems and collaborate with others to improve the overall design, testability, and quality
Track and communicate test results in a timely, effective, and automated manner
Collaborate with various teams in building automation test suite covering multiple applications
Effectively document identified defects in the defect tracking system that is easily understood by developers; work with developers as necessary to resolve issues
Provide feedback and report results of testing to management and stakeholders 





Skills

Must have


Willingness and ability to work with both: automation and manual testing
Excellent testing experience and very good understanding of full testing lifecycle
Good understanding of test automation concepts and patterns
Proficiency with Java 8 or later
Good knowledge of Unix console commands
Selenium WebDriver and Rest Assured experience
Test reporting tools experience (Allure)
Practical experience with CI/CD
Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Experience in an agile development environment, agile mindset
Must have excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
Must have ability to build a strong working relationship with the managers and team members 


Nice to have

Experience in banking area 





Languages

English: C1 Advanced


Seniority

Senior


Relocation package

If needed, we can help you with relocation process.




Vacancy Specialization 

QA automation


Ref Number

VR-79573

title: Junior Service Engineer
description:
Are you a Service Engineer looking for an interesting and inspiring opportunity?

 Join our Turbomachinery Services Engineering Team!
 Our Turbomachinery & Process Solutions team provides industry-leading products and services that optimize the extraction, production and processing of energy. We help a diverse range of customers across the value chain to reduce operating costs and improve productivity.

 Partner with the best

 As a Product Service Engineer, you will be responsible for:

 Handling the responsiveness and timeliness metrics for Customer Claim Management cases in her/his area of responsibility.
 Supporting troubleshooting and initiatives with broad scope. Investigates technical issues and define the recovery or mitigation actions.
 Being part of inclusive multifunctional teams to deliver root cause failure analyses (RCA), though data and material analysis.
 Supporting during plant outages preparation, execution and lesson learned with other functions

 Defining the execution plan and manages issues within functional area of expertise, in agreement with the overall strategy of Services Engineering.

Reviewing and proposing Data analytics to improve the predictability


 Fuel your passion
 To be successful in this role you will:

 Have a Bachelor of Science in Engineering, Physics, Chemistry
 Have 5+ years of experience in Heavy Duty Gas Turbine or Centrifugal Compressor design, manufacturing, repair or product service and/or 2-3 years of field experience in Turbomachinery Rotating Equipment, and/or Troubleshooting role
 Scholastic knowledge of rotor dynamic analysis, thermodynamic and performances calculation.

Do you thrive on the possibility of creating new data and modeling data for decision making and reporting? Then you’ll fit right in!  Join us in our exciting journey with implementation of a new data platform to make sure we stay relevant and exceed customer expectations. NNE employee
Department
BIM Design


Location
 Bredevej 2

    Denmark
