title: Data Management Engineer, Junior
description:
Data Management Engineer, Junior
-
(
AUS0007EO
)



 Ausenco es una compañía global que está redefiniendo lo que es posible. Nuestro equipo está basado en 26 oficinas en 14 países, con proyectos en más de 80 ubicaciones en todo el planeta. Con nuestra profunda expertise técnica más un registro de 30 años rompiendo esquemas, entregamos soluciones innovadoras a través de estudios de consultoría de alto valor agregado; ejecución de proyectos; operación de activos y optimización de mantenimiento a los sectores de minería & metales; energía e industrias.



Actualmente nos encontramos reclutando un Data Management Engineer, Junior para incorporarse a nuestro Equipo de consultoría de Global Consulting Pipelines Integrity en Chile, donde tendrá la oportunidad de desarrollar las actividades de gestión de la información documentada y los datos de acuerdo con el modelo de gestión de datos de Ausenco, desarrollando procesos de gestión de documentación documentada, datos e información de manera sustentable, aplicando tecnología de punta para asegurar el acceso seguro, confiable y trazable de la información documentada, los datos y la información de las actividades clave de la gestión de integridad de activos de nuestros clientes.


Acerca del rol

Gestionar la recolección, centralización, integración, validación, recuperación, control, protección, manejo y entrega controlada a terceras partes de los datos críticos para la gestión de integridad de activos de nuestros clientes.
Desarrollo de bases de datos controladas y seguras de la información documentada, datos e información de nuestros clientes y de proyectos.
Desarrollar procedimientos específicos de gestión y gobernanza de Información Documentada, Datos e Información.
Desarrollar Tableros de Control (Dashboards) y Reportabilidad por medio de uso de herramientas BI.
Desarrollo de modelos predictivos por medio de la utilización de tecnología de Machine Learning y AI, según sea aplicable.
Trabajar para la creación de una red de contactos internos y externos con el fin de poder acceder a las bases de datos, datos e información documentada, crítica propiedad de nuestros clientes.
Desarrollar excelentes relaciones con todas las partes interesadas con el fin de asegurar el logreo de los objetivos de los proyectos a los que esté asignado.







Acerca de ti

1 a 5 años de experiencia laboral.
Experiencia en Gestión de Información documentada, Datos e Información; Manejo de Bases de Datos, Desarrollo de Tableros de Control (Dashboards) con herramientas BI, y manejo de datos masivos con herramientas informáticas.
Profesional de la ingeniería, Ingeniero Civil, Industrial o carrera afín.
Con experiencia en gestión de información documentada, gestión de datos, herramientas informáticas avanzadas de Data Minning, Big Data, Machine Learning, Business Intelligence, Artificial Intelligence, entre otras.
Manejo de herramientas de base de datos.
Manejo avanzado de MS Excel.
Conocimiento de Big Data, Data Minning, Cyber Security, Data Management.
Inglés intermedio

Trabajar para Ausenco significa que no te conformarás con el status quo – serás parte de una organización culturalmente diversa y con la mente puesta en el futuro. Esperamos que nuestra gente entregue resultados sobresalientes y te daremos rienda suelta para encontrar la mejor manera para tus clientes y grupos de interés.
Si resultas seleccionado recibirás una compensación competitiva y la oportunidad de crecer y desarrollar tu carrera, construyendo tus habilidades dentro de nuestro equipo.
Fuerza Laboral Diversa e Inclusiva Como compañía global creemos en la diversidad y la impulsamos en su sentido más amplio -género, edad, experiencia, nacionalidad, etnia, idioma, religión, educación, discapacidad, habilidades, estilos de trabajo y dónde te encuentras ubicado. Nuestro ambiente de trabajo se basa en la confianza y el respeto por los derechos y las oportunidades de todos los individuos.
COVID-19 La salud y la seguridad de nuestros empleados y candidatos es primordial. Dadas las condiciones locales de la pandemia, tanto su turno como lugar de trabajo podrían cambiar temporalmente para cumplir con lo requerido por las autoridades.

title: QA Data Engineer
description:
WHY BECOME AN OSTRONAUT?
 Here at Ostro we help millions of people live healthier lives by being the missing, caring link between those who make medicines, treatments, and diagnostics, and those who take them. We create personalized healthcare journeys that boost engagement for consumers and HCPs, and drive value for life sciences brands.
 We are looking for like-minded people eager to join our team and help architect the future of life science commercialization through our enterprise SaaS products. We are a small but mighty team of around 60 (for now!) internationally-based colleagues. As we grow, we are looking for Ostronauts who want to join us on our growth journey to disrupt life science digital marketing and who are ALSO committed to our values of teamwork and honesty!
 Our founding team has designed and built companies on the consumer front acquired by Google, as well as enterprise tech companies deployed across The Fortune 500. We are backed by some of the best investors in the world, including RRE Ventures, Bling Capital, Founders Fund, Greycroft, and more.
 PERKS OF BEING AN OSTRONAUT:
 Impacting the future of healthcare - your innovations could very likely become the new norm for millions of people.
 Working alongside the founders of the company. If you have any entrepreneurial desire to start your own company in the future, you will see first-hand what it takes.
 100% fully remote but with frequent opportunities to collaborate in-person.
 ️ Technology, office setup and co-working space reimbursement!
 Freedom and responsibility to structure your work as you desire. We measure output and results and believe freedom allows for maximum ability.
 ️ Unlimited PTO!
 Family leave: up to 10 weeks of 100% paid salary.
 ✨ Open communication - we believe in being transparent and radically honest with no retaliation.
 Competitive salary and equity
 Medical/dental/vision benefits
 CULTURAL VALUES:
 Practice radical honesty, Assume positive intent, Put people first, Win as a team

 Brief Overview:
 The Data Quality Engineer is an SDET role that provides continuous automated and manual testing of data used by both internal and external clients. Data sets originate internally and externally with different formats and delivery mechanisms. The Data Quality Engineer works closely with the engineers, data scientists, and data analysts to deliver value to our customers and internal teams by proactively discovering issues with the data.
 Role and Responsibilities - Your day-to-day routine

Creating test plans with input from SMEs
Automating test plans and data quality checks
Building monitoring for data delivery from all sources and alerting when problems are detecting
Build test automation for all data portals and customer reports
Recommending improvements to our systems and methods
Raises the bar on system performance and reliability

Qualifications and Education Requirements:

Significant knowledge and experience with test automation strategies for software and data
Solid understanding of ETL processes, tools, and best practices
Strong SQL knowledge
2+ years of data SDET experience

Bonus Qualifications

Familiarity with Python
Familiarity with Metabase
Familiarity with data visualization frameworks for web application



 The full salary range for this position is $147,250 - $198,950 USD. This shows the full range and earning potential for the role, and not the starting point. These numbers are based on our compensation philosophy and US national averages since, as a fully remote company, we do not adjust compensation based on location.
 Ostro's goal is to provide an inclusive and equitable work environment for current and future Ostronauts. In support of our core value of practicing radical honesty, we display our salary range for each job posting across all US locations, whether or not we are required to do so. Within that range, actual compensation is determined by several factors, including but not limited to skills, job expectations, and relevant training.
 Our Talent Acquisition Partners can share more information on our compensation philosophy, during initial interviews. Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only and do not include equity and benefits.


 Ostro provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. 
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.
 Applicant Privacy Notice

title: Data Engineer
description:
Context of the job 
 
Chez Keyteo Luxembourg, nous recrutons des collaborateurs compétents et investis pour assurer la bonne réalisation des projets techniques et fonctionnels de nos clients. Nos principaux secteurs d’intervention sont la Banque, l’Assurance et les Télécommunications. 

Notre structure à taille humaine véhicule trois valeurs principales : 


> Passion: Nous sommes motivés par la passion de réussir et de relever de nouveaux défis. Notre ambition est d’atteindre les exigences techniques et méthodologiques sur chaque projet. 
> Transparence: Notre approche, au travers des valeurs humaines, se veut transparente envers nos collaborateurs et nos clients. Notre mode de collaboration pérenne s’établit sur la confiance afin de fournir la meilleure qualité de service, adapté à chaque environnement. 
> Convivialité : Nous accordons un intérêt majeur au capital humain, pour que chaque personne de notre communauté puisse s’épanouir. Nous sommes persuadés que la convivialité contribue à une meilleure collaboration et permet de générer l’implication de chacun.


 Pour plus d’information, n’hésitez pas à prendre contact avec nous :

 LinkedIn : https://www.linkedin.com/company/keyteo/mycompany/ 
Web : www.keyteo.com 
Instagram : keyteogroup 
Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/keyteogroup/ 
E-mail : recrutement-lu@keyteo.com


 Activities

 o Accompagner les métiers dans l'analyse du besoin 
 o Challenger les solutions et priorités 
 o Vérifier que la conception fonctionnelle est cohérente 
 o Concevoir des solutions décisionnelles pertinentes en tenant compte des enjeux de chaque projet. 
 o Accompagner les équipes internes dans les différents projets 
 o Mise en place des best practices Data( Cube, Reporting & Data visualisation) 
 o Testing des solutions BI 
 o Réaliser des tests avant la livraison des produits 
 o Formation des utilisateurs 
 o Travailler en collaboration avec les équipes DAM
 Required profile 
 
Vos qualifications

 o Expérience professionnelle dans le domaine de la Data d’au moins 5 ans. 
 o Très bonne maitrise des outils Microsoft ( SSAS, SSRS) et Power BI. 
 o SGBD : DB2, SQL Server 
 o Une expérience dans le domaine bancaire. 
 o Compétences en gestion de projet 
 o Esprit analytique 
 o Sens du résultat, rigueur, autonomie 
 o Force de proposition, prise d'initiative 
 o Compétences relationnelles et organisationnelles. 
 o Capacité à gérer des tâches multiples et à s’intégrer dans une équipe. 
 o Maîtrise des langues française. 
 o La connaissance de l’outil Webfocus constitue un atout. 
 o La connaissance des langues luxembourgeoise et allemande constitue un atout.
 Salary

title: Data Build Engineer
description:
At Globe, our goal is to create a wonderful world for our people, business, and nation. By uniting people of passion who believe they can make a difference, we are confident that we can achieve this goal.
 


   Job Description
  Handles data management and provisioning of data for the customer data and analytics unit and MSH as a whole.
 

   ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
 


   Data Quality & Validation
 

   Ensure data accuracy and completeness of data accessed by analytics.
 

 Will work on organizing and automating/managing data requirements of MSH-CDA.
 Design and Build datamarts. Establish and enhance data collection activities.



   Data Architecture & Capability Roadmap
 

   Establish and determine the optimal procedures to lift Analytics team productivity, efficiency and fast-track achievement of Analytics Vision to know everything about the customer.
 

   Lead Development of automated exchanges and data sharing procedures between CDAP and all other data sources within Globe, subsidiaries and even external.
 

   Maintain coordination with EDO’s Data Lake and Infrastructure roadmap.
 

   Data Collection
 

   Lead and be the data enablement SPOC for the Analytics team.
 

   Manage development of data collation/collection of Globe data, including enhancing customer data from Social Media and Sentiments and other Globe subsidiaries in compliance with Globe ISDP standards and Data Privacy Act.
 

   Manage both batch and real-time streaming data requirements in relation to the business and customer objectives and work with technology teams (EDO, Prodman, ISG) for implementation.
 


   Establish and maintain development of the algorithm and process to validate IKY (I Know You) data project of Commercial Business in collaboration with EDO Governance team and digital channels.
 

   Establish and maintain Single Customer View Data build effort requiring validation– progressing from Mobtel level view to Customer level view
 


 Data Storage
 

   Coordinate planning, and identification of the best Data Storage and Infra solution (ie cloud, bare metal, hybrid) taking into consideration cost, security and the access needs of the team
 

   Manage set-up and maintenance of the Commercial business data servers such as access matrix, folder structure.
 

   Lead forecast of the team’s storage and server space requirements.
 


   Data Mapping & ETL
 

   Lead Project Management of Data Mapping and ETL initiatives based on the Analytics team and Commercial Business requirements.
 

   Lead and coordinate Development and maintenance of Data Dictionary
 

   Establish process and manage versioning of Scripts and Data mapping / attribute / KPI definitions and sources
 

   Build Analytics marts – Ready Datamarts development leveraging the optimal technology (i.e. RDBMS)
 


   Data Security & Governance
 

   Develop and maintain Access Matrix to analytics platforms used
 

   Establish tokenization / anonymization initiatives for Analytics especially (Personally Identifiable Information – PII) and ensuring that PII has limited accessibility to necessary analysts
 

   Be the Business SPOC and Information security champion with regards to data security and governance
 

   Establish appropriate Work From Anywhere (WFA) solution for Analytics folks – such as secure VPN access, what data is safe to be accessed outside, etc.
 

   Maintain establishment of Data sharing and release process and principles within the analytics team, within Commercial Business, within Globe, outside Commercial business, Globe subsidiaries and partners and non-Globe entities.
 


 Business Development
 

   Manage business development and negotiations with 3rd party data providers & experts
 

   Lead business casing, commercial and contract requirements in relation to Data build and Data science tools / capabilities
 


   Make Your Passion Part of Your Profession. Attracting the best and brightest Talents is pivotal to our success. If you are ready to share our purpose of Creating a Globe of Good, explore opportunities with us.

title: Data Engineer:in
description:
Wenn es darum geht, zukünftig Millionen Fahrgäste und tausende Züge auch digital auf den Weg zu bringen, braucht es die besten IT-Expert:innen. 8.000 haben wir schon, aber längst nicht genug. Als Projektleiter:in, Berater:in, Entwickler:in oder IT-Architekt:in ist jetzt die spannendste Zeit einzusteigen und in einem starken Team wegweisende Lösungen und Großprojekte in den Bereichen Mobilität, Infrastruktur und Logistik umzusetzen.
  


   Im Team dataXpress helfen wir unseren konzerninternen Kund:innen, ihre unterschiedlichen Daten fachlich zu Informationen zusammenzuführen, zu historisieren und zu verstehen. Unsere Expertise liegt in der Integration komplexer Daten. Durch den hohen Automatisierungsgrad unseres Services reduzieren wir Kosten und verkürzen signifikant die Time-To-Market.
 


 Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir dich als Data Engineer:in (w/m/d) für die DB Systel. Du kannst dir aussuchen, ob du größtenteils remote oder von unserem Bürostandort Frankfurt am Main arbeiten möchtest. Für Teammeetings oder bei entsprechenden Projekterfordernissen kommen wir alle zwei Wochen in Frankfurt am Main zusammen.
 


 Deine Aufgaben:




 Du entwickelst im Team unsere architektonische und technologische Plattform im Bereich Data Vault weiter
 Als Data Engineer:in entwickelst du schwierige und komplexe Prozesse der Datenaufbereitung, -integration, -modellierung und -visualisierung gemäß der Anforderungen unserer konzerninternen Kund:innen
 Gemeinsam mit deinem Team entwickelst du Lösungen für komplexe technische Anforderungen
 Du bringst deine Erfahrungen ein und wirkst aktiv bei der Umsetzung innovativer Ideen und Gestaltung unserer DevOps Prozesse mit




 Dein Profil:




 Du hast ein (Fach-)Hochschulstudium in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung abgeschlossen oder verfügst über eine Ausbildung im IT-Bereich mit langjähriger Erfahrung in der Praxis
 Deine Berufserfahrung in der Datenmodellierung zeichnet dich aus: In der Entwicklung mit Python, Apache Airflow und Oracle liegt deine Expertise
 Idealerweise hast du bereits mit Git gearbeitet
 Du begeisterst dich für agiles, selbstorganisiertes Arbeiten und sprichst fließend Deutsch



 Benefits:



 Wir fördern flexible, individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle und unterstützen, wo es betrieblich möglich ist, durch moderne Arbeitsformen wie Homeoffice oder mobiles Arbeiten.
 Du schaffst Großes und bekommst nicht weniger zurück: ein marktübliches Gehaltspaket mit i.d.R. unbefristeten Arbeitsverträgen und Beschäftigungssicherung sowie vielfältige Nebenleistungen und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge.
 Faszinierende Projekte und Aufgaben – von der Digitalisierung eines Großkonzerns bis zum Projekt Zukunft Bahn – fordern Dein Können und warten auf Deine Handschrift.


 Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte und gleichgestellte Bewerber:innen bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Job Description
Doktar is an Agritech company with the purpose of improving food systems through intensive use of data and data-driven decisions. To fulfill its purpose, Doktar delivers a palette of digital services to the entire agricultural value chain. Doktar is positioned as a one-stop-shop for digital agriculture solutions, which requires us to develop and deliver a set of services based on emerging technologies, such as remote sensing, the internet of things, machine learning and artificial intelligence.


We are looking for a Python Developer who will be responsible for the end-to end development of data infrastructure features, from design to production.


Roles and Responsibilities

Build high-performing API’s using Python to enable data discovery, ordering, delivery, and post-processing at scale.
Develop and design a mechanism for ordering multiple raster and vector data sources.
Manage testing and bug fixes and prepare technical documentation.
Implementation of security, data protection, and integration of data storage solutions.
Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools.
Work collaboratively with the design team, UX/UI designers to understand end-user requirements to provide technical solutions and for the implementation of new software features.


 
Key Skills & Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, GIS Systems, or other related scientific or technical discipline (or equivalent).
3+ years of strong experience in software development using Python.
Expert in developing backend applications with RESTful APIs (Django/FastApi).
Have experience with modern virtualization technologies (Docker
Being able to configure, run, tune and troubleshoot services on AWS.
Excellent knowledge of written and spoken English.
Strong problem identification and resolution skills.
Capability to work with different teams simultaneously.
Ability to adapt quickly in a fast-paced, start-up environment.


 
Nice to have

Experience in deploying machine learning pipelines/data pipelines using Airflow/Kubeflow /Mlflow
Working knowledge of Postgresql.

title: Junior Data Engineer (m/f/d)
description:
Trelleborg is a world leader in engineered polymer solutions for almost every industry on the planet. And we are where we are because our talents brought us here. By specializing in the polymer engineering that makes innovation and application possible, Trelleborg works closely with leading industry brands to accelerate their performance, drive their business forward—and along the way, shape the industry and progress that will benefit humankind in the exciting years ahead. Our people are Shaping Industry from the Inside. Why don´t you join us?
 

 The Data Engineer will assist with development, testing, and maintenance of data pipelines using big data technology. This encompasses the development, management, and operation of a data architecture, including data intake, data quality assessment/evaluation, data curation and enrichment processes.
 Scope of your role

Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture and support building an infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using big data technologies.
Support our software developers, database architects, data scientists and machine learning engineers on data initiatives and ensure optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects.
Align, promote, and constantly update the data architecture, data engineering tools and technology stack with relevant stakeholders.
Coordinate with different functional teams in IS&BPM, TSS, and Trelleborg Group to implement models and monitor outcomes.

What defines you

Degree in computer science, business engineering, mathematics, physics, or similar qualification
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on engineering and manufacturing
Experience using the programming language Python and related frameworks to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques
Comfort working in a dynamic, research-oriented group with several ongoing concurrent projects
Knowledge in building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures, and data sets
Solid experience in preparing data for predictive and prescriptive modeling
Good software development skills and basic knowledge of good software development patterns, including software testing

We offer you

Several weeks of induction training for your new tasks: You will get to know our company, your contacts, and our structures (Trelleborg Academy)
A challenging, multifaceted, and interdisciplinary field of activity
Work in multicultural environment
A flexible work environment in our new innovation center
Diverse and healthy culinary offerings in our company restaurant, as well as game, relaxation and fitness zones
Good transport connections for public transport users (3 min. S-Bahn/U-Bahn) & own parking garage (>100 free e-charging stations), sponsored as part of a mobility concept
Flexible working time models with mobile work, as well as work-life balance

Start shaping industry from the inside!
 Trelleborg is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we take pride in the diversity of our employees, valuing the special experience and expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business. The ability to develop ground-breaking technologies is one of our key assets and our people make it happen.
 Feel free to contact our HR Recruitment Team for any questions:
 Stefani Sabotinova/HR Phone: +497117864749
 Heike Gall/HR Phone: +49 711-7864-393

title: Big Data Engineer - Remote Work
description:
Who We are
 BairesDev is proud to be the fastest-growing company in America. With people in five continents and world-class clients, we are only as strong as the multicultural teams at the heart of our business. To consistently deliver the highest quality solutions to our clients, we only hire the Top 1% of the best talents and nurture their professional growth on exciting projects. 
We are looking for Big Data Engineers for Home-based modality to join our Development team and participate in different projects made up of multicultural teams distributed throughout the world. We are looking for proactive people, team players passionate about programming in this language and oriented to provide the best experience to the end user. This is an excellent opportunity for those professionals looking to develop in one of the fastest growing companies in the industry!
 These developers will face numerous technical challenges, so they must use current technologies, get involved in the mobile world, web applications, devices, etc.
What You’ll Do:

Work together with developers, tech leads and solution architects to build applications.
Improve existing structures by adding new functionalities or proposing technological updates so that as a result, the impact of your contribution is significant in the core of each business.
The result of your work will also allow you to improve the user experience on scalable and high availability platforms, contributing to the key differential of each business.

Here’s what we are looking for:

6+ years of experience working as a developer.
5+ years of experience in Big Data.
Proficient with analysis, troubleshooting, and problem solving.
Hands-on experience with managing data loads and data quality a plus.
Advanced English level.

How we do make your work (and your life) easier:

100% remote work.
Hardware setup for you to work from home.
 - Flexible hours - make your schedule.
 

Paid parental leave, vacation & holidays.
Diverse and multicultural work environment.
An innovative environment with the structure and resources of a leading multinational.
Excellent compensation — well above the market average.
Here you can grow at the speed of your learning curve.

Our people work remotely but with a consistent and robust culture that promotes diversity and teamwork. To continue being the leading software development company in Latin America, we want to ensure that every BairesDev member gets the best growth and professional development opportunities in a diverse, welcoming, and innovative environment.  Every BairesDev team member brings something unique to our company. We want to hear your story. Apply now!

title: Data Integration Engineer
description:
Introduction
 At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.
  

Your Role and Responsibilities
 Build, deploy and manage data infrastructure that can adequately handle the needs of a rapidly growing data driven organization. Streamline data access and security to enable data scientists and analysts to easily access to data whenever they need to. Partner with internal stakeholders to understand business requirements, work with cross-functional data to build efficient and scalable ETL workflows and processes to ingest data from a large number and variety of data sources. Build data expertise and own data quality for allocated areas of ownership. Design, build, optimize, launch and support new and existing data models and ETL processes in production.
  
 Your primary responsibilities include:
  


Coordinate with multiple technical teams to ensure apt integration of functions to identify and define necessary system enhancements to deploy new products and process improvements.
Provide expertise in area and advanced knowledge of applications programming and ensure application design adheres to the overall architecture blueprint
Utilize advanced knowledge of system flow and develop standards for coding, testing, 
debugging, and implementation
  

Resolve variety of high impact problems/projects through in-depth evaluation of complex 
business processes, system processes, and industry standards.
  

Required Technical and Professional Expertise


Apply strong expertise in developing, maintaining, and testing infrastructures, transforming data into a format that can be easily analyzed, and architecting solutions for data scientists that enable them to do their jobs. 
Deep knowledge of SQL, “Big data” data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience working with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark is required.
Experience working with large data sets, data pipeline and workflow management tools, Azure cloud services, and stream-processing system. 
Background in programming in Python, Scala, C, C++, Java is beneficial.


 Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise


Minimum 4+ years of experience in ETL Datastage development
Demonstrate knowledge of a cross section of tools and techniques relating to support of large-scale data analysis
Proven understanding and proficiency of database administration and data structures
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills





 About Business Unit
 IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.
 



 Your Life @ IBM
 In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.
   Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.
 Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.
 Are you ready to be an IBMer?
 This job requires you to provide your COVID-19 vaccination status with supporting documentation, where legally permissible.



 About IBM
 IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.
  
 Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. 
  
 At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.
 



 Location Statement
 For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.
 



 Being You @ IBM
 IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Data Engineer Sénior
description:
About the role 


   Data Engineer en charge du traitement et de l’analyse des données issues des différents processus d’Orange, liés au fonctionnement des réseaux mobiles de nouvelle génération, vous aurez comme principales missions de :
   

Réaliser les développements de systèmes de collecte et de traitement de données issues des réseaux opérés par Orange en particuliers dans le domaine des réseaux d’accès radio
Accompagner les entités opérationnelles sur l’implémentation opérationnelle de cas d’usage DATA&IA sur des plateformes Big Data et Cloud, en particulier sur la mise à disposition des données
Veiller à la bonne performance des pipelines de données en fonction des besoins métiers d’Orange
Vous intègrerez une équipe de 5 data scientist, 2 data analyst et 4 chercheurs en ingénierie de connaissances et deep learning, dans un environnement technique riche et varié.
La création de ce nouveau poste permettra de démarrer de nouveaux projets et renforcer des projets existants notamment sur la maintenance prédictive des réseaux d’Orange.



    Vous travaillerez :
   

à contribuer à l’amélioration de l’efficacité opérationnelle des réseaux mobiles de nouvelle génération (4G/5G)
en support aux Data Scientist et chercheurs de l’équipe et du Groupe afin de leur fournir les outils et données leur permettant de réaliser leurs prototypes d'IA





About you 


   Si vous avez des :
   

expériences opérationnelles dans le data engineering ou le développement d’outils IA dans un environnement de production
compétences en programmation avancée (Java, Python, Scala) avec des pratiques industrielles et maintenables
 aisances dans les environnements de développement
  

d’analyses de données et les technologies du Big Data : Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Elasticsearch …
connaissances sur les algorithmes et techniques d'intelligence artificielle (machine learning, deep learning, tensorflow, keras…)
 Si vous êtes :
  

autonome dans votre travail et force de proposition
pédagogue et ayant envie d’apprendre
 Rejoignez-nous.
   Bonus du poste :
  

Télétravail possible 1 jour par semaine
Accompagnement sur la montée en compétences : tutorat, formations à la demande




Department 

Vous êtes à la recherche d’une nouvelle opportunité de carrière ? C’est le moment opportun de postuler et rejoindre Sofrecom ! Saisissez l’opportunité de transformer cette période difficile en une opportunité de vous réinventer !
 Chez Sofrecom, nous continuons à recevoir vos candidatures et à vous proposer nos meilleures opportunités de carrière. Avec les conditions sanitaires actuelles, nous avons opté pour le télétravail pour préserver la santé et la sécurité de nos collaborateurs. Vos échanges avec nos équipes de recrutement se feront à distance.
 Filiale du Groupe Orange et spécialiste du secteur des télécommunications, Sofrecom est un acteur unique dans le monde du conseil et de l’ingénierie. Sofrecom analyse et anticipe les tendances du secteur, conseille, accompagne et pilote le développement et les transformations de nos clients. Sofrecom est surtout une entreprise riche de sa diversité avec plus de 2000 consultants et experts issus de plus de 30 nationalités et répartis à travers ses 11 implantations dans le monde.
 Chez Sofrecom, nous sommes convaincus que la diversité est un facteur de richesse et de performance. Nous veillons donc à ce que notre processus de recrutement garantisse l’égalité des chances et à ce que l’ensemble des candidats bénéficient d’une égalité de traitement.
 Sofrecom déploie dans l’ensemble des implantations la même culture d’entreprise fondée sur l’audace, l’agilité et la même envie de bien servir ses clients.
 Toute donnée à caractère personnel que vous partagez avec Sofrecom Services Maroc est traitée conformément aux dispositions de la loi n° 09-08, relative à la protection des données à caractère personnel.
 Afin d’exercer vos droits d’accès, de rectification ou d’oppositions, merci de contacter la DRH sur le 05 37 27 99 00.



Contract 

   Regular

title: Software Engineer, University Graduate, 2023
description:
Due to business needs, we are prioritizing candidates that are available to start this position before the end of January 2024. 

  This role is eligible for visa sponsorship.
 


 Google welcomes people with disabilities.
 
 Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience in computer science, data structures, algorithms and software design.
Experience in Software Development and coding in a general purpose programming language (e.g., Java, JavaScript, Python, C/C++, etc.).


 Preferred qualifications:

Experience programming in C, C++, Java, and/or Python.
Experience with Unix/Linux or Windows environments, distributed systems, machine learning, information retrieval, and TCP/IP. 


About the job
 Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.  As a key member of a small and versatile team, you design, test, deploy and maintain software solutions.
 Google is an engineering company at heart. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on users around the world. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, social to local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.


 Responsibilities

Build our platforms, systems, and networking infrastructure using experience with distributed systems, OS/kernel, network system design, and large-scale storage systems.
Build internal systems used by Googlers globally.
Mitigate reliability failures in a component or system.
Create and support a productive and innovative team, including working with peers, managers, and teams.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Hey there!
 Do you want to contribute to a cleaner planet?
 Skyfri is delivering actionable insights by analyzing real-time data streams from solar power plants, globally. 3GW worth of solar customers trust us with our data science team. To meet the high demand in the market, and to adapt to new technologies, new latitudes and new regulations, we are expanding our core data science team. By joining Skyfri you are increasing the economic viability of renewable power, closing the gap to the emission goals.
 Our data-department consists of experienced data engineers, scientists, and analysts. Some are experts from the solar asset management field, and others have in-depth experts in building production grade data platforms.
 Our platform is built on top of modern technologies and we need you to continue to stay ahead of the curve. We are backed by some of the greatest investors within renewable energy, and we have experienced founders in the team, all of whom have successfully scaled businesses internationally before.
 You are…
 … Smart and ambitious, with a passion for start-ups and clean tech. You are creative, always willing to break new ground and come up with new and exciting ideas. You are open-minded, kind, and a team player who understands that we are all in this together. You have a keen interest in mastering technologies such as Databricks, Digital Twins, IoT Hub, Time series database, Structured Streaming and Azure Functions - and if you can impress us with your grit and insights during the interviews.
 In addition, we need you to:

Be fluent in English, our working language.
Have a Bachelor’s degree or relevant experience.*
Live in (or be willing to relocate to) Oslo, Norway.
3+ years' experience as data engineer or ETL/ELT developer.
Experience with Python (preferably Pyspark), SQL, and data and machine learning pipelines.
You can create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture, Assemble large and complex data sets that meet business requirements.

 

Non-EU/EEA citizens must have completed a bachelor’s degree to be eligible for a work permit in Norway. 

What we offer

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Flexible working hours with work-from-home days.
Interesting work within a dynamic and innovative company.
A central role in a company in high growth, with great opportunities for career and personal development.
A lot of fun in an international and diverse office environment.

 
At Skyfri, we embrace diversity as the cornerstone of who we are. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic. We choose our candidates based only on qualifications, merit and business need.  
We look forward to hearing from you!







    Department
   

    Development 
   

    Locations
   

    Oslo

title: Data Engineer (Python)
Junior Field Service Engineer - Graduate opportunity
description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity
 When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.
 Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.
 Are you ready to help us make the future?

   For our site in 
  Varkaus or Kuopio we are currently looking for 
  Junior Field Service Engineer who is passionate about becoming our new Field Service Engineer for our Honeywell Process Solutions (HPS) organization - in the specific in our Lifecycle Solutions and Services (LSS) team, who 
  can join us in January-February 2023.

 HPS is a pioneer in automation control, serving industrial process manufacturers worldwide. We help industrial customers globally operate safe, reliable, efficient, sustainable, and more profitable facilities. We offer leading technologies from the plant floor to the boardroom as well as comprehensive lifecycle services that help to ensure more productive and stable operations.
  

Among Your Responsibilities


The starting point would be general PHD or Optivisio products-related configuration and setup with Senior Engineers. Focus is to grow and train to become Field Service Specialist having the responsibility of entire new installations of PHD products which is gathering data overall DCS system.
Your expertise in SQL, Interfaces (OPC, OPC UA and logics), and Databases are giving strong background to grow. We also see the Operating systems experience (Windows, Linux and Virtualization) as an enabler.
Supporting the Service and Project Teams and growing Finland installed base.
Coordination with and communication together with Senior Engineers and customers.
Strict alignment to Honeywell and client health and safety program requirements.
We will extensively train you on your path on growing the expertise skills required.


 Your profile


We’d love to see your degree or ongoing studies in Computer Science, Information or Engineering Technology or Automation Engineering.
You truly enjoy spending time in front of your laptop and you have great computer - you may have some experience with SQL, Interfaces OPC, OPC UA and logics, Databases, Operating systems (Windows, Linu,x) and Virtualization. Tell us more about your university courses or your tech hobbies!
You may have some experience in maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair of computer-based process control systems, or you can be a fresh graduate ready to take the first step in your career.
You are able to accurately document designs and work performed - for instance, you have done this in some university/technical school projects.
You feel excited to speak directly with your customers and you understand that your job can make a difference.
You are fluent in Finnish and English - no matter what, your written/verbal communication and social skills always influence your partners positively.
You have a positive attitude and are interested in learning and developing your skills!


 We Are Happy To Offer You


An extensive training and orientation that gives you the opportunity to learn and develop while working with the excellent technologies.
A support of highly experienced technical teams globally.
Competitive compensation and benefits package and career opportunities of a global company.

 If you feel it’s the right time for you to move on with your career and you love the idea to participate to the growth of this team, then let us know now and apply now!
  EMEAUR
  Additional Information

 Category: Customer Experience

 Exempt

title: Data Engineer - Talend
description:
Introduction
 In this role, you'll work in one of our IBM Consulting Client Innovation Centers (Delivery Centers), where we deliver deep technical and industry expertise to a wide range of public and private sector clients around the world. Our delivery centers offer our clients locally based skills and technical expertise to drive innovation and adoption of new technology.
  
 A career in IBM Consulting is rooted by long-term relationships and close collaboration with clients across the globe.
  
 You'll work with visionaries across multiple industries to improve the hybrid cloud and AI journey for the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Your ability to accelerate impact and make meaningful change for your clients is enabled by our strategic partner ecosystem and our robust technology platforms across the IBM portfolio; including Software and Red Hat.
  
 Curiosity and a constant quest for knowledge serve as the foundation to success in IBM Consulting. In your role, you'll be encouraged to challenge the norm, investigate ideas outside of your role, and come up with creative solutions resulting in ground breaking impact for a wide network of clients. Our culture of evolution and empathy centers on long-term career growth and development opportunities in an environment that embraces your unique skills and experience.
  

Your Role and Responsibilities
 As a Data Engineer, you will develop, maintain, evaluate, and test big data solutions. You will be involved in data engineering activities like creating pipelines/workflows for Source to Target and implementing solutions that tackle the clients needs.
 Your primary responsibilities include:

 Collaborate with the team, design, build solutions using the Talend product set and develop reports rationalize existing code 
Write and administer ETL jobs (extract and load data), integrate data from different data sources
 Deliver Talend solution implementation and support
 Translate business and technical requirements into data interfaces, data transformation jobs and design data models
 Ensure development guide and best practice for developing Talend solutions are followed


 Required Technical and Professional Expertise


 Talend ETL - fully proficient with development and administration of Talend Open Studio and Talend Server - Experience developing with the Talend product suite
 Strong SQL knowledge 
Deep knowledge and hands on experience with dimensional Data modeling
 Data warehousing concepts, reporting concepts
 Working with cloud platforms (docker, Kubernetes)


 Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise


 Proficient in English (written/spoken)
 French - nice to have





 About Business Unit
 IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.
 



 Your Life @ IBM
 In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.
   Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.
 Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.
 Are you ready to be an IBMer?
 This job requires you to provide your COVID-19 vaccination status with supporting documentation, where legally permissible.



 About IBM
 IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.
  
 Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. 
  
 At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.
 



 Location Statement
 IBM wants you to bring your whole self to work and for you this might mean the ability to work flexibly. If you are interested in a flexible working pattern, please talk to our recruitment team to find out if this is possible in the current working environment.
 



 Being You @ IBM
 IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Data Engineer/Analyst
description:
State-of-the-art technologies, world-class off-highway OEMs, great and helpful colleagues, easy-going and supportive atmosphere, personal and professional growth, development friendly organization, Ponsse Group colleagues Among other things this is what you will get when working at Epec!
 Epec is a heavily developing and growing technology company in the area of control systems, electromobility and autonomous vehicles. Now we are looking for a Data Engineer / Analyst to work full-time or hybrid hours in one of our offices in Seinäjoki, Tampere or Turku, or we can discuss other locations as well - flexible remote work is possible at Epec.
 What kind of tasks?
 You will be responsible for development and maintenance of the data gathering environment that is suitable for mobile machine surroundings. This position also includes AI/ML dataflow design, implementation, and maintenance so those will be understandable and usable for the mobile machine environment. Epec customers include world leading machine manufacturers, and you will have the opportunity to work with them as part of the project team.
 Why apply to Epec?
 At Epec you will have an opportunity to work with the worlds leading off-highway OEMs and to bring the latest technologies to the market. We offer you a modern, flexible and innovative environment to work in. Epec is a sustainable workplace with highly skilled colleagues and Ponsse Group collaboration and a possibility to be a part of a growth company with several possibilities to develop and challenge yourself. At Epec we trust in people - you have the possibility to manage your own work and we offer you modern facilities and tools to work with. If you would like to work in an agile and fast-reacting organization, Epec might be a suitable working place for you!
 What we expect from you?
 You can be a SW professional, automation technology expert, autonomy/robotic specialist or you have worked with Cloud based AI environments, Statistical tools usage and application with big data, or AI (Artificial Intelligence) and ML (Machine Learning) usage with moving machines.
 We expect that you have an appropriate education for this job and fluent English both in speaking and writing manner. To be successful in this position the absolute must are co-operation and interaction skills together with a can-do attitude.
 How to proceed?
 If you have any further questions you can contact our Program Manager, Petri Aaltonen +358 40 502 1715 / petri.aaltonen@epec.fi.
 Applications including salary request before 31.1.2023. The first interviews are planned to take place during weeks 4-6.
 Epec Oy is a system supplier specializing in advanced electric / electronics for efficient, safe and connected NRMM non-road mobile machines and commercial vehicles. Being close to our customers is how we continuously co-create and innovate sustainable future technology solutions that make a difference. Epec works in cooperation with leading international machine manufacturers and belongs to the Ponsse Group.
 WWW-osoite: http://www.epec.fi Yhteystiedot: Elina Harju, elina.harju@epec.fi Työpaikan osoite: Tiedekatu 6, 60320, Seinäjoki, 60320 SEINÄJOKI Palkkaus: Katso kuvaus Työ alkaa: Katso kuvaus Työaika: kokoaikatyö Työn kesto: yli 12 kuukautta Haku päättyy: 31.01.2023 Ilmoitus jätetty: 09.01.2023 TE-palvelujen ilmoitusnumero: 11779443 
 Lähde: TE-palvelujen asiakastietojärjestelmä
 .

title: Data Engineer
description:
Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 154 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive. 
Job Purpose and Impact 

 The Data Engineer will help design, build and operate high performance, full-stack, data centric solutions utilizing the comprehensive capabilities of Cargill’s Data, Cloud, API and Streaming platforms. In this role, you will contribute to delivering a flexible and interoperable data product in support of Analytics and Integration use cases. You will contribute to design of data structures and pipelines to collect data and design and implement data transformations, combinations or aggregations. You will help build data streams and APIs to make data more consumable. Key Accountabilities 

 Collaborate with businesses and other stakeholders to participate in product or solution designs. Develop robust, scalable and sustainable data products or solutions utilizing cloud based technologies. Provide moderately complex technical support through all phases of product or solution life cycle. Perform data analysis, handle data modeling and configure and develop data pipelines to move and optimize data assets. Build moderately complex prototypes to test new concepts and provide ideas on reusable frameworks, components and data products or solutions and help promote adoption of new technologies. Independently solve moderately complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned Qualifications 

 Minimum Qualifications 
Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience. Proficiency in at least one backend programming language such as Java, Python, C#, Golang. Experience building CI/CD pipelines. Proven experience using SQL (stored procedures) or NoSQL, performance tuning. Understanding of Cloud Computing. Experience with Unix shell scripting. Experience in API development and/or ETL processes. Experience developing software using agile methodologies such as Scrum and/or Kanban. Strategic thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills. Strong interpersonal skills, ability to build trust and relationships and influencing others. Result orientation and ability to work in ambiguous situations where requirements are not clear. 

 Preferred Qualifications 
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing and/or analytical tools. Experience using any Hadoop Distribution, preferably Cloudera, to build solutions that deliver value through leveraging data as an asset. Experience building Kafka or Apache Pulsar streaming solutions. Experience with NoSQL backends. Experience with API frameworks, gateways and management. Experience working with various types of data sources such as SAP, JDE and other ERP systems.

title: Software Engineer II
description:
Our Purpose
 


   We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a 
  
   culture of inclusion
   for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
 


   Job Title
 
 Software Engineer II
  Overview
 
 We are looking for a Software Development Engineer to drive our customer experience strategy forward by consistently innovating and problem-solving. The ideal candidate is passionate about the customer experience journey, highly motivated, intellectually curious, analytical, and possesses an entrepreneurial mindset.
 
 This is a rare opportunity to put your signature on how Mastercard process real-time transactions. We need you to help take our system to next level working closely with real-time transaction processing and software engineering team on new products. We do not expect you to be a bank card payment expert but guarantee within the first 6 months you will be. You will be working with the best engineers to help them build the products we all want.
 
 Our current technology stacks are diverse and evolving combinations of global and local, closed, and open-source technologies. We are not looking for a solution for now; we are looking for the best solution for tomorrow. We are an ambitious team that takes smart risks and challenges everything.
 
 Role & Responsibilities:
 

Work as part of a development Scrum team in an Agile environment
Responsible for the requirement analysis, design, development, and delivery of software solutions
Develop, customize, and test applications to integrate to Mastercard’s specifications
Help mentor and guide other team members during all phases of the SDLC.
Troubleshooting, and participate in urgent incident handling

 All About You:
 

Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, or equivalent industry experience
2 more years Software Engineer experiences in backend system
Deep understanding of data structures and algorithms
Solid experience with Java programming, experience with Go/Python is a good plus
Solid experience with real-time transaction processing system
Solid experience with cloud native system and microservices architecture
Experience with ISO 8583/20022 message processing is a good plus
Deep understanding of virtualization and Linux containers
Solid experience with RDBMS, such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, and SQLite
Solid experience with NoSQL databases, such as Redis, RocksDB, etc.
Solid experience with TCP, HTTP and gRPC communication protocols
Solid experience with KVM virtualization, and docker, experience with Kubernetes is a good plus
Experience with common Linux system, such as RHEL, CentOS, Oracle Linux and Ubuntu
Experience with payment industry is a good plus
Good communication skills in written and spoken English



   Corporate Security Responsibility
   All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
 

 Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
 Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
 Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
 Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: Data Engineer - Patras
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all

 We are excited to announce the launch of our new EY offices in Patras and are inviting young graduates and experienced professionals from Patras and the wider Western Greece region to join our dynamic consulting team. We are a leader in consulting services and are seeking individuals with the right mix of skill, enthusiasm and curiosity that want an opportunity to enhance their knowledge and develop professionally within a truly global organization.
 
The opportunity

 Modern technology produces more data than ever before, but also provides the tools to store, organize, analyze and share this data, resulting in new opportunities and substantiated business insights in support of new and deeper insights and more informed decision making. EY delivers leading services and solutions in the area of big data, business intelligence and data engineering built on a blend of tools and custom-developed methods.

 As part of our Data and Analytics team of the Technology Consulting practice, you will work with multi-disciplinary teams to support clients in a wide range of data initiatives aiming to generate and present new, useful and actionable insights. You will have the opportunity to work and take responsibilities in challenging engagements, gaining exposure to clients in various sectors both in Greece and abroad.

 Your key responsibilities


 Participation in large-scale client engagements.
 Contribution towards, or even leading delivery of innovative and engaging data engineering solutions.
 Understanding of business and technical requirements, provision of subject matter expertise and implementation of data engineering techniques.
 Conducting of data discovery activities, performing root cause analysis, and making recommendations for the remediation of data quality issues.
 Putting good organizational and time management skills into practice, with the ability to prioritize and complete multiple complex projects under tight deadlines.


 To qualify for the role, you must have


 A BSc or MSc degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or other related, quantitative fields.
 Advanced SQL skills
 Knowledge and experience in PowerBI


 Ideally, you’ll also have:


 Relevant professional experience.


 What we look for


 Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills.
 Desire to investigate and try-out new tools and technologies as they are released.
 Ability to work under tight timelines, in cases for multiple project deliveries.
 Good interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively within high-performing teams.
 Confidence to convey technical advice and guidance to clients.
 Advanced technical writing skills in Greek and English (additional languages a plus).
 Evidence of self-motivation for continuous development.


 What we offer

 We offer a competitive compensation package where you will be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our rewards package includes a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being. Plus, we offer:


 Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
 Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
 Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
 Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.


 If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
 The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

 #betterworkingworld

title: Data Engineer - Remote, Full-Time
description:
Bluelight Consulting is a leading software consultancy seeking a skilled Data Engineer to join our fast-growing team. Our mission is to design and develop technology that improves the lives of its users while providing an exceptionally high level of service to our clients.
  


 We are looking for Data Engineer who wants to be part of a fast-paced, dynamic environment, where everyone’s opinions and efforts are valued. We hire outstanding individuals and give them the opportunity to thrive in a collaborative atmosphere that values learning, growth, and hard work.
  


 Our team is distributed across the United State and Central / South America. If you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, and rapidly-growing software development consultancy, and if you are passionate about software development and creating the finest apps in the marketplace, please apply below.
  



What We Are Looking For


 Experience with AWS services including but not limited to S3, Athena, EC2, EMR, and Glue.
 Ability to solve any ongoing issues with operating the cluster.
 Experience with the integration of data from multiple data sources.
 Experience with various database technologies such as SQLServer, Redshift, Postgres, and RDS.
 Experience with one or more of the following data integration platforms: Pentaho Kettle, SnapLogic, Talend OpenStudio, Jitterbit, Informatica PowerCenter, or similar.
 Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service.
 Experience with or knowledge of Agile Software Development methodologies.
 Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
 Excellent oral and written communication skills with a keen sense of customer service.
 Experience with collecting/managing/reporting on large data stores.
 Awareness of Data governance and data quality principles.
 Well versed in Business Analytics including basic metric building and troubleshooting.
 Understand Integration architecture: application integration and data flow diagrams, source-to-target mappings, data dictionary reports.
 Familiar with Web Services: XML, REST, SOAP.
 Experience with Git or similar version control software.
 Experience with integrations with and/or use of BI tools such as GoodData (Prefered), Tableau, PowerBI, or similar.
 Broad experience with multiple RDBMS: MS SQLServer, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redshift.
 Familiarity with SaaS/cloud data systems (e.g. Salesforce).
 Data warehouse design: star-schemas, change data capture, denormalization.
 SQL/DDL queries/Tuning techniques such as indexing, sorting, and distribution.
 BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.
 3+ years of Data Pipeline development such as SnapLogic or Datastage, Informatica, or related experience.
 3+ years of SQL experience (No-SQL experience is a plus).
 Experience designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines.






What You'll Be Doing


 Develop and maintain data models for core package application and reporting databases to describe objects and fields for support documentation and to facilitate custom application development and data integration.
 Monitoring execution and performance of daily pipelines, triage and escalate any issues.
 Collaborates with analytics and business teams to improve data models and data pipelines that feed business intelligence tools, increasing data accessibility and fostering data-driven decision-making across the organization.
 Implements processes and systems to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes.
 Writes unit/integration tests, contributes to engineering wiki, and documents work.
 Performs data analysis required to troubleshoot data-related issues and assist in the resolution of data issues.
 Work within AWS/Linux cloud systems environment in support of data integration solution
 Works closely with a team of frontend and backend engineers, product managers, and analysts.
 Teamwork: Collaborate with team members. Share knowledge, provide visibility of interpersonal accomplishments and follow directions when provided.






Company Benefits


 Competitive salary and bonuses, including performance-based salary increases
 Generous paid-time-off policy
 Technology / Office stipend
 100% remote work, now and post COVID
 Continuing education, training, conferences
 Company-sponsored coursework, exams, and certifications






   Being a software consultant is a fun, challenging, and rewarding career choice for engineers. Your contributions are highly valued by clients, and the work you do often has a direct and significant impact on the client’s business.
  


 You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects for our incredible clients, which will help you quickly improve as a consultant and software engineer. You will get to work with modern languages and frameworks alongside some of the best developers in the world!
  


 So if you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, rapidly-growing software consultancy, please apply. #LI-Remote
