title: Data Engineer/BI SQL Developer (DataOrbis)
description:
DataOrbis is a global cloud-based information solutions company. We provide market and business intelligence solutions to the fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) industry. Our solutions combine people, process, and leading-edge cloud technology to facilitate and inform business decisions, that are customised to our client’s needs. We have a wealth of knowledge and expertise in information technology and market information services in the consumer goods and retail industries, and we are passionate about breaking down data silos and transforming companies into businesses driven by sourcing, integrating and actioning data. Our Values are the absolute foundation of our business, and we believe in attracting, recruiting, retaining, and developing the brightest talent, to allow the right skills at the right place at the right time and for us to constantly focus on engaging our team in a winning environment. We are currently looking for a professionally skilled Data Engineer to be part of our team!
The ideal candidate needs to be an honest and self-motivated team player who is willing to be a key member of the team and be responsible for the development, implementation, and maintenance of databases, ETL packages and reports according to DataOrbis best practices and specifications.
You are a keen problem solver and use both your intuition and logic to come up with workable solutions for implementation. You have excellent attention to detail and are deadline driven always ensuring that the required timelines are met.
You are a proactive multi-tasker with strong organisational and administrative skills and can efficiently manage and handle numerous tasks across multiple projects in a structured manner while remaining calm and collected. You have strong attention to detail and have business process knowledge in development best practice, and you possess a wide variety of skills and knowledge to manage complex and varied tasks.You enjoy working within a team-based environment are confident in your communication to effectively manage both up and down and communicate continuously. You will be part of a cross-functional team and will work closely with both the DevOps and technical teams in ensuring the development and delivery of technical solutions according to the client’s needs ensuring the contractual delivery of our service offering to our clients on an ongoing basis.Responsibilities include

Data Warehouse development and maintenance
Performing ETL using MS SQL Server Integration Services.
Design, development, and maintenance of reports using MS SQL Server Reporting Services.
Manage and maintain databases through the design and development of T-SQL queries and solutions.
Database performance tuning and query optimisation.
Working closely with the development team in the creation and development of inhouse applications.

Your skills and experience includeA suitable tertiary IT degree, diploma or relevant certification in the IT related field.

Two plus years database development experience using MS SQL Server
Knowledge and experience with MS SQL Server applications and BI Tools including;
Analysis Services
Reporting Services
Integration Services
T-SQL
Data Mining
Performance tuning
Query optimisation


Sound problem solving skills with the ability to develop logical solutions to fit situations and resolve database and data related issues.
Excellent time management skills with the ability to prioritise and execute tasks to meet deadlines as specified.
Troubleshooting skills with the ability to investigate and resolve issues on either an individual basis or in conjunction with the team.
Good interpersonal skills with the ability to professionally interact with both internal and external clients as well as communicate progress, developments and difficulties encountered.
Flexible and agile with the ability to work on multiple concurrent clients and projects.

Key personal attributes include

The ability to work under pressure.
Highly analytical.Strong attention to detail.
Ability to learn and adapt to change in a high paced rapidly changing environment.
Service and delivery orientated.
A strong team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
High levels of initiative, proactivity and delivery orientated.
Ability to work on multiple concurrent projects, deliveries and competing demands.
Passionate and self-motivated with a sound values and belief system.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Innovation starts with being curious.
At Volvo Cars, we believe that being curious and truly committed to understanding people is the key to future success. We are people who care about other people, working together to create new technologies and innovations for safe, sustainable and convenient mobility. Want to join us?

 Do you want to use your data skills to transform Volvo Cars? At Volvo Cars, we are making bold digital visions come true. We aim to be the leader in the automotive world by creating a digital ecosystem built around making our customers' lives less complicated. What we all have in common at Volvo Cars is our passion for protecting lives, our endless curiosity, and our dedication to create a new future for the automotive industry. Our human centric focus is what separates us from all other car companies. 
Digitalisation will be as important for the automative industry as the combustion engine and the gearbox used to be. Data plays a strategic role in Volvo Cars digital visions and future product offerings. We are looking for passionate data engineers that wants to influence and craft the data ecosystem that helps Volvo Cars to grow and reach our goal of being an electric car company by 2030. Our team is new and we sit in Volvo Cars new Tech Hub in MOOD in central Stockholm. We operate in a start up alike environment, but with the resources and support that only a big company can offer. Our team is a part of the Global Online Experience (GOX) area and our mission is to ensure we know our customers well and keep this information safe and secure.

 We have only just begun this journey in earnest, and you’ll be joining us at a time where you can really make a great impact. We are having fun, have a highly innovative atmosphere, and are excited about our emerging ecosystem of data products. You will help us to form our data platform from the beginning and play a key role in defining our tech stack. We think you would love to join us if you are passionate about modern data architecture principles, data technologies, and data storage solutions and want to apply your interest to improve the experience for all of Volvo Cars customers. Come join us and set the tone for the next chapter in our company's and the entire automotive industry’s history!  What to look forward to as a part of our team We are in an early stage and there are plenty of opportunities in the team to drive experiments and build innovative tools that will help us to build a cloud based world-class data architecture based on Data Mesh principles. Your work will be creative and you will help us to leverage our large and diverse datasets to enable use cases with direct impact on the end-customer's digital experience. The heart of the role is to design, code, test, and document programs using agreed standards and tools to achieve well-engineered results. You will work closely with data producers and product teams to share your knowledge and identify improvement areas and to build domain expertise that will help us to deliver on our exciting product objectives. 
You and your skills We are keen on building a team with a diverse set of skills and the most important is that you are a team player, passionate about data engineering and wants to join us on our journey. It’s great if you have strong programming fundamentals and are experienced with architecting large-scale distributed computing systems in the cloud. It’s also valuable if you have experience designing and building distributed data pipelines and have worked with data modelling, data access, and data storage techniques. The role includes working with many different stakeholders and speaking with many different teams and we hope you enjoy that and are interested in delivering value to the business together with your team members. 
Sounds interesting? Welcome with your application! We are continuously screening applications and will fill the position as soon as we find a good match. We encourage you to apply as early as possible and to reach out to hiring manager Jacqueline Eriksson jacqueline.eriksson@volvocars.com for questions about the position and Senior Talent Acquisition Partner Lovisa Ermell lovisa.ermell@volvocars.com if you have any questions regarding the process. Please note that applications via email will not be accepted due to GDPR.


Who are we?
Everything we do starts with people. Our purpose is to provide freedom to move, in a personal, sustainable and safe way. We are committed to simplifying our customers’ lives by offering better technology solutions that improve their impact on the world and bringing the most advanced mobility innovations to protect them, their loved ones and the people around them.

 Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. The people of Volvo Cars are committed to making a difference in our world. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. We believe in bringing out the best in each other and harnessing the true power of people. At Volvo Cars your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential. Join us on a journey of a lifetime as we create safety, autonomous driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

title: Utilities Data Project Engineer
description:
Northvolt has an exciting job offer for an Utilities Data Project Engineer to join our passionate team. 
In joining us you will play an important part in our journey to building one of the first large scale European battery factories. Together with Northvolt you will play an important role in the transformation to a carbon free society.
 In this role you will have overall responsibility for the project management, validation, and quality of the Northvolt Tool Utility Matrix (TUM) or utilities engineering data for our Ett Site in Skelleftå or Kvarnsveden Site in Borlänge.
 Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Ensuring that the Tool Utility Matrix (TUM) is issued on time and that all changes in the TUM are tracked and recorded to assist with the project change management process. 
Issuing the updated versions of the TUM and communicating same to all project stakeholders. 
Collecting the utility requirements (power, cooling, heating, gases, chemicals, water, etc) of the process and mechanical systems. 
Working with suppliers and engineering companies from all around the world to determine the actual utility requirements and heat dissipations for the equipment supplied. 
Validating the requirements for utilities against basic laws of physics, industrial engineering practice and by liaising with the relevant discipline leads. 
Validation of data quality; including, but not limited to, integrity toward Northvolt's general data model (Functional breakdown structure and Location breakdown structure)
Developing and maintaining data-driven methods and automated tools to automate the processes for managing the data.
Improving the TUM format to facilitate automation and quality control.

The person we are looking for is flexible, curios and eager to learn. You will get the chance to have a real impact on our success story in Sweden and see the results of your work. Our organization values great self-discipline and a natural talent to make things happen. Qualities that we cherish are sense of quality, friendliness, grit and a sense of humor. 
Northvolt is an equal opportunity employer. We're a diverse group of individuals, united by a common mission, who recognise that while our actions as individuals have a role to play in driving Northvolt towards its goals, we always seek to move forward as a team. We offer you an open and welcoming atmosphere where we win as a team – and fail as a team. Northvolt is growing at the speed of light and we are a strong believer in internal career development. 
Apply with CV in English or your complete LinkedIn profile. 
Full time employment, fixed salary.  Planned starting date is asap.








Skills & Requirements
Qualifications/education/experience :

Bachelors or masters in mechanical, process or electrical engineering or computer science.
Experience in the design/engineering of industrial, manufacturing, or chemical process facilities.
Have experience in multi-disciplinary engineering coordination, interfacing with construction and internal/external stakeholders.

Specific skills:

Fluency in English.
Valuable (but not required) if fluency in other languages, including Swedish.
Good understanding of mechanical and electrical utilities.
Good knowledge of AutoCAD, standard office tools (particularly Excel).
Basic knowledge about data bases and data interchange.
Advantageous to have knowledge of Revit and Autodesk Construction Cloud APIs.

Personal success factors:

Great communication skills as have constant interaction with team members and external parties such as equipment suppliers and engineering companies.
High work ethic, multi-tasker, strong analytical ability and attention to details, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.
Flexible, friendly, motivated to take on new challenges, has grit and a sense of humor.
Passionate & purpose driven - we work for a more sustainable future.
Structured and detail oriented with ability to see the large picture.
Highly organized and result driven.
Has a can do-attitude and an entrepreneurial spirit.









Great Place to Work




World leading technique





Top specialists as team peers





International environment





Fast paced & entrepreneurial culture





Warrant program





Wellness grant

title: Data Engineer
description:
Overview: 
 
   The Data Engineer develops, implements and documents data systems that provide the technical solutions to meet specifications and business requirements defined by company objectives to promote effective, efficient, and compliant operations.
  Responsibilities: 
 
Work as part of a project team to define and document data and data pipelines for a variety of solutions.
 Technical responsibility for data and data pipelines to ensure compliance with data standards, architectural standards, and achievement of documented requirements.
 Develop and maintain current state documentation and deliverables for data solutions.
 Maintain existing and new data solutions to ensure that they continue to meet user needs.
 Provide assistance to operational teams to ensure continuity of service.
 Work with the Data Engineering community of practice to identify and implement continuous improvement opportunities.
 Must have excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
 Performs other duties as assigned.
 Ensure that Cook’s Code of Conduct is considered in all business matters carried out on Cook’s behalf.
 Qualifications: 
 
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or other related degree; or experience of such kind and amount as to provide a comparable background.
 Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases; experience with SQL Server, Oracle, and/or MongoDB preferred.
 Experience building data transformations, data structures, and data pipelines.
 Experience with data integration tools.
 Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages.
 Demonstrated organizational, analytical and interpersonal skills.
 Ability to manage tasks independently and take ownership of responsibilities.
 High self-motivation.
 Willingness and availability to travel on company business.

 About Cook Medical
 Since 1963, Cook Medical has been finding solutions to improve the world's healthcare problems for the patients and doctors we serve. As one of the world's largest private companies, we have always operated with our patients, customers, employees and communities at our core. We do this, not only because it is good business, but also because we believe that being a good corporate citizen is the right thing to do.
 Cook Medical has been in Limerick since 1993. Since opening, we have become a European headquarters for many of Cook's business functions.
 With a global workforce of 12,000, we employ over 850 people in Ireland who bring Endoscopy, Urology and Peripheral Intervention products from conception to commercialisation.
 Our employee benefits include:

 Life Assurance and Income Protection cover
 Educational Assistance
 Company sponsored Defined Contribution pension scheme
 Medical Health Insurance cover for you and your immediate family
 Extensive health & wellness program includingIndian head massages, healthy lifestyle seminars, mindfulness courses, physio sessions, flu vaccinations, nutrition talks
 Fully equipped gym on site
 39-hour week with flexible start & finish times
 Paid time off to participate in volunteer activities
 Free parking
 Subsidised restaurant
 Sports & Social club

title: Data Engineer
description:
Hos Intrum vil du udvikle dig ved at gøre en forskel – på såvel højt plan som i et internationalt miljø. Og dét i en bekræftende kultur, hvor din indsats tæller.
 


   Olisitko sinä seuraava intrumlainen?
 


   Liiketoimintamme perusajatus on toisten auttaminen. Autamme loppuasiakkaitamme löytämään ratkaisuja talousvaikeuksiinsa. Autamme asiakkaitamme tehostamaan yrityksiensä rahankiertoa, jotta ne voivat kasvaa, kehittyä ja luoda uusia työpaikkoja. Tämä puolestaan hyödyttää koko yhteiskuntaa ja juuri tästä toiminnassamme onkin lopulta kyse. Toimimme terveen talouden suunnannäyttäjänä, ja se tekee työstämme merkityksellistä. Roolista tai tittelistä riippumatta.
 


   Data Engineer
 

 Vahvistamme tiimiämme ja haemme nyt Data, BI & AI Management -tiimiimme uutta työkaveria. Työssäsi rakennat ja suunnittelet analytiikkaratkaisuja sisäisten sekä ulkoisten sidosryhmien kanssa osana ketterää tiimiä.
 


   Voit olla joko aloittelemassa uraasi tai jo kokemusta ja osaamista kartuttanut henkilö.
 


   Odotamme sinulta
 



     kokemusta jostain BI-työkalusta (esim. Qlik Sense, PowerBI, Tableau)
   


     vähintään SQL perusteita
   


     kykyä omaksua nopeasti uusia asioita ja hahmottaa laajempia kokonaisuuksia
   


     positiivista ja ratkaisukeskeistä asennetta
   


     sujuvaa kommunikointia suomeksi ja englanniksi
   



   Lisäksi tehtävässä auttaa tai voit oppia
 



     ymmärrys ETL/ELT prosessista ja työkaluista (esim. dbt, talend)
   


     analytiikkaosaaminen (tilastolliset menetelmät, Python/R)
   


     kehittämisen perustyökalut ja -menetelmät kuten Git & CI/CD
   



   Eduksesi on myös työkokemus vastaavanlaisista tehtävistä sekä hyvät tiimityöskentelytaidot.
 


   Intrum tarjoaa sinulle kansainvälisen markkinajohtajan työympäristön ja mahdollisuuden tehdä merkityksellistä työtä sekä kehittää ammattitaitoasi monipuolisessa tehtävässä mielenkiintoisella toimialalla. Meillä on kannustava työkulttuuri, jossa työpanostasi arvostetaan ja lupaamme, että pääset työskentelemään motivoituneessa porukassa huippukollegoiden kanssa. Työpisteesi voi sijaita joko Tampereen tai Helsingin toimistollamme. Työskentelemme hybridimallilla, jossa voit joustavasti yhdistellä etätyötä ja toimistopäiviä. Työ alkaa sopimuksen mukaan mahdollisimman pian ja tehtävä on vakituinen.
 


   Lisätietoja tehtävästä antaa Juho Kolmonen, Data, BI & AI Manager, p. 045 118 8911. Tavoitat hänet parhaiten torstaina 26.1. klo 10–12, tiistaina 31.1. klo 10–11.30 ja perjantaina 3.2. klo 10–11.30 mutta voit kokeilla onneasi myös muina aikoina!
 


   Hakuaika tehtävään päättyy 5.2.2023.
 


   Ser du dig selv som den rette person til stillingen? Alletiders! Ansøg nu.
   Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

title: DATA ENGINEER
description:
As an Engineer, you have an advanced technical data-oriented profile. We are interested in professionals with solution delivery experience to address complex data management challenges. You can implement relevant Master Data Management, Data Virtualization, Business Glossaries, Data Catalog, Big Data solutions and/or Data Quality solutions.
 You will be:

designing and implementing:

data solutions taking into account the functional and technical requirements
data modeling and data architecture
data integration and conversion

developing data quality and governance capabilities

Your qualifications are:

5+ years experience in Master Data Management, Data Governance, Data Quality and/or Data Integration
5+ years of experience with data management platforms such as Collibra, Informatica, Alation, TIBCO, SAS, IBM...
an analytical and creative mind
proven ability to deliver in time
preferably trilingual: English (requirement), Dutch and/or French
good communication and presentation skills, both written and oral
strong interpersonal skills, such as being able to work in a team as well as autonomously
flexibility and ableness to work under pressure
willingness to travel across Belgium and potentially abroad

Your academic requirements are:

Bachelor or Master’s degree

Datalumen is an equal opportunities employer.
 Primary Location: Belgium Job Level: Senior - Expert Contract Type: Payroll, contractors and freelance

title: Data Engineer
Data Engineer
description:
Overview / Responsibilities: 
 
   Wood is currently recruting for a graduate Data Engineer to support our GES+ project support team in Khobar, Saudi Arabia. 
 

  This team works to assist clients in using their data to create value, drive business decisions and improve engineering efficiency.
 


 The successful candidate will work as part of a multi-disciplinary team to develop and implement solutions which increase the safety, reliability and productivity of our clients’ assets through the application of advanced analytics and artificial intelligence. As a valued team member they will build strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders through working collaboratively in global, agile, multi-disciplined teams. They will have strong statistical skills to support the team in the development of current and new applications that have the capability to deliver real-world results.
 


 The successful candidate will work across a variety of tasks, including:
 

 Support the design, development and deployment of data mining algorithms to solve data management challenges, including data scraping and cleansing
 Support the design, development and deployment of web-based and desktop-based applications
 Support our system engineers in assembling large, complex datasets
 Participate in integrity, maintenance and reliability and digital twin systems configuration and implementation projects
 Participate in requirement gathering sessions and developing data modelling specifications
 Participate in the design, development and deployment of Machine Learning and Deep Learning models to solve maintenance and reliability challenges
 Individual responsibilities will be commensurate with capabilities and experience level


   In order to be successful, candidates must demonstrate that they:
 

 Possess a questioning mind, brimming with bright ideas that they are able to articulate and share
 Be a critical thinker with strong analytical, critical reasoning and problem solving skills
 Be comfortable with manipulating and combining large, high dimensional datasets from multiple sources
 Have an ability to interpret findings and identify key insights to communicate to a non-technical audience
 Have demonstrated experience building relationships with internal and/or external stakeholders
 Be passionate about delivering high quality work
 Are interested in programming, software testing and database management activities in office based environment
 Able to work under close supervision, provide design assistance to the teams
 Can resolve specialty related data science issues by applying accepted sense, principles, codes, and innovative ideas
 Are interested in learning and understanding of oil & gas business required for the job
 Have thorough knowledge of computer programming, cloud platforms, APIs, database setup and management
 Able and willing to work collaboratively within team based environment with good communication
 Can handle and propose easy graphic user interface and graphic design skills for presentations and software / database front ends
 Skills / Qualifications: 
 
Degree in a data-oriented field like Software Engineering, Statistics, Economics or Computer Science and / or a tertiary qualification in Mechanical, Mechatronics or Process engineering
 No prior experience is required
 Knowledge of statistics, data engineering, data science, statistical concepts such as regression, time series, mixed model, Bayesian, clustering to analyse data and provide insights
 Deep working knowledge of MS Office, Visual Basic, Oracle and SQL is mandatory
 Scripting ability in Python, PHP or similar is preferable
 Programming ability in a compiled language (C/C++, C# etc.) is preferable
 Familiarity with Graphic and User Interface design is preferable
 Working knowledge of AI & ML is preferable
 Understanding of agile development methodologies
 Self-motivated, enthusiastic and committed to delivering first class technology engineering services
 Excellent English language skills and effective communication capability both written and verbal
 Effective interpersonal skills and an ability to relate to those in a wide range of organisation positions
 Demonstrated ability to understand complex problems and help identify practical and technically sound solutions
 Company Overview: 
 
   Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering, helping to unlock solutions to critical challenges in energy and materials markets. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in 60 countries, employing around 35,000 people. www.woodplc.com
  Diversity Statement: 
 
   We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Data Engineer
description:
We’re looking for talented Data Engineers. The ideal candidate should be autonomous and be willing to learn about interesting technologies such as Databricks, Snowflake Data Cloud, Apache Airflow, and Apache Kafka. In this role, you should be willing to engage in teamwork and have excellent communication skills both in English and Spanish. 

 You will be working with modern data technologies, big data sets, and high-performing teams to ensure we are adding value to our clients. This is an excellent opportunity to grow your career by working closely with talented and experienced mentors in a motivating environment that encourages continuous growth and constant feedback. We’re growing fast, so this could be the perfect opportunity for someone looking to magnify their impact! 


Data Engineer Should Haves:
 Solid knowledge and experience with SQL. 
Experience in any of the following languages such as Python, Scala and Java. 
Background in cloud platforms like Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services (AWS), or Google Cloud Platform (GCP). 
Know-how in data ingestion, ETL development, and data processing such as Apache Spark. 
Good understanding of Data Lake and Data Warehouse. 


We Believe In Your Growth! These Are The Benefits For You:

Set your salary: Learn, improve your career and decide how much you want to make! 

Manage your time: Do you need time for yourself? Are you having a bad day? Errands to run? No worries, just let your team know. 

Grow with us: We want you to feel happy and have a clear purpose. If you to want to excel your own expectations, we´re here to support you in different aspects; academic, professional and as a human being. 

 Are you ready to participate and #GrowWithPerficient?

title: Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d)
description:
YOUR ROLE

 What can you expect as a Machine Learning Engineer at RAYLYTIC? Together with our industrial and university partners, we apply AI to find the best treatment for a patient's individual cancer treatment.
 

 Your challenge will be to identify and segment cells in microscopy images taken at different Z-heights, reconstruct the slice data in 3D objects and analyze morphologic changes of the cell clusters over time to assess the effect of various treatment options. Within two years, the developed AI model and related UI software shall be integrated as a microscopy-image analysis module in our UNITY platform. This project shall serve as the basis for a comprehensive microscopy image analytics module, that follows our philosophy of integrating all data relevant for diagnosing and providing the best possible treatment for patients.
 Collaborate with international and multidisciplinary team of engineers, data scientists and medical professionals.
 Contribute to scientific journals and congress abstracts.
 We are looking for passionate people who share our values and want to contribute to improving patients' lives. Are you interested to start a meaningful job? If so, keep reading to learn more! 
 

Your tasks:


 Responsible for complete pipeline of a project i.e. from research to production stage.
 Evaluation of new state of the art frameworks and employing them to new projects.
 Interfacing with other teams to develop microservices and provide APIs.
 Organization of tasks in an agile environment utilizing scrum.
 Supervising intern/master student.


 YOUR PROFILE


 Hold a master or higher degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Biomedical engineering, bioinformatics or similar field. 
Prior experience with the AI-based analysis of microscopic data, preferable with biological cells.
 At least 1-2 years of experience :

With deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or Pytorch.
Using Docker and writing integration/Unit test tests.
With version control tools eg. Github, Bitbucket. 

Excellent communication and documentation skills. 
Experience in medical image analysis e.g. X-ray, CT, MRI, microscopy.
 Professional working proficiency in German and English.  Nice to have:
 Published papers or conference presentations on deep learning topics.


 WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM RAYLYTIC


 The impact: We want to change the healthcare sector fundamentally, but we cannot do it alone. Join us and help us to create a positive impact on the life of many patients.
 Let's grow: As we are a fast-growing company with short decision-making processes, we want you and your ideas to shape the future of Raylytic.
 Wherever, whenever: We trust you. That's why you can choose your working place and time flexibly, adapted to your professional and personal needs.
 Your Team: Diversity and teamwork are nice buzzwords you say? We disagree. We are an international team that values and supports each other. Ask your future colleagues about it, they can tell.
 Better together: We support each other inside and outside the office. Whether it's an upcoming project or a round of table tennis in the park.
 Your health: Is not only important to you, but also to us. Therefore, we take over a gym membership of your choice. 

 Sounds like a job for you?
 We are looking forward to your application and the chance to get to know you!
 
 About us


   893 / 5000
 
 At RAYLYTIC we are redefining digital health applications by building bridges between the actors in the health care system and overcoming established ideas about supposed system boundaries. With our SaaS applications for research, clinical studies and diagnosis, we automate administrative processes and improve the quality and evidence of patient treatment.
 For our "scaling-up" we are looking for committed employees who create and follow the path from RAYLYTIC to the market leader in an appreciative and agile working environment. We are united by the goal of improving the everyday lives of healthcare workers with the latest technology and the health of people. We want to make the greatest possible sovereignty and evidence-based knowledge available to patients regarding their health and treatment options.

title: Project Engineer – Network and data communication
description:
At Hitachi Energy our purpose is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation
Do you want to energize your career by working in challenging customer projects with advanced power and electrical control systems? Hitachi Energy, Grid and Power Quality Solutions (GPQS) unit (former FACTS – Flexible AC Transmission Systems) in Västerås, currently has several vacancies for Station Operation and Monitoring Engineers within our Global Center of Competence / Control Engineering department. If you have the necessary drive and results focus, Hitachi Energy, GPQS offers a stimulating and dynamic environment in a global context where you will be working at the forefront of the energy industry. We offer you a role where you can grow in various ways: technically and in terms of visibility and leadership. We are looking for a driven, teamwork-oriented achiever for this position. We would welcome applications from experienced professionals, as well as younger applicants who are keen to take their carriers to the next level. To excel in this position, you need to be organized, responsive and solution-driven, with a strong focus on delivering results and serving the customer.
Your responsibilities

As Station Operation and Monitoring Engineer with focus area on Network and data communication, you will work with high quality deliveries and cost-efficient engineering solutions for our customers.
In close collaboration with our Control Application engineers and other colleagues you will take responsibility for design of network topology, configuration of network devices and verification of network communication related to our MACHTM control system controlling the PQS Application.
You will hold a frequent contact with other engineering groups, project managers, local Hitachi Energy offices and our customers to achieve the best results.

Your background

You have an engineering related degree, ideally with a specialization in data communication and network technology. Similar training can also be considered.
You have preferably some years of experience from similar engineering positions working with process- or substation automation and network communication.
Relevant experience in some of the following areas will be considered meritorious:
Windows and Active Directory administration
Network administration and network security
Hands on experience using Linux
Configuration and troubleshooting of firewalls, network switches, File Transfer, data diodes and other network devices
Knowledge of commonly used Layer2 & 3 switching protocols
Experience in troubleshooting TCP/IP network
Commonly used Protocols like LDAP, SMB, SFTP, HTTP, SSL etc.
Network Time Protocol
Syslog/SNMP
Backup and restore devices and software configuration
Experience of Hitachi Energy Control system, MACHTM is considered a strong plus.
This position involves a great deal of customer contacts and close cooperation with colleagues worldwide; therefore, English is required, both verbally and written; Swedish is considered as an additional plus.

More about us
Are you ready for an exciting new challenge? Does the above description sound like you? We are interested in learning more about you and what you can contribute with, so do not hesitate to apply even if you do not meet all requirements. Welcome to apply before February 7th, 2023! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today! Recruiting manager Anitha Shanmugasundaram, anitha.s@hitachienergy.com, will be happy to answer your questions regarding this position. More information: Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer; Stefan Andersson, +46 107- 38 08 21; Ledarna: Christer Fridlund, +46 107-38 29 12; Unionen: Karin Ulvemark, +46 107-38 51 42 or Ingrid Rinaldo, +46 107- 38 58 19. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Helena Stefansdottir, helena.stefansdottir@hitachienergy.com Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader that is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We serve customers in the utility, industry and infrastructure sectors with innovative solutions and services across the value chain. Together with customers and partners, we pioneer technologies and enable the digital transformation required to accelerate the energy transition towards a carbon-neutral future. We are advancing the world’s energy system to become more sustainable, flexible and secure whilst balancing social, environmental and economic value. Hitachi Energy has a proven track record and unparalleled installed base in more than 140 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ around 40,000 people in 90 countries and generate business volumes of approximately $10 billion USD. www.hitachienergy.com #LI-NEU1


Publication date


2023-01-17


Reference Number



  SE53920980_E4

title: Production Engineer
description:
Date Posted: 2022-10-18-07:00
  Country: Finland
  Location: Marioff Kerava, Finland
  About Carrier and Marioff
 At Carrier we make modern life possible by delivering innovative and sustainable ground-breaking systems and services that matter for people and our planet. We exceed the expectations of our customers by anticipating industry trends, working tirelessly to master and revolutionize them. At Marioff, we make the world a better place to live. Marioff Corporation Oy was founded in 1985 and is a leading developer of water mist fire protection technology supplying system solutions worldwide under the brand HI-FOG®. Owned by Carrier, we have several subsidiaries around the world and employ approximately 400 people handling the complete value chain, from idea, development and manufacturing to the marketing, sales, and servicing of our products. We are an international company with worldwide offices and our HQ is Vantaa, Finland. We’re looking for a  Production Engineer
 As Production Engineer you are responsible for developing the processes at Pump Unit Production. You will work daily with shop-floor management, operators, planning, quality, engineering, EHS, logistics, and other stakeholders. All your short-term and long-term tasks are related to improving productivity, quality, on-time delivery, health & safety in the production area.

 Your responsibilities as Production Engineer include:

 Developing processes, tools, and methods for assembly, testing, and tube-bending.
 Leading kaizen events to improve processes and layout. Implementing the needed changes.
 Updating, documenting, and training work-instructions in the area.
 Introducing new products and product-variants to production in co-operation with engineering.
 Processing Engineering change notices and identifying their impact to production.
 Diagnosing problems and turnbacks in the production lines and providing instructions & trainings to operators.
 Turnback reviews and root-cause analysis in co-operation with quality. Creating problem reports for engineering if necessary.
 Identifying, planning, and implementing machine and tool investments that improve productivity, quality, and safety.
 Establishing safety procedures and instructions.
 Updating production-related data in ERP and other systems.

 Our expectations:

 A degree in engineering (Master’s or Bachelor’s) or similar work experience
 Work experience in Electrical/Mechanical/Production/Operations Engineering
 Good written and verbal communication skills in both Finnish and in English.
 Experience with CAD / 3D design software, MS Office tools, ERP systems, PDM systems
 Work-experience from industrial environments, experience in Lean and process development
 Problem-solving skills, attention to detail, ability to make decisions under pressure, teamwork skills
 Any experience with PLCs is highly advantageous


 We can offer:

 A growing company in Marioff, with strong and global corporate support from Carrier
 Competitive Salary
 World-leading water-mist suppression technology
 Fun, supportive, and experienced colleagues
 An exceptionally safe and clean work environment
 A workplace within a good commuting distance in the Helsinki and Uusimaa area
 World-class training opportunities for Lean and Quality with the Carrier Excellence training program
 Marioff Employee Milestones
 Lunch benefits, sports and culture benefits, hobby clubs, occupational healthcare

 Our commitment to you
 Our greatest assets are the expertise, creativity and passion of our employees. We strive to provide a great place to work that attracts, develops and retains the best talent, promotes employee engagement, fosters teamwork and ultimately drives innovation for the benefit of our customers. We strive to create an environment where you feel that you belong, with diversity and inclusion as the engine to growth and innovation. We develop and deploy best-in-class programs and practices, providing enriching career opportunities, listening to employee feedback and always challenging ourselves to do better. This is The Carrier Way.
 Join us and make a difference.
 Apply Now!

title: Production Quality Engineer
description:
Job Title Production Quality Engineer
 
 Job Description
 Philips is a global leader in health technology, committed to improving billions of lives worldwide and striving to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. Driven by the vision of a better tomorrow.





 But it’s not just what we do, it’s who we are. We are 80,000, wonderfully unique individuals, with two things in common. An unwavering sense of purpose and a relentless determination to deliver on our customers’ needs. It’s what inspires us to create meaningful solutions – the kind that make a real difference – when it matters most.

 The world and our customers’ needs are changing faster than ever before and while we are proud of what we do already, we know we can do more. That’s why we need you, to help us tackle increasingly complex challenges posed by ever evolving health and well-being needs.

 In this role, you have the opportunity to make life better




 As a Production Quality Engineer you will drive product quality improvement activities, using statistics and data analysis techniques to improve processes. Working with production, manufacturing engineering and suppliers in the areas of process control, quality control and assurance, data collection, failure analysis, corrective actions, reporting for early detection and correction and continuous improvement. Responsible for “real time” investigation of failures, finding root causes, issuing summarizing report and following-up corrective actions implementation.

 You are responsible for

 Manage and follow-up on quality activities
 Participate and lead “real time” manufacturing line investigations to identify cause and containment actions. Work with Production, Supply and Manufacturing Engineer personnel
 Interpret manufacturing outputs and customer inputs, define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
 Select and apply quality procedures and methods, appropriate inspection strategy and statistical techniques
 Establish and monitor quality/process control for high risk parts and high risk suppliers
 Create and administer an effective closed-loop corrective action program
 An active member on the production release of new products, responsible for quality plan preparation
 Plan and participate in internal manufacturing audits and assessments as a co-auditor
 Participate in the Material Review Board process to dispose of rejected material


 You are a part of
 CT/AMI Q&R.
 At Philips we apply the highest quality and regulatory standards. Complying with laws and regulations at all times and follow the Philips Business System which is designed to help us deliver on our mission and vision. We are looking for people with attention to details, respect for precise processes, and passion for the highest standards. In return, we offer a variety of opportunities to grow your career horizontal as well as vertical within Quality & Regulatory as part of local and global teams.

 To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

 B.A. / B.Sc degree
 At least 2 years of work experience in quality in a manufacturing plant
 Good understanding of statistical methods, quality tools and methodologies (i.e. 8D, DMAIC, SPC, FMEA, Control Plan


 In return, we offer you
 Endless opportunities to learn and develop your career in the directions to which you aspire. Philips Healthcare is a place where you will work with others whose far-reaching ideas and accomplishments have impacted over 200 million lives already.





 How we work at Philips Our newly-adopted hybrid work concept fuses flexibility with collaboration to deliver great outcomes for our people and our customers. We are embracing an approach wherein we spend more time together than apart – which for full-time employees translates to an average of at least 3 days working from the office and up to 2 days from home – for our hybrid roles. Hybrid work flexibility means people can meet the changing demands of work and home in the most balanced, productive, and healthy way.

 Our hybrid working model is defined in 3 ways: We believe in the importance of impactful collaboration: There's a certain energy when everyone’s in the same room that can heighten idea generation and creative friction needed for problem-solving. We embrace flexibility: Choosing where, when and how to work can vary according to task and team schedules. Flexibility isn’t office or online, it means choosing the space that works best for you, your teams and our customers on a case-by-case basis. We want to be at our best: The way we work and our workspaces are designed to support our well-being, offer career advancement opportunities, and enable us to be at our best.

 Why should you join Philips? Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on innovative, customer-first health technology solutions. Help us improve the health and well-being of billions of people, every year. Ultimately creating a career that no one could have planned for. Even you.

 #LI-EU

description:

title: Junior Data Engineer
description:
Job ID: 1341
Location: Stockholm, Sweden
Stockholm or Helsinki | Hybrid | Full-time
__As a data engineer at Bonava you will build data pipelines and write code to transfer, transform and prepare data for various data services at the company. You will enable the business to utilise the data for insights and help us as a company to become more data driven.
The roleIn this role you will design, build, and maintain data pipelines in Microsoft Synapse Analytics. You will write code in PySpark (a mix between Python and SQL that runs on Spark) to update, transform, and store data automatically in efficient ways in our data lake. You will also build algorithms to extract, create and transform data that will be used to deliver new insights to the business.
The way we workThe team you will be joining is a distributed team split between Stockholm and Helsinki. As the Data Science-team we cover everything from integrations to reporting and AI. We use a hybrid setup, mixing remote work with working from the office.We work in an agile way aiming for small frequent releases using guiding principles from the software development world. Our tech stack is mostly within Microsoft Azure, where we are using PySpark and Synapse Analytics heavily. For reporting we use Microsoft Power BI.
Who we are looking forFor this role you need to enjoy writing and optimizing code as well as digging into data flows and integrations. You learn new technical tools quickly when you have the proper support. Working independently is something you are used to, but you are also comfortable with asking for help and helping your colleagues when needed. You have a high attention to details, and you understand the importance of both correctness in the data and the code as well as prioritisation.
We believe you have a MSc in computer science, data science or information systems, or a similar type of education.
Required

Knowledge of relational databases, modelling of data and normalisation of data structures


Experience in coding in some SQL-dialect


Experience coding in Python


Knowledge of complexity, optimisation, and characteristics of less and more efficient algorithms


Proficient level in English

You can fulfil these requirements through your education or through work experience.
MeritingIt is also meriting if you have experience of any of the following:

Git in some form for version control


Azure, AWS or GCP


Azure Synapse Analytics or Azure Data Factory


Spark and especially PySpark


AI, machine learning or advanced analytics


CI/CD

Join our journeyWhen you apply, please submit your resume and cover letter in English together with grade transcripts from your higher education. We are reviewing applications continuously, so please send your application as soon as possible but no later than the 12th of February.If you have any specific questions, please contact Helena Sjöberg at helena.sjoberg@bonava.com, the recruiting manager.
This is BonavaBonava is a leading residential developer in Northern Europe that creates homes and neighbourhoods where people have the highest quality of life. The company is the first residential developer in Europe to receive approval from the Science Based Targets initiative for its climate targets. With its 2,100 co-workers, Bonava develops residential housing in Germany, Sweden, Finland, Norway, Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania. Bonava’s shares and green bond are listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.
We are changing the housing gameJoin our journey
Job Type: Full-time

title: Data Engineer
description:
About TriOptima
 TriOptima was founded in 2000 in Stockholm and is an award-winning provider of critical post trade infrastructure and risk management services for the OTC derivatives market. Our customers are banks and financial institutions across the world. We design services that reduce risk and cost for the finance sector, always with the highest security at heart and with focus on quality throughout our processes.
 TriOptima is a pioneering fintech business at the heart of financial markets, bringing together the people, processes, and network to optimise operations for thousands of firms across the globe.  TriOptima started a new chapter in 2021 as part of OSTTRA, a new venture that unites four businesses that have been at the heart of post-trade evolution and innovation for the last 20 years.

 The office space is modern, spacious, and designed for social interactions and our rooftop terrace makes for scenic lunches in the summertime, right in the middle of Stockholm. We will provide you with equipment for remote work and always encourage a healthy work-life balance. We believe our colleagues are fantastic and the most important part of us and our culture. We strive to make this a place where everyone feels like they have a place, can grow, and have fun while doing something valuable.

 About OSTTRA
 Launched in 2021, OSTTRA unites four businesses that have been at the heart of post-trade evolution and innovation for over 20 years: TriOptima, MarkitServ, Traiana, and Reset. With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimisation, to clearing and settlement. Learn more at 
   
    www.osttra.com
   


 Business Analytics team

 The team is responsible for the internal and external business analytics. The purpose of the team is to help the organization make informed data driven decisions, as well as identify business opportunities and process improvements. We collaborate closely with business owners and senior management to understand business needs and translate them to actionable insights.

 The team takes responsibility for the entire data pipeline. The team manages a data warehouse where we collect data from the TriOptima services as well as external sources which we then use to deliver data to our BI platform and other analytical tools. The data pipeline is written in Python, and we use Tableau as a BI platform.

 The team is highly self-driven. We are continuously adjusting our way of working as we find what works for us. We encourage collaboration and continued learning. We believe that diversity is what makes a good team great, and that diversity of experience and thought create inclusive and successful products. As a global company with colleagues around the world we work in English, even in the Stockholm office where the TriOptima technology department is located.

 Data Engineer role
 As a Data engineer at TriOptima, you are expected to:

 Maintaining and supporting our data warehouse
 Extending the data warehouse to support exports from new products and services
 Develop the business intelligence data platform which includes database design and managing the ELT process.
 Collaborate with other technology teams to build robust data integrations


 About you
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you have experience with some of the following:


 Degree in engineering or similar
 At least 2 years of experience from data engineering/bi developer within a business intelligence/analytics team
 Proficient in programming Python or similar language
 Experience of data warehouse design
 Experience of ETL/ELT processes and tools
 Comfortable writing complex SQL queries. Work effectively with big data volumes in both relational databases and with unstructured data
 You are fluent in English, both in writing and verbally
 Understanding and interest in the financial market and derivates is a bonus

 CME Group: Where Futures Are Made
  
 CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.
  




   The Candidate Privacy Policy can be found here.

title: Artificial Intelligence - Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Job Summary: 
As a part of the Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) Algorithms team, the AI/ML Engineer will perform research and development of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning systems for use in clinical settings. It is a cutting-edge research and development opportunity with key focus on analyzing data to discover the relationships among various measurements and medically relevant conditions and developing computational models for diseases diagnosis, detection and prediction of critical events. Responsibilities will include working with data such as speech, image/video, electronic medical records as well as continuous streams from invasive and non-invasive sensors. The AI/ML Engineer will also closely work with our software, hardware and systems teams to ensure an efficient deployment in Masimo products. 

Duties & Responsibilities: 

Designing, training and verifying machine learning models 
Prototype new ideas/technologies to create proof of concept and demos 
Contribute to the organization’s strong drive to be on the cutting edge of technology through the generation of patentable ideas 
Effectively communicate with engineering and marketing teams 
Delivering high quality software design, documentation and implementation 


Minimum & Preferred Qualifications and Experience: 
Minimum Qualifications: 

3+ years of professional experience in artificial intelligence, machine learning and/or deep learning 
Experience with modern frameworks such as: Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch, Caffe, etc. 
Experience in Python and C++ 
Hands-on experience of development to solve problems such as: regression, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction, structured output and anomaly detection. 

Preferred Qualifications: 

Experience with databases and their tools 
Experience in applying AI/ML to biomedical data 
Experience with robotics and/or computer vision 

 Education: 

M.S./Ph.D. degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering/Computer Science, (advanced degree preferred)

title: Data Engineer to Nordax Bank
description:
Are you a result-driven person with a passion for data and technical solutions? Come join our data Engineering team at Nordax Bank and be a part of an exciting transformation journey in how we work with data!
 About The Role
 We are currently looking for a Data Engineer/Analyst to join our engaged and tech-savvy Data Engineering team! You will be a part of IT and collaborate with stakeholders all over the organization. The team is currently in an expansion phase with new architecture under implementation and a cloud migration plan under design. This is a great career opportunity for a data engineer or analyst to grow in front-end, back-end, and design matters. You will also have possibility to influence new end to end data architecture and flows and designing data solutions (On prem, Cloud and Hybrid).
 Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Implementing traditional database & DWH concepts to provide self-service reporting solutions in Power BI
Creating power BI reports
Building and maintaining data pipelines
Identifying data quality gaps and improve data quality
Design and build ETL/ELT processes
Support in creating and improving functional and technical design of current and existing solutions.

Your Profile
 To thrive and succeed in the role you should be passionate about data, technical solutions, modern software development methodologies and learning new things related to data. You have an eye for details and are a driven person that has demonstrated “pulling up the sleeves” to reach your goals.
 We believe you have:

Relevant academic degree e.g., civil or industrial engineering, computer sciences, math, statistics etc.
Experience in working with Analytics & BI tools and services (we use the Microsoft stack MS SQL, SSIS, Power BI, Azure)
Experience with on premise DW and Cloud solutions
Practical experience with developing end to end data pipelines within a data warehouse/data lake 
Experience in designing data models 

As a person you are result-oriented, and you are an inclusive team player with a willingness to grow and develop. You have an ability to mentor other developers in all aspects of their engineering skillset. You are fluent in English and have excellent communication and presentation skills.
 Other qualifications that it is good to have:

Finance industry, or other regulated industry
Developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines
Working with data on cloud (e.g., Azure SQL, ADF, Data bricks, Snowflake and similar)
Other programming skills such as Python, Scala etc.
Create and maintain technical design and data architecture

Our offer

Freedom with responsibility
Career Development
Feedback Culture
Coaching Leadership
A strong caring company culture – we really care about each other!

If you want to know more
 Please feel free to contact hiring manager Nina Alias at nina.alias@nordax.se if you have any specific questions about the role. If you have any question about the application or recruitment process, please contact recruiter Sarah Wahlstedt Corméry at sarah.wahlstedt.cormery@nordax.se. Due to GDPR, we are unable to handle applications sent to us by e-mail.
 Next step
 We will review applications continuously and the position may be filled before the application deadline, so make sure not to wait until the last day! The applications should include your CV, written in English or Swedish.
 We believe in evidence-based tests in order to eliminate unconscious bias and increase hiring precision - the right person for the right position. For this reason, we use Alva Labs assessment methods for our recruitment processes to help us identify candidates with the greatest probability to succeed in this role.
 We also want to inform you that we do a background check for all positions at Nordax via SRI. Please read more about here : Frequently asked questions and answers about background checks.
 We look forward to your application!
 About Nordax
 Nordax is one of the leading specialist digital banks in Northern Europe that helps people make informed financial decisions for their well-being by acting as a strong alternative to traditional banks. We are proud of our sound and data-driven competence that allows us to lend responsibly and earn our customers’ trust based on transparent and clear pricing models. We are experts in mortgages, savings accounts, private loans and equity release products.
 Nordax Bank is committed to protecting your personal data and to respect your privacy. With reference to GDPR, please do not include sensitive personal information in your application such as ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs, or information about your health, such as sick leave.

title: Trainee, Data Analyst / Engineer
description:
Your Title: Trainee, Data Analyst / Engineer
   Job Location: Espoo (Leppävaara), Finland
   Our Department: 
  
   Structures
  



 Would you like to work in a truly international and diverse working environment with meaningful and interesting tasks in the modern software industry? This will be an excellent opportunity to gain valuable work experience and develop your skills with the help of great mentors. Our welcoming culture is a safe space where you can be yourself and achieve your potential.


 We are now looking for a Trainee, Data Analyst / Engineer to join our Customer Insights, Data and Analytics team at Trimble in Espoo. We hope you will be able to start in May and work until the end of August.
 

 What You Will Do
 


   You will join a team responsible for generating data driven customer insights and driving data driven culture, processes and tools within Trimble’s Structures Division. You will work alongside data analysts, data engineers and data scientists focusing on a variety of different types of data.
 


   We are proud of enabling our organization to improve our products, services and customers’ experience through the analytics and insights we provide. We hope you share our passion for data and are eager to learn and grow as part of the team.
 


   Depending on your background and skills your tasks will include supporting and/or coordinating various projects related to data analysis, data engineering, data management and governance.
 

 What Skills You Could Bring
 

 You are curious by nature. You are also a proactive team player that likes to get things done
 You are in your Master level studies with a focus on analytics, business intelligence, data science or computer sciences
 You have fluent written and spoken English and strong communication and collaboration skills
 We consider it as a plus if you are interested in/have previous experience in web analytics and have experience in programming languages like SQL, Python etc.


 Join our team! Apply via the application form as soon as possible, by February 5 at the latest.
 

 About Your Location
 

   You will be based in our brand new office in Espoo. It is only a 5 min walk from Leppävaara train station to our office. We have flexible working hours and a hybrid working model.
 


   About Our Structures Division
   We are proud of developing Tekla software solutions for structural engineering that are driving the BIM revolution. We are committed to improving digital construction information workflows to give our customers a competitive edge. Visit 
  
   https://www.tekla.com/references
   or watch our BIM awards 2022 video (
  
   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZpfQChQ_wuQ
   ) to get an idea of what we help to build all over the world. More information about us on 
  
   https://www.tekla.com/
  


 About Trimble
 

   Trimble is an industrial technology company transforming the way the world works by delivering solutions that enable our customers to thrive. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics connect the digital and physical worlds to improve productivity, quality, safety, transparency and sustainability. From purpose built products to enterprise lifecycle solutions, Trimble is transforming industries such as agriculture, construction, geospatial and transportation.
  

   www.trimble.com
  


 Videos:
 



     Trimble - Life´s work
    ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kbuoxq5S_M4 )


     Life at Trimble, Sakari
    (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Jy_NfsNDio&t=1s )


 Trimble’s Inclusiveness Commitment
   We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while also moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work.
 

   We have programs in place to make sure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly that they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from.
 



    Trimble’s Privacy Policy

title: Software Engineer Trainees
description:
Come join our Software team as Software Engineer Trainee. Be in the front line with other Cimcorpers on creating modern and new generation’s inventory management systems! We are looking for future Software Engineers to learn and grow during the summer of 2023 with us.
As a Software Engineer Trainee, your work consists of frontend-, backend-, or fullstack development depending on your personal interests. Databases, Java, Redux and React are your day-to-day tools. At work we apply agile methods and CI testing tools.


Kind notification – Depending on cookies you allowed from GDPR settings might affect your form fill procedure. Allow cookies in order to use and send the form successfully. Some users are experiencing challenges e.g. with Google Captcha protection or attaching CV files in the very end before sending the form. Please see our Privacy policy to see how we handle your personal data.


Road to professional success

1-3 years of studies in software engineering
 Programming as a hobby is an asset also!
 General interest in technology and various devices
 Open mind for traveling is also a positive asset
 A brisk attitude and enthusiasm to take on challenges makes you a potential Cimcorper

At Cimcorp depending of your position you will work with our software team, technology development or customer service in our brand-new facilities at Ulvila, Finland and you get experienced professionals as tutors.
The work is located in our headquarters at Ulvila. 
For further information about the position, please, contact Director, Software, Pasi Kankaanpää, pasi.kankaanpaa(a)cimcorp.com
How to apply
Apply as soon as possible but no later than Feb 28. We will start interviewing the possible future Cimcorpers while the position is still open, so fill in the application and we will be in touch.
About us
Cimcorp Group has been simplifying material flows since 1975. We improve our customers’ profitability by offering unique solutions for automation. Our reliable robotic systems run with easy-to-use software, optimized for intralogistics, and our lifetime services secure our customers’ success in business.
As a global system integrator, we make it possible for our customers – who work mainly in grocery retail and the tire industry – to succeed in their market, today and tomorrow.
With a worldwide network of offices and partners – and as a member of Murata Machinery Ltd., one of the world’s largest logistics automation suppliers – Cimcorp offers local support globally.

Application
Qualified candidates are welcome to send their resume by February 28, 2023 00:00 UTC

description:

title: Data Engineer
description:
Starship. Talk of the town. Or the world.


   Welcome to Starship – the revolutionists of tomorrow’s delivery service. Thanks to our smart little robots, we are already well on our way to a changed future and a whole new way of delivering food and packages. In that way, we offer people new and comfortable services that facilitate and improve their everyday lives – while continuously striving to create green, ethical circular communities. Ready to solve some real problems?Scroll down and read more about this unique opportunity!
 


 Your new adventure


   The Data Platform team helps data guide the way by providing a quality user experience for all data users across the org. As a Data Engineer you will be instrumental in identifying and solving scaling bottlenecks proactively. This includes creating observability and reliability, working with petabyte scale data and collaborating with teams across the whole data lifecycle within Starship.
 


 Your responsibilities:


Help design the data warehouse that scales to tens of thousands of robots delivering goods 24x7 and is a breeze to use.
Enhance observability and test coverage throughout our data lakehouse powered by Databricks on AWS.
Support data professionals with data modeling and analytics engineering best practices.
Help stakeholders within the Engineering organization to succeed in making the most of our data platform.



 What’s in it for you?


   At Starship, engineering is at the core of everything we do. The fact that Ahti Heinla, our co-founder, still participates in developing our software is one good example. The trust we give our engineers to bring new ideas to the table is another one. We simply believe that the best decisions are made with input from our collective expertise and intelligence, using data, reason and enlightened intuition. And we trust you to come up with new ideas for goals or initiatives and figure out pragmatic ways of implementing them. Flexible working time, company events, an employee stock option plan, and a competitive salary awaits.
 


 What we hope you’ll bring to the table:


Solid understanding of distributed database systems.
Considerable experience in a related role designing data models and building out robust optimized data pipelines.
Advanced SQL and basic scripting skills. Experience with Databricks/Spark and/or dbt is a plus.
An active interest in the world of data engineering.



 Shape tomorrow with today’s ideas


   High-performance algorithms and innovative technology are a start. But to develop really impressive robots, the human dimension is decisive. And that’s where you come in. At Starship, you will join a bunch of tech-savvy future pioneers who revolutionise tomorrow’s delivery service today. And a bunch of fantastic, likeable, and hard-working robots, of course. So, bring out your most human self and team up with us. 
 

Want to learn more about our technologies, data challenges and how we will change the world together? Get in touch and let’s have a chat!



 Interested to hear more about our data work? Take a look at this post Dodging the data bottleneck — data mesh at Starship by our Head of Data Taavi Pungas.
