 A strong responsibility






We like






Experience with programming languages (e.g. SQL and/or Python)
 Knowledge of Database architectures
 Good analytical skills
 Experience with cloud solutions
 Common with data visualization tools
 Pro-active and flexible work mentality
 Interest in trading






We offer






Training, continuous learning and development opportunities
 Competitive compensation package
 Annual performance-based bonus
 A non-hierarchical workplace
 Young and highly motivated teammates
 Ownership in your work
 A fun workplace
 Plenty of social events!

title: Data Engineer
description:
You will get the opportunity to work in beating heart of data within the Rabobank. You will work together with people who have an insatiable curiosity in technology, data, and self-development. You will heavily invest in your career. You will make memories.


 As a Data Engineer you can make a difference


 Within the Tribe Data & Analytics you will work in the centre of the data driven enterprise. The tribe contains 6 area’s:




 Global Data Platform
 Analytics Platform
 Data & Factory Services
 Data Science
 Business Intelligence
 Customer Analytics






 For about 40 squads are divided over these areas. In all areas we data engineers play an important role. We need your help to design, build and run ground breaking solutions that are as valuable to our 7 million customers.


 You will be responsible for As a Data Engineer you will your main purpose is to make sure that data can be used for operational and analytical purposes.




 Experience


 Above all we are looking for new colleagues with an insatiable curiosity in data, technology and self-development on a medior/senior level. You get excited by building and deploying big data pipelines in the cloud. In the Squad you work on Azure, where you use cloud native components and value the separation between storage and computing. Data frames are not a new concept to you and you write code in either PySpark or use Azure Data Flow for your ETL needs. Your deployments are automated and you are able to quickly prototype your solutions.



 You have a couple of years of experience in using the concepts/components in a production environment:




 As a Data Engineer within the tribe D&A it would be great if you have experience with the following technologies (if you don’t thick all of the boxes we still would love to meet you):



 Azure Data Factory
 Azure Databricks using Python/SQL
 Data modelling and SQL
 Airflow
 Azure Synapse
 API Development on Azure (preferably with python)
 Scripting either PowerShell or bash
 Azure DevOps
 Azure Data Lake Storage
 Azure Functions
 Build and deploy with Azure DevOps
 Set up data quality and monitoring
 Develop unit tests (TDD)






 The competences we would like you to have:





 Eager to learn new techniques
 Enjoy to teach and share knowledge
 Good communication skills
 Strong collaboration with other roles in the Scrum team
 Drive to continuously improve
 Take ownership of the build, run and change process
 Curiosity






 What do we offer? We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36-or 40 hour working week), you can also expect:



 Based on your experience: up to € 5437,- gross per month (scale 9) or up to €6481,- gross per month (scale 10)
 Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
 an extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
 a budget of € 750- to set up your home working space and a monthly home working allowance of up to € 40-
 a personal development budget of € 1,400-
 a combination of working from home and at the office
 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport
 A pension scheme to which you contribute 3.5%
 151.2 hours holiday per year + 1 Diversity Day per year






 This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Engineer based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.



 You and the job application process




 Reply to the vacancy for Data Engineer at Rabobank.



 Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Oscar van Dijk, IT Recruiter, oscar.van.dijk@rabobank.nl
 We will hold the interviews through a video call.
 You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
 A security check is part of the process.
 We respect your privacy.






 Growing a better world together You are already aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for millions of customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our “Growing a better world together” mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:




 A third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature & Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.
 As part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.
 Together with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.





 Interested? Please contact us.

title: Traineeship Data Engineer
description:
Uren: 32-40 uur
 Werkplek: Standplaats Utrecht, maar projecten door heel het land!
 Ervaring: Traineeship

 Heb jij passie voor werken met data en ben je klaar voor een knallende start van je carrière? Als Data Engineer trainee zet je je tanden stevig in de techniek om grote hoeveelheden data te prepareren en op te slaan. Uiteraard doe je dat niet alleen, maar werk je in een team van IT-professionals met elk zijn/haar eigen expertise. Als gemotiveerde Data Engineer draag jij bij door data te prepareren, waardoor de klant beter gebruik kan maken van zijn data. Je ontwikkelt streaming en/of batch processen om data te ontsluiten en bouwt mee aan het datalandschap en de implementatie van Cloud oplossingen (AWS). Daarnaast ben je samen met je team verantwoordelijk voor het opleveren van kwalitatief hoogwaardige oplossingen. Je ontwikkelt jezelf gedurende dit Traineeship tot een zelfstandig werkende professional, die er energie van krijgt om ‘slimme’ oplossingen te creëren en te adviseren.









Jouw job in één alinea









Natuurlijk gooien wij jou niet meteen in het diepe. Je volgt diverse trainingen om je professionele skill set uit te breiden met certificaten in bijvoorbeeld Business Intelligence tools zoals SQL, Data Modelling, Data Analytics, Data Visualisation en Business Analysis. Daarnaast trainen we je in handige consultancy vaardigheden zoals storytelling en overtuigend presenteren. Laat ons weten wat jou motiveert en waar jouw ambities liggen. Wij helpen je daar graag bij. Je krijgt bij ons namelijk alle ruimte om je eigen carrière vorm te geven en de opleidingen te volgen die daarbij passen. Ook na dit Traineeship heb je keuze uit honderden opleidingen en trainingen via het All You Can Train-programma van onze Capgemini Academy. Zo kun je jezelf verder blijven ontwikkelen tot IT-professional binnen jouw vakgebied!









Je thuisbasis bij Capgemini









Capgemini is een van de grootste IT-consultancy bedrijven in Nederland en is marktleider op het gebied van Consulting, Technology en Outsourcing. Bij ons heb je alle mogelijkheden van een groot bedrijf, maar de bescheidenheid en sfeer die je bij een klein bedrijf verwacht. We werken op basis van vertrouwen en bieden je de vrijheid om jezelf te ontwikkelen. Natuurlijk werken we hard, maar we vinden een fijne werksfeer en collegialiteit onderling ook erg belangrijk.
 Onze personeelsvereniging Escape en onze Young Professional community IDentity organiseren regelmatig verschillende toffe activiteiten. Denk aan borrels, vrijmibo en leuke teamuitjes. Genoeg te doen dus! Wat je daarnaast nog meer kunt verwachten?









Benefits










Een salaris van € 3.477,- inclusief mobiliteitsvergoeding van 750 euro & 8% vakantiegeld.
 De eerste 1,5 jaar twee keer kans op een salarisverhoging.
 Cold feet? Kennen we niet. Bij ons krijg je direct een vast contract.
 All You Can Train zonder enige verplichtingen.
 Een goed gevulde koffer met vakantiegeld én genoeg tijd (26 vakantiedagen) om het uit te geven.
 Een premievrij pensioen.
 Werk waar je maar wilt op een device naar keuze met onze connectiviteitsvergoeding.
 Je eerste levensbehoefte als professional: een snelle laptop en een simkaart die je ook privé mag gebruiken.
 Altijd lekker onderweg met je leaseauto of NS-businesscard. Of kies voor uitbetaling van je reiskostenvergoeding.










      Alles over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden 
     









Waarom past deze vacature bij jou?









Je bent een enthousiaste Young Professional die zich wil specialiseren in (technische) data-vraagstukken bij grote (internationale) organisaties. Naast sterke analytische skills en praktische vaardigheden, bezit je ook over een dosis creativiteit en ben je klantgericht. Flexibiliteit is voor jou geen issue en het lijkt je leuk om bij onze opdrachtgever op locatie aan projecten te werken.
 Daarnaast heb je:

 Een afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding in een IT-studierichting.
 Maximaal 0-2 jaar werkervaring.
 Aantoonbare ervaring met programmeren.
 Ervaring met AWS, Python en Java is een pré.
 Je hebt tijdens je opleiding gewerkt met (grote) databestanden, simulatie onderzoek en/of databases.
 Een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.












Werken bij Capgemini 




        Get the future you want. Die belofte doen wij aan jou. Dat begint al op dag één. Met een goede onboarding en gestructureerde en transparante groeipaden. Maar ook: volop mogelijkheden om daarvan af te wijken, zelf te pionieren en je eigen weg te kiezen. Daarbij kun je van onze kant rekenen op grenzeloos vertrouwen én collegiale support. Werken bij Capgemini betekent ook werken in het internationale hart van de innovatie. De eredivisie van de technologie. Een werkgever met oog voor jou en het vizier op de toekomst, waarin duurzaamheid en diversiteit en inclusie de hoofdrollen spelen.

title: Junior Big Data Engineer
Analytics Engineer
description:
Your opportunity



 With Mollie’s continued growth comes an ever-increasing need to make decisions based on data. Sitting in Mollie’s Business Intelligence & Analytics Engineering team, you will partner with stakeholders from Mollie’s Commerce and Marketing departments to understand how data can help serve their needs. From here, you will help model masses of complex, constantly evolving data into a shape that allows teams to answer questions and measure performance.
  

    With this role comes great responsibility, but don’t worry - you are not on your own. You will be working with Mollie’s wider Data Team, alongside some of the brightest Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Analysts out there. On top of this, you will have a selection of the latest and greatest tools at your disposal (BigQuery, dbt, Looker). Are you up for the challenge?
  


 What you'll be doing 

Data modelling: curate and publish robust data models to support analytical requirements around data from Salesforce, Google Analytics and Mollie products
 Data warehouse design: shape Mollie’s data warehouse architecture and evolve Mollie’s data governance framework to meet ever changing requirements
 Performance optimisation: monitor costs associated with data transformations and utilise DBT and BigQuery to optimise performance
 Data quality: define and champion best practices around data quality quality at Mollie, ensuring data models are complete with documentation and validation tests
 Data literacy: promote data literacy at Mollie through coaching other teams, presenting your work regularly and contributing to knowledge sharing sessions


 What you'll bring

 3 - 5 years experience as an Analytics Engineer, Data Scientist or Software Engineer with focus on data
 SQL mastery
 Experience with another programming language e.g. Python
 Experience working in a Cloud Environment e.g. Google Cloud or AWS
 Experience working with Github / Gitlab
 An analytical mindset with strong attention to details
 Ability to synthesise data into a clear story
 Fluency in English


 Nice to haves

 Experience with a tool like dbt or Dataform
 Experience with a BI tool (preference towards Looker)
 Experience in Fintech or online payments

title: Data Engineer
description:
Tel Aviv, Israel


 Job Type:


 Freelance








 About the Company












                 At Tectu, you can make a real impact! As a Data Engineer you will play a lead role in delivering data and business strategies, solutions and processes to support the data oriented projects. The ideal candidate is passionate about delivering cutting edge solutions to support the changing business needs and technology landscape. You will be working closely with others on our Product and Engineering teams to define and deliver these solutions.
               




 If you are data obsessed, passionate about technology, self-motivated and a disciplined freelancer, we would love to speak with you. The ideal candidate has both a willingness and desire to work in a dynamic environment, is able to apply Agile methodologies in day-to-day activities, and who enjoys working both independently with little oversight and in a team environment.
               










 About the Role












                 At Tectu, we work with various customers, providing advanced tech solutions to solve different problems and needs. As a Data Engineer at Tectu, your day will most likely vary according to which projects you’re involved in, but generally you’ll be performing the following activities:
               




                  Owning major projects from inception to production deployment, shipping at a rapid pace
                


                  Architecting, designing and developing simple, yet flexible solutions for a variety of customers
                


                  Designing and building data infrastructure such as data ingestion, pipelines, warehouses, and data lakes that are efficient architectures and capable of storing and analyzing large quantities of data
                


                  Solving challenging data integration problems, utilizing optimal ETL patterns, frameworks, query techniques, sourcing from structured and unstructured data sources.
                


                  Recommending and implementing ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, cost and quality
                


                  Participating in defining data strategy and capabilities roadmap
                


                  Contributing to team-wide efforts - code reviews, design reviews, technical decisions, and mentoring others
                










 Qualifications












 Requirements:





                  5+ years of experience in data engineering, data warehousing and data lake platforms
                


                  Strong proficiency of SQL and Python
                


                  Experience in data analytics, data modeling, ETL/ELT, data integration and orchestration (e.g. Airflow) and processing of structured and unstructured data.
                


                  Experience in a variety of big data technologies such as AWS EMR (Spark) and Athena (Presto)
                


                  Experience with DWH solutions like AWS Redshift, BigQuery, Clickhouse
                


                  Experience with latest cloud technologies of one of the biggest vendors (AWS is an advantage)
                


                  A proven track record of owning and delivering tasks and projects on time
                




 Soft Skills:





                  Strong work ethic and strong core values (honesty, integrity, creativity)
                


                  Sense of urgency, ownership mindset, and customer focus
                


                  Innovative problem solver who takes initiative never stops thinking about ways to improve
                


                  Ability to self-learn new skills and technologies
                




 Advantage:





                  BS in highly-quantitative field (Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, EE) is preferred
                


                  Experience designing data systems from scratch
                


                  Data driven mindset
                


                  Able to create and communicate the 'big picture' in a clear way.
                


                  Experience with data testing and data ops tools
                


                  Experience with writing tested code as part of development lifecycle (e.g. Unit, Integration, API)

title: Data Engineer
description:
תיאור

    For a tech company with an AI/big data solution for the retail industry we are looking for DATA engineer (located in Yokneam - Hybrid)
   


 What will you be doing?
   


 Be responsible for Data flow stages from definition to architecture, including Data acquisition, Data set acceptance criteria, Data storage technologies, Data Science integration
   

     Performing strategic analysis of data, architecture designing and customizing technological solutions for large scale data processing
   

     The Data Engineer will take responsibility to explore technologies to scale up Data ecosystem to handle rapidly big Data growth
   

     Work closely with Data science team to embed ML / AI algorithms into the product
   

     Work with cloud, data science, application, and client teams to make sure your solution is solving significant business problems in a robust, scalable manner.
   

     Design, develop, and maintain ETL/ELT from various data streams
   

     Use cutting edge data engineering technologies: Python, Airflow, Java, Kubernetes, Spark, Scala, Apache Parquet, Talend, Data lake…
   




דרישות התפקיד

    2+ years of relevant data engineering work experience in production environments (Data environments, Big Data processing, Database techniques, Data analysis or similar)
   

B.Sc / BA in Computer Science or equivalent



 Must have hands on programming experience in Python, Java (Scala – advantage)



 Must have hands on experience in SQL & databases



 Excellent English communication skills spoken and written



 Ability to learn new technologies and work in a dynamic fast paced environment



 Focused on personal development and eager to learn.



 Result-driven, pragmatic, and innovative.



 Working experience with Airflow and Spark is a big plus.



 Experience with Cloud technology is an advantage.



כישורים נדרשים

title: Data Engineer - Data Assets Group
description:
Description
 Lusha is growing rapidly, and we are searching for an experienced Data Engineer to join us!
 If you are a highly skilled software engineer experienced in solving complex algorithmic and engineering (preferably data) challenges, with a strong knowledge of a wide range of technologies and solutions as a Data Engineer and someone who thrives in a cross-functional and fast-paced environment - continue reading :)
 You will

 Design and implement Lusha’s high-scale and data-intensive platform.
 Analyze, develop and execute data integration solutions in order to manage the information lifecycle needs of our business units.
 Participate in the most significant projects in the company.
 Research and implement algorithmic solutions.

 You are

 Autodidact. You love challenges, and you are highly motivated.
 Think before you code - “Good software design and architecture come from the whiteboard and not from the keyboard.”
 Ambitious. You are eager to make an impact and lead by example. You want to grow, you thrive in a fast-moving, dynamic growth environment, and are able to operate at the strategic level and the micro-detail to get things right.
 Independent. You pick things up quickly and are able to execute independently from ideation to implementation.
 Results-driven. You have a can-do approach and drive to exceed your goals.
 Data-oriented. You like analyzing and working with data.
 Organized. You are able to manage highly interdependent, multifaceted projects and keep various work streams on track - even those with many moving parts.
 A team player. You collaborate with the team and cross-team members to achieve your goals.



 3+ years experience in designing and implementing server-side Data solutions.
 3+ Programming experience, preferably in Python and SQL.
 Experience implementing algorithmic solutions, data mining, and analytical methodologies.
 Able to use orchestration frameworks such as Airflow, Kubernetes, and Docker Swarm.
 Experience with Data Lake, Spark - Advantage.
 Familiarity with AWS ecosystem - Advantage.
 Familiarity with the following tools: Kafka, DataBricks, Jenkins - advantage.
 Experience working with various database engines (relational, document storage, key-value, time series) - ElasticSearch, Redis, Postgres, MySql.

title: Junior Data Engineer
description:
תיאור המשרה:

 חברה פיננסית מובילה מחפשת Junior Data Engineer שי/תצטרף לתחום ה Big Data בחברה. 
תפקיד מעניין ומגוון הכולל הובלה ופיתוח מקצה לקצה של תהליכי Data Pipeline,
ביצוע Design ויישום של פתרונות Machine Learning, עבודה עם אנשי Data Science ו- Data Architect, עבודה עם Python, Spark וטכנולוגיות מתקדמות נוספות.
הזדמנות מעולה לעבוד בחברה טכנולוגית המאפשרת איזון בית - עבודה!

דרישות המשרה:
שנה ניסיון בפיתוח קוד ב- Python
יכולת תכנון תהליכי פיתוח עם דגש לתחזוקה ותמיכה לטווח הרחוק
ניסיון בעבודה עם DataBases שונים כגון: MS SQL, Teradata, Hive


מס' משרה:
 119318

title: Data Engineer
description:
Who we are:
 Resident is an industry-leader in the Direct-to-Consumer (e-commerce) space. While our customers are primarily based in the US, our R&D, Product and Data teams have been operating out of Tel Aviv since our founding. Our mission is simple, we are building a best in class ecommerce platform that leverages data and technology to create a competitive advantage for our brands. Starting from the marketing acquisition funnel and continuing through each customer’s journey, our tools and technology enable us to go the extra step to deliver a world class customer experience.


 Our company is built around continuously improving our ability to introduce new customers to our products, and wow them with exceptional experiences through the shopping and post purchase journey. We love to use data and metrics to drive our decisions, while keeping in mind that customers don’t speak in numbers, and that each one should be treated as a member of our family.


 Oh, and by the way - you’ll get to work with a diverse group of experts around the globe. You can expect a hard working team of people that understands how to create meaningful connections and get great work done virtually - it’s in our nature!
 What we do:
 We shape the business decision making process by providing the business units with the data as well as the insights about the risks and potential of their initiatives. We make sure to capture the opportunities that require strong data foundations, and we invest heavily on unlocking opportunities that require advanced data modeling.
 What You’ll Be Doing:
 We are looking for a brilliant, quick-learner Data Engineer for our data engineering team - an independent logical thinker who understands the importance of data structuring for macro-business decisions.
 The position combines high technical skills with business orientation, working closely with the analysts and the R&D team, and affecting the company's cross-departments decisions directly. Our Data Engineer should have the ability to speak in technical and practical terms, and more importantly, lead from one to the other, while dealing with challenges and creating them - to make our team even better than it is.


 Roles and Responsibilities

Creating and structuring end-to-end data pipelines & ETLs: from the source all the way to the analysts hands, enabling them the ideal conditions to make smart and data driven business decisions.
Deep understanding of the business needs, technical requirements and the company’s roadmap - and translating it into data solutions and scalable products.
Writing multi-step scalable processes from more than 50 data sources - Marketing. Operations, CS, Product, CRM and more... tying them up to a valuable & useful source of insights for the analysts.
Understanding data challenges and weaknesses, and managing high standards monitoring and reliability processes.

  Requirements

B.A / B.Sc degree in a highly quantitative field - a must.
2-3 years hands on experience as a Data Engineer/BI Developer querying data warehouses (SQL), structuring data processes using quantitative techniques - a must.
Fast learner with high attention to details, and proven ability to multitask on several projects at a time. - a must.
Practical experience in Python in data context. a must.
High analytical skills and the ability to deep dive into details. a must.
Google Cloud Data tools (BigQuery, Cloud Composer, AutoML, DataFlow), Rivery, Airflow - a SUPER plus.
Experienced in analyzing data, and gaining insights - a plus.
Experience working for a data driven company on a large scale - a plus.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Gett is the place where you come to when you need to be on the move with confidence, regardless if you are a member of the general public, a business customer, a driver or a partner. We provide the best possible service our customers can get, where it matters the most. And you can make our team stronger than ever! 
Gett’s Data team is looking for a talented Senior Data Engineer to join us.
 The Senior Data Engineer will be a key member of the data team, at the core of a data-driven company, developing scalable, robust data pipelines , data models, and to provide business intelligence.
 Come and work in an evolving, challenging environment with a variety of data sources, technologies, and stakeholders, to deliver the best solutions to support the business and provide operational excellence.

 Responsibilities:

 Building the next generation of the Data Warehouse, moving from old and legacy models into move robust.
 Building new ETL pipelines and bugfix old one.
 Improve data quality and ingestion; identify root cause of data issues and provide resolution ensuring accuracy and trust in everything we build.
 Ensure that the local data needs are taken into account by the global BI team.
 Debug reports or automatic Python scripts and ensure the reporting server infrastructure is connecting correctly to our main data sources.
 Contribute to pieces of analysis to inform business decisions.

 Requirements

 Minimum 2 years of experience in software development/data engineering/business intelligence - A must.
 Strong experience in data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing - A must.
 Experience with Python - A must.
 Big data technologies (Spark, Hive, Spark, Presto, Airflow) - An advantage.
 Experience working with AWS big data technologies (S3, EC2, EKS) - An advantage.
 Knowledge in containerized environments (Docker, Kubernetes) - An advantage.
 Knowledge of infrastructure and DevOps (CI/CD, Terraform) - An advantage.

title: Data Engineer
description:
DESCRIPTION


DESCRIPTION


      The primary purpose of this role is to utilize expert-level ETL development knowledge to assist our customers to migrate and transform data from their source systems or DWH to MDClone Platform during the project implementation and post-go-live. Daily work activities will include data analysis, ETL development, data migration and transformation, configuration and troubleshooting, providing training and knowledge transfer to enable customers to utilize and manage the deployed solutions, and to aid in supporting live customers.
    


 YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:
    

 Collaborating with customers to understand their business requirements, data processes and analyze their systems’ data, in order to design the data migration and transformation processes.
 Developing all the ETL process components required to migrate data from the customers’ source databases into the MDClone big data platform.
 Loading large datasets and improving the efficiency of ETL processes.
 Performing data cleansing to provide high-quality data.
 Providing training and knowledge transfer to enable customers to utilize and manage the deployed solutions.
 Providing ongoing support for data-related issues.
 Creating data migration project schedules and tracking projects against the plan using project schedules and status reports.



 ACADEMIC AND PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:
    

 Bachelor’s degree in a relevant technical field (Information Technology, Computer Science, Software, Engineering, or related technical discipline), or equivalent combination of training and work experience.
 Excellent analytical capabilities.
 Proficiency with SQL development. Minimum two years experience.
 At least two years of experience with ETL design and development.
 Experience with Big Data technologies is an advantage.
 Experience with Java and Python is an advantage.
 Experience with healthcare project implementation is an advantage.



 PERSONAL SKILLS:
    

 Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently.
 Excellent communication and presentation skills.
 Enjoys brainstorming and has a passion for problem-solving.
 Ability to work effectively with project managers and team members to provide support as both an independent operator and team player.
 Capable of learning new technology and research independently.



 TECHNOLOGY EXPERIENCE:
    

 Big Data – Hadoop, Hive, Impala, HBase, Apache Solr
 ETL – Talend, SSIS, Informatica, DataStage
 SQL – PostgreSQL, MS SQL, Oracle, Other
 Programming Languages – Java, Python

title: Data Specialist (Student position)
description:
About The Position

Percepto is the leading provider of autonomous inspection and monitoring solutions, harnessing robotics, including our very own market-leading industrial drone-in-a-box solution. Our team is made up of software and hardware engineers, industry experts and professionals who are all passionate about innovation and driven to push the boundaries of what’s possible with software, AI, and hardware. We are a fast growing company with offices in Israel, the U.S. and Australia, with Fortune 500 clients around the world. Our company growth is not stopping any time soon, and we are looking for great talent like you to join our team!
 We are looking for a Junior Data Collection Specialist to join our computer vision and deep learning team. In this role, you will have the chance to train our product to achieve state of the art AI Algorithms.
 This is an opportunity to join a professional Machine Learning team, that gets our autonomous drone and robotics solutions to new heights!
 Why join Percepto? We care about the people we work with; we want our team members to grow and develop professionally, to find their job rewarding and intellectually stimulating, and of course - to have fun and feel that they are part of the Percepto family. Our Computer vision team develops state-of-the-art computer vision algorithms to address the various perception tasks required for our autonomous drones, such as object detection and scene perception.

Responsibilities


Analyze and Verify Data - research data sources, conduct thorough data analysis and make corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the recorded information
 Create a Digital Conversion Program, by writing scripts in Python
 Oversee data collection process, work closely with drone operators teams in the field
 Generate and present reports, covering workflow and workflow disruptions, exceptions, and analysis results.


Requirements


Student in Industrial engineer or equivalent
 Relevant experience in IDF relevant units - An advantage
 Strong analytical skills
 A self-motivated capable of working alone or in a small team to collect the best data to train our AI
 Fluent English - must

title: Software Engineer Intern - Caesarea, Israel
description:
Location: Caesarea or Tel-Aviv, Israel
 


 Start Date: Flexible - in accordance with the university schedule
 


 What You'll Do


   You'll develop Core Software technologies at the heart of tomorrow's leading infrastructure solutions, tackling the entire range of challenges from user-facing API-s, through high-level algorithms, all the way down to firmware.
 


   The Cisco silicon One team is leading the silicon development in Cisco. We use the latest silicon technologies to build largest scale and most complex devices at the edge of feasibility.
 

   If you want to work with amazing people, developing the first iteration of world-class products, join us!
 


 Who You'll Work With


   You'll be part of the Cisco Silicon One team - an amazing group driving Cisco game changing next generation network devices - Cisco Silicon One™. Our unique team works in a startup atmosphere inside a stable and leading corporate environment on the outside.
 

   We are transforming the industry and building a new internet for the 5G era, providing a unified, programmable silicon architecture that is the foundation of all Cisco's future routing products.
 

   Our design center is unique - hosting all silicon HW and SW development disciplines inside one site.
 

   Our devices are designed to be universally adaptable across service providers and web-scale markets, designed for fixed and modular platforms. Our devices deliver high speed without sacrificing programmability, buffering, power efficiency, scale or feature flexibility.
 

   Cisco Silicon One™ is a revolutionary, ground-breaking technology for our customers and end users for decades to come! The Internet now has a new faster, better, safer engine!
 


 Learn more about us right here:


   Silicon One Article
 

   Cisco Silicon One movie
 

   Cisco CEO talks to Fortune about 5G Chips
 

   Israeli Calcalist on Leaba Cisco acquisition (in Hebrew)
 

   Cisco Bets Its Business on 'Internet for the Future' Strategy
 


 What are we looking for?



 Brilliant ambitious and motivated individual, regardless of previous experience.
 Team players who enjoy big challenges
 Students of Computer Science with GPA above 88 from leading Israeli Universities, graduating in 2023-24
 People who can quickly ramp on multiple, interdisciplinary domains.



 Why Cisco



   We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to shape the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unique personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns.
 

   We are thought leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.
 

   #WeAreCisco
 



Message to applicants applying to work in the U.S.:  When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire salaries in U.S. locations. For non-sales roles, the hiring ranges reflect base salary and do not include bonuses, equity, or benefits. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive target, and do not include equity or benefits. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.

title: Data Scientist - Casablanca
description:
About the role 

Au sein de l'équipe, vous serez plus particulièrement chargé.e de proposer, évaluer, qualifier, et déployer des solutions à mettre en œuvre pour répondre aux problèmes d'apprentissage (maintenance prédictive, optimisation réseau, détection d’anomalies, recherche de cause racine, monitoring, …) à partir de données issues des réseaux fixes ou mobiles.
 En réponse aux besoins exprimés par les directions métier :


 Vous vous interfacez avec le client pour comprendre le besoin opérationnel et le traduire en problématique de machine learning
Vous concevez et mettez en place des algorithmes d'IA en utilisant les modes d'apprentissage les plus appropriés en fonction des besoins métiers
Vous réalisez l'évaluation de performance des algorithmes et des solutions proposées
Vous collaborez avec nos data engineers pour construire des flux de données qui passent à l’échelle et déployer vos modèles en production
Vous assurez l'accompagnement des entités opérationnelles sur l'adaptation et l'usage des applications ainsi développées.





About you 

Diplômé.e d'une école d'ingénieur ou diplôme équivalent de niveau master 2 avec une spécialisation dans une discipline scientifique (data-science idéalement, mathématiques, informatique ou statistiques), vous disposez d’au moins une expérience significative sur des projets en data science dans un cadre opérationnel et avez développé les compétences suivantes :


 Bonne connaissance des algorithmes de Machine Learning, et de leur utilisation pour résoudre des problèmes concrets. Vous savez quel modèle de Machine Learning choisir pour quel type de problème au-delà d’une utilisation « black-box », et êtes capable d’en évaluer les performances de façon adéquate.
Connaissances opérationnelles des techniques classiques en statistiques, analyse de données et mathématiques appliquées
Bon niveau en développement dans au moins un langage de programmation orienté Data Sciences (Python de préférence, Scala, etc…) et en gestionnaire de configuration (Git de préférence)
Capacité à manipuler de gros volumes de données dans un environnement opérationnel
Expérience en déploiement de modèles de machine learning
Vous maintenez une activité de veille en data science pour suivre les derniers développements
Sens de la communication (écrit-oral) en français et en anglais.
Capacité à adapter son discours à des interlocuteurs différents (vulgarisation) et à dialoguer avec le « client », comprendre son besoin et résoudre des problématiques concrètes et complexes.
Des connaissances en Cloud (Google Cloud Platform de préférence) sont un plus





Department 

Vous êtes à la recherche d’une nouvelle opportunité de carrière ? C’est le moment opportun de postuler et rejoindre Sofrecom ! Saisissez l’opportunité de transformer cette période difficile en une opportunité de vous réinventer !
 Chez Sofrecom, nous continuons à recevoir vos candidatures et à vous proposer nos meilleures opportunités de carrière. Avec les conditions sanitaires actuelles, nous avons opté pour le télétravail pour préserver la santé et la sécurité de nos collaborateurs. Vos échanges avec nos équipes de recrutement se feront à distance.
 Filiale du Groupe Orange et spécialiste du secteur des télécommunications, Sofrecom est un acteur unique dans le monde du conseil et de l’ingénierie. Sofrecom analyse et anticipe les tendances du secteur, conseille, accompagne et pilote le développement et les transformations de nos clients.
 Sofrecom est surtout une entreprise riche de sa diversité avec plus de 2000 consultants et experts issus de plus de 30 nationalités et répartis à travers ses 11 implantations dans le monde.
 Chez Sofrecom, nous sommes convaincus que la diversité est un facteur de richesse et de performance. Nous veillons donc à ce que notre processus de recrutement garantisse l’égalité des chances et à ce que l’ensemble des candidats bénéficient d’une égalité de traitement.
 Sofrecom déploie dans l’ensemble des implantations la même culture d’entreprise fondée sur l’audace, l’agilité et la même envie de bien servir ses clients.
 Toute donnée à caractère personnel que vous partagez avec Sofrecom Services Maroc est traitée conformément aux dispositions de la loi n° 09-08, relative à la protection des données à caractère personnel.
 Afin d’exercer vos droits d’accès, de rectification ou d’oppositions, merci de contacter la DRH sur le 05 37 27 99 00. Ensemble, nous contribuons au développement du numérique dans le monde !

title: QA Engineer (Web)
description:
Location
   

    Lviv or remote
   



    Department
   

    Quality Assurance Department
   



Required Skills

2+ years of commercial experience as a QA engineer
Relevant knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes
Clear, concise and comprehensive bug reports and test cases
Using different Test Design Techniques
Experience in Web testing
Experience in API testing
Delivery of high-quality tested features/bugs
QA processes optimization and improvement
Constant development of professional skills in Quality Assurance domain.



Key Responsibilities

Reviews requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide testing and feedback
Creates test plans and test cases
Designs, develops and executes test cases
Identifies, records, documents, and track bugs
Checks fixes and closes bugs; completes the quality testing cycle
Perform through regression testing when bugs are resolved
Communicate with Dev Team, Data Team, OPS Team
Attend all required meeting due to SCRUM process. Take active part in grooming and planning sessions
Demo features on Sprint review meetings



We Offer
You’re going to enjoy working with us because of:
 — Interesting and challenging Aviation domain — Work with great and friendly international Team of professionals — Decent remuneration — Cosy shared co-working space with coffee, cookies and lunches — Assistance in learning opportunities — Time off throughout the year (paid and unpaid) — Support and arranging well-being programs
 Join the RocketRoute team and you’ll work with smart, interesting people to solve the biggest challenges in flight planning and aviation systems.


How to Apply
If you share our passion for Aviation please send your CVs in English with the salary expectations indicated to recruitment@rocketroute.com.
 Please be aware that by sharing your profile or CV with us all the personal data included in your CV/profile becomes available to RocketRoute for processing. To monitor and manage your personal data under General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) please contact recruitment@rocketroute.com. All the requests are processed within 72 hours.
 We appreciate if you include the following statement your application/CV: “I hereby give consent for my personal data included in the resume to be processed for the purposes of recruitment under the General Data Protection Regulation”.

title: Data Engineer
description:
A short overview of the company: 
Our client's main focus is to provide technical solutions for the travel industry.They operate across all travel verticals; airlines, ground and sea transportation, and provide solutions for distribution, commercial and operational systems, as well as Wi-Fi, connectivity and in-flight entertainment. The company operates in a B2B2C environment, delivering value to its customers through a building block model. They combine their modular technology into tailored solutions, enabling them to more quickly address opportunities and meet customer needs.
They combine this with a keen commercial focus and strong industry domain knowledge. They understand that their customers are the travelers, which helps them play an advisory role as well as provide great technology. They create value by working together with their customers in true partnerships, co-locating teams and sharing business benefits and risks.
The ﻿﻿Profile we are looking for: 
The ideal Backend Developer is self-motivated, has a hands-on attitude to work, loves coding, is passionate about their work and their teams work and wants to continuously progress their skill set. They must be comfortable working in a virtual work environment with resources spread across the globe who predominantly work from home. One day is usually not exactly the same as the next, so being flexible and nimble will be a huge benefit. If you recognise yourself in the description above, we are convinced youll love being part of this team.
Duties and responsibilities: 

Build and scale high-performance backend systems, primarily using Python programming language and ecosystem
Troubleshoot issues in and improve functionality of existing systems
Integrate user-facing elements developed by mobile and web teams. Work with 3rd party data sources and APIs (systems integration)
Embed security and data protection
Actively collaborate with a cross-functional team working with product owners, UI/UX designers, backend developers, app developers and QA at various stages of the development process.
Develop appropriate tests to support code and ensure test automation and code quality and security
Conduct unit testing on your code and conduct code reviews.
Based on the project needs and end goals, proactively suggest improvements to architecture and technologies for maximising development efficiency
Mentor and coach other backend developers within the team
You will also be expected to keep your skills up to date by following advancements in the field and researching new and innovative technologies and techniques.

Team structure and job organization:  Cros functional/interdisciplinary team with Scrum Master, Product Owner, Developers, QA, UI/UX specialist (if needed)
IT Stack:  Python, Open APIs, Jason rest, React, TypeScript, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS, Ansible, Selenium, CI/CD, Gitlab, Microservices,
The methodology by which work is organized: Agile, Scrum, KANBAN, Waterfall﻿﻿
﻿﻿Requirements﻿: 

Minimum 5 years of software development experience, at least 3 of which are hands-on Python coding
Solid knowledge of Python web frameworks (Flask, Django, FastAPI or such)
In-depth knowledge of modern software design patterns
Ability to design elegant and efficient JSON REST APIs for given use cases (using OpenAPI standard and toolchain)
Good understanding of (and significant experience in) concurrent and parallel computing, asynchronicity, distributed computing patterns and principles
Solid knowledge of common algorithms, data structures, OOP (patterns and specific python implementations)
Understanding of CI/CD development practice and tools, experience writing Integration and Unit tests in Python.
Combination of good coding skills, end-to-end thinking and problem-solving approach, and track record of standalone delivering bigger chunks of work
Good knowledge of Agile principles and experience with some popular issue tracking tool (for example Jira)
Ability to communicate effectively to a variety of audiences including both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
English fluent (C1) ﻿

Benefits ﻿and conditions: 

﻿﻿Competitve Salary
Competitive Benefits
Learning and development support
Welcoming and friendly culture
40 h/week hybrid (2/3 days on-site and 2/3 days home office) ﻿

Send your cv via the link: https://www.careers-page.com/ibc/job/L639WW8R
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:

software development: 5 years (Required)

title: BI Data Engineer
description:
Sinergidea è un’azienda italiana specializzata nel settore IT/ICT, inoltre ha competenza ed esperienza di lavoro acquisite in molteplici settori del mercato, come Banking, Finance, Industry, Automotive, Utilities, Energy. Ci distinguiamo sul mercato per le nostre soluzioni IT in area Digital Payments e in particolar modo per i nostri servizi di consulenza. Grazie alle nostre sedi a Milano e a Novara sappiamo offrire i nostri servizi sull’intero territorio nazionale.
 In questo momento stiamo cercando con urgenza un Data Engineer da coinvolgere sui progetti in area di business intelligence destinati al settore bancario. La persona individuata verrà coinvolta il prima possibile nel gruppo di lavoro già operante sulle attività, e si coordinerà secondo un approccio Agile. La posizione comporta l’utilizzo di alcune delle tecnologie maggiormente utilizzate per l’identificazione, estrapolazione e raccolta dei dati.
 Per questa opportunità è previsto un impegno a tempo pieno e prevalentemente da remoto; per policy dell’azienda viene richiesta la presenza una volta a settimana presso la sede di riferimento a Milano oppure a Torino.
 Le principali tecnologie che verranno utilizzate sono:

MongoDB
MySQL
SSAS
Erwin
Alteryx
Datastage

Start: Immediato. Luogo di lavoro: da remoto e una volta a settimana in sede (MI o TO)
 Gli interessati sono pregati di allegare il Curriculum Vitae dettagliato in formato Word in lingua italiana o inglese in ottemperanza alla legge sulla privacy. La ricerca è rivolta a tutte le persone, nel rispetto delle pari opportunità. Crediamo e supportiamo la diversità tra i/le nostri dipendenti e collaboratori/trici. Tutte le candidature verranno prese in considerazione e verranno valutate in base ai meriti della persona, a prescindere dal colore, razza, nazionalità, etnia, sesso, genere, orientamento sessuale, stato civile, disabilità, responsabilità genitoriale, seniority anagrafica, religione e credo. In conformità al GDPR, i dati personali verranno trattati esclusivamente ai fini dell’eventuale futura instaurazione di un rapporto di lavoro con la Società e per un tempo non superiore ad un anno solare dall’invio del curriculum, salvo futuro aggiornamento dello stesso comunicato dal/dalla Candidato/a. _________________________________________________________________
 Sinergidea eroga su tutto il territorio nazionale le seguenti tipologie di servizi:

Consulenza attraverso la selezione e fornitura di figure professionali qualificate da inserire presso un team di lavoro oppure creazione integrale del team, formandolo e fornendo la metodologia e il supporto adeguati all’espletamento del task.
Sviluppi software ad hoc.
Engineering e Re-Engineering di BPO

Per informazioni, www.sinergidea.it
